Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: jmasci
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here this past week,with business just outside of Toronto. These accomodations are excellent and perfectly suited for the business traveler. The single king bed room was spacious and immaculately clean. It offered ample space for working and both comfort and quiet for sleep. I also ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning and the food was quite good (try the egg white frittata if you are diet conscious). My only reservation about providing an excellent rating is price. While the room charge was quite reasonable, the costs for breakfast ($28), valet parking ($40) and internet access ($13) were all unreasonably high. Such a pity!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Jean_alberta_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton when I attended an academic conference in Toronto. I was very tired when I arrived so I didn't ask to change rooms. But for over $200/night my roommate and I got a small, noisy room on a lower floor with no fridge, no internet access, paper cups for coffee, and very basic toiletries that were not replaced as we used them. This hotel was not up to the standard that I'm used to. On the positive side, the staff were very pleasant and helpful, which counts for a lot, but it still does not make up for an altogether uncomfortable experience at very high cost.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: GwenKitchener
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, on the tail end of our March Break trip to Toronto. From the second I walked in to this hotel, I was treated very well. It started with the front desk employee who gave me my key; she greated me with a beautiful warm smile and provided me with various information about the hotel and the surroundings. I was checked in within 3 minutes. When we got up to our room, it was spacious. The beds were double beds, which I am not used to seeing anymore; most hotels have queen size beds, which I prefer, especially when travelling with my family. But the beds were comfortable. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was top notch. About 15 minutes in to our stay at the hotel, we received a knock on the door; I was sure it was someone coming to tell us to get our kids to be quiet. I even said that to them as I opened the door, instead I was greeted by house keeping. She must have been cleaning another room not too far away and heard the kids; she was so friendly and said she wasn't here to complain about the kids, she smiled and gave us a complimentary card for a free movie for the children. I thought that was so sweet of her, she didn't have to do that. The service at this hotel, is excellent. Everyone is very friendly. The room itself again, was clean and spacious. There wasn't much of a view, but that is to be expected as the hotel is in the heart of Toronto. Parking was located directly underneath the hotel at a reasonable rate, considering we were in Toronto. The one thing the hotel room didn't have was a fridge, so if you need one, don't forget to ask when you are booking. Overall, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “VERY Businesslike!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha14057
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December to attend a concert by Alex Cuba. We picked the hotel because of its proximity to our rendezvous location where a bus hired by the band transported us to the concert. It is obvious that this property is geared towards business travelers. The colors are dark and the decor modern. I LOVED the elevator with the glass walls, allowing us to view the city as we ascended to our room. Our room was on one of the top floors and was spacious and clean. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and the thermostat actually kept the room at the temperature we required. We had a quick snack in our room before the concert which was DELICIOUS and promptly served. Breakfast the next morning was a delight. Our server was pleasant and efficient. She even let me have 2 small jars of jelly to take to my nephews as gifts. All the staff that we encountered were friendly and professional. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those who need to stay downtown, but I prefer the Hilton's waterfront location during the summer for the variety of activities that can be found there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Stacie B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and close to everything! The staff was really nice and the rooms were also comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paull25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was very impressed.... Great staff, great spacious rooms, great views and a great location. The Exec Lounge served a great breakfast and evening canopes and the staff in here were very friendly.... Our room had great views over the city and was cleaned to the highest standards.... It was also nicely decorated and very spacious. As visitors to Toronto the location was great with a subway station nearby and lots of nice bars and resturants within walking distance. A fantastic hotel, which i wouldnt hesitate to book again if in the Toronto area!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pleasant atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: pajoreview
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location,easy to navigate and has a nice atmosphere and that was generated by the staff whom we came into contact with.It started with the front desk, easy friendly checkin with information regarding hotel and gym and pool.We were given a $25 coupon to use towards a dinner in one of two restaurants.The room was a good size and overlooked the outdoor pool.My husband and I did a check of the room before unpacking and it was very clean.We always do this.We took advantage of the $25 dinner coupon in the Tundra restaurant.Our waiter was Christian and he was excellent,We had a very nice dinner. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service, Spacious rooms but ...”
Reviews.Author: Dbarashi
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel. The staff is great, the room are modern and spacious, views are amazing and no question about the location. I am a gold member and got a free upgrade to executive lounge which I always appreciate. However during the 5-7 happy hours , after grabbing a drink I was ask to fill a slip and pay for my drink. This never happened to me in any other Hilton around the world or any other executive club around the world. I asked to talk with manager and was told that in Canada these are the rules. it is ok but because Canada is an exception I expected the hotel to put a sign or inform the guests. I noticed few other guests were surprised after they already had several drinks.. Hilton Canada you guys need to fix it! I still recommend the hotel but if you are an international traveler please be aware of the club...

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: GREENQUEEN08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one evening in a double room. The bed is incredibly comfortable, there are many stations to entertain you on television. The location of the hotel is perfect as many attractions, restaurants and so on are a short walking distance. The bathrooms are very clean and the hotel staff are incredibly friendly! I would stay there again in a heart beat! Prices per night are not overly expensive and fair for the comfort and luxury of this Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Singlr night for the Opera”
Reviews.Author: Tango9R
Reviews.Content: Booked here for one night based on convenience for the Canadian Opera Company. A competitor was virtually as close (Sheraton) but rates here were slightly better. In general, very good. The common areas were all very clean, as was the room. I was given an option on line, and purchased, for an upgrade at a reduced price if available on check-in. My recollection was that this would be offered, verbally, on check-in prior to actually happening. It didnâ€™t: we were given an Executive Room and charged the (reduced) upgrade cost. Overall, this was ok and I didnâ€™t comment once I saw the bill, but is probably only worth the additional $40 based upon the general cost of things in downtown Toronto. For this, we were given free Wi-fi (un-used), access to the Executive Lounge and, of course, our room upgrade. The Lounge served free non-alcoholic beverages, hors dâ€™ouvres and alcohol (priced cheaper than the bar, but self-serve). It was only open until 10 p.m. so was useless to us after the Opera. The hors dâ€™ouvres were nothing special being spring rolls and gnocchi pomodoro. Its Continental Breakfast purported to be an upgraded version of the standard included fare. While ok, it wasnâ€™t worth $20 each. Having said all of this, the combination of larger room, free non-alcoholic beverages and, at least a â€˜snackâ€™ I would likely take the option again for such another special occasion. You can choose considering what you get. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. Toronto is a very busy city, virtually 24/7. The hotel is reasonably sound-proofed in so far as while we could hear sirens regularly while awake, they were muffled enough that they did not keep us awake. Furthermore the three rooms down our hall occupied by a birthday party for an 11 year old girl, did not keep us up either. We were on the 22nd floor which may have been a factor for the sirens, but clearly not for the 11 year old pterodactyls... We ate in the hotelâ€™s restaurant: Tundra. Quite nice and reviewed separately.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cool t
Reviews.Content: Amazing downtown hotel. It is very clean and has a very nice modern look to it. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are pretty big and clean! Loved the location, it is right in the middle of toronto and you have access to the clubs, bars, restaurants. all in a walking distance!!

Reviews.Title: “Always my first choice”
Reviews.Author: redwoodyonge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Toronto many times and always leave satisfied. The rooms are spacious. Several years ago bathrooms were upgraded to remove the bath tubs and replace them with large, walk in shower cabinets. Now, we compare all hotel bathrooms to Hilton Toronto standard. Reception staff are always courteous and helpful. Concierge staff have arranged car hire for us too. Best of all, book a room and breakfast package. The Hilton buffet breakfast is superior with a wide range of hot and cold food, fresh fruit, bread and cereals. There can be no better way to get a day in Toronto started.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JandK786
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at this hotel in December 2011. I've very familiar with this hotel, as I used to travel to Toronto often for work and I always stayed at the Hilton downtown. In terms of location, it doesn't get much better than this (to be fair, Sheraton Centre is across the street), but much better location than Westin Harbour Front on Lakeshore. You're a very short-walk away from Eaton Centre, Toronto City Hall, Union Station, CN Tower, etc. Every major point of interest in downtown Toronto is within walking distance; for sites which are a bit further (e.g. ROM), subway stop is 1 block away on University Street. Good restaurants are also very close (one of the best greek restaurants is less than 1 block away). The hotel is very nice, rooms are VERY big (much bigger than typical hotel room), modern and comfortable. Lobby is very nice, with a good hotel restaurant on the ground floor (perfect for late night munchies), and the basement has Ruth's Chris steakhouse, which is excellent if you're willing to pay. The hotel also has panoramic elevators on University street which is a nice touch. If you're a HHonors gold or platinum member, you will enjoy the lounge on the 30th floor, which is very nicely equipped with a nice view. The staff at the hotel were also very courteous and helpful (the concierge was great!). I have stayed at many hotels in downtown TO (Sheraton, Westin, Hilton and Marriott Eaton Centre), and the Hilton is by far my favourite. I recommend it highly for those travelling on business, or for those who want to explore downtown TO over a weekend, Hilton is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Long Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: meliberk
Reviews.Content: Had a positive stay at this hotel. I took the Airport Express bus in around 10:00PM that is meant to make it's drop off at the Sheraton (which is about one block away). The driver was nice enough to drop me right at the Hilton which was great. Check in was very smooth and easy. The room was clean, and well furnished, Nice big bed, chair/lamp area and desk with outlets. I am not a fan of hotels that charge for Wi-Fi, so that was a disappointment. They do offer free computer stations in the lobby, so I was able to print out boarding pass, check e-mails, etc. No particular view from my 15th floor room, but the glass elevators on the outdoor side were fun. I didn't think to ride one up the the top floors to see what the view was from there! I don't like maids to come into my room during my stay and I appreciated how respectful this hotel was of that. No non-stop calls or messages at the end of the day to see if I wanted service. If one of the housekeepers saw me come out of my room they would always ask if I needed anything, so they were lovely and attentive in that way. The front desk was always helpful if I had questions. They didn't seem to know where at the Sheraton the airport bus did their pick ups back to the airport. I know it is not their property, but sice it is a shared pick-up spot between the two hotels, I would think they would know how to direct their clients. Location was great for me. I walk everywhere and was able to get to all of the areas I wanted to see, Old Town, Cabbage Town, Theater District, Yorkville. If you aren't up for the kind of walking I did, there is a subway stop right up the block. All in all, a great stay and I would reccommend for personal or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good city business hotel”
Reviews.Author: acculligan
Reviews.Content: I spend about a week a month in Toronto and I'm gutted I haven't stayed here before. It's a nice warm hotel. Unlike it's resort style sisters, it's got a quiet, confident feel and although some refurb is required feels solid and well placed. The rooms are spacious albeit a little dated. However, the ability to have a large desk, chair and additional space in the room wins over. Plush robe and great amenities are also a nice plus. The gym and pool are good and the executive lounge has wonderful views - although the breakfast in the lounge and the canapes are rather limited. The service is impeccable and the staff were determined that I had a great time and even a couple of dramas were quickly addressed and dealt with to ensure my stay was optimum. AS a business traveler I highly recommend this hotel as it's location, style and amenities (although the internet is a little slow) are suitable for functional stays.

Reviews.Title: “HHonors Gold members - unwelcomed here”
Reviews.Author: HighTechTraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Toronto Hilton with several colleuges. When I previously stayed at the Toronto Hilton, as a Gold HHONORS member I would get access to their executive lounge and in general had a good experience. Well, turns out they've changed their benefits for the worst. When I checked in I was informed that as an Gold HHONORS I no longer are entitled to access to the lounge. In addition, it seems the breakfast that is offered to me as a replacement was a pastry and coffee from a "TO GO" counter of the restaurant. When I checked out I placed my room card in the "did not meet expectations" box. I was contacted a day later by one of the managers - a Mr. Monan who asked me for the reason for my dissatisfaction. I wrote in to explain and Mr. Monan's answer was basically "We don't really value our Gold members". It seems this Hilton property no longer values HHONORS Gold members and makes it clear both by failing to provide good service and by failing a second time in addressing these complaints. I will not stay in this hotel again and I urge all HHONORS Gold members to find another property who values their business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaqibQ
Reviews.Content: I liked 1) excellent personal service of staff - they wanted to be helpful and maintained a very positive mental attitude 2) breakfast buffet was very good 3) location is excellent I didn't like 1) my room feeling a little run-down but I don't want to make such a big deal about it because it wasn't antique 2) pillows - way too soft for me, but maybe I should have corrected that by asking for firmer pillows

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice”
Reviews.Author: RJALSA
Reviews.Content: This is my hotel of choice in downtown Toronto. It is conveniently located, friendly staff, clean, and beds are excellent. Nice panoramic view glass elevators. I usually go for an executive room booking. Access to the lounge is worth it for a "continental plus" breakfast and for meeting in the evening. There is a boardroom in the lounge that can be booked. It is very useful for meeting as a group unless you require privacy. Mary who works at the lounge is a lovely hostess who has a remarkable memory for people and names. She makes you feel that it is a home away from home. I try to stay on floor 31 because there is a stairwell connecting to the 32nd floor lounge but at the moment, this floor is slated for renovation and so is a standard room floor. Avoid the "02" rooms as they sit on the elevator banks and while one side is turned off at certain hours, they go fairly late and start fairly early.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aventura28
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night but it was a very pleasant hotel. Good location, just slightly outside of the financial district, so convenient to just about everything downtown. Subway station just a block away and the hotel is on the Path which makes it easy to get to restaurants and shopping without going outside. We had a corner king suite on a high floor, so the view was quite nice, although we were facing north. I'm sure the south view would have been even nicer. The room itself is quite large with a sofa and chair, big screen swivel TV, and a big work desk. The bathroom, although nice enough, is showing wear with paint peeling etc. King bed very comfortable. Difficult to find electrical plugs. Very strange there was no minibar in room, just an empty space where a fridge should go. Bar in the lobby was very crowded in the evening, with inattentive service. Hotel restaurant was empty during peak dinner time (we could see into the restaurant from the bar), and was also not very busy for breakfast in the morning. Buffet food was passable. Concierge was very helpful. Front desk staff okay too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Pohjanmaan_Patu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in excellent place, just example 1,5.km to CN tower and Hockey Hall of Fame. Hotel is under renevation so rooms where I did stay was renevated just a while go. View from floor 22 was awesome to Toronto downtown. Only negative thing about this hotel was very poor breakfest buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DMF3758
Reviews.Content: I'm not a great fan of the Hilton chain, but I really enjoyed my stay here. Mainly I think because I had a very nice junior suite with good views, a huge bed and a living area. The room was bright, clean and spacious. I paid just CAD 165 per night which seemed a great rate. The hotel is tatsetfully decorated and designed and avoids the institutional feel of many chain hotels in north America. The staff were very helpful. I had a problem with the hot water in my room which was quickly sorted out, although the bathroom fittings could do with updating. I was also a bit surprised to have no minibar in the room. The buffet breakfast (CAD26) is very good and comprehensive.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Everything”
Reviews.Author: yelsel71
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at this location and its great. We like to walk outdoors and its pretty close to all of Toronto's major attractions. Last year we walked the PATH to the Rogers Centre and its a great way to stay out of the cold, and its pretty easy to follow. We usually are in Toronto for one reason or another so don't spend a lot of time at the hotel or in the room. Both times we had a 2 double room and its clean and comfy, has a nice bathroom and a coffee maker, last year I had requested a small fridge and they game me one. The pool is half in and half outdoor, I haven't been in it but the kids loved it. Note the parking on their website its a weekday rate and its cheaper on the weekends and its right at the hotel underground. We did order a roomservice pizza and it was good but expensive....I guess thats to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business and travellers”
Reviews.Author: odot
Reviews.Content: This essentially business hotel (one block from City Hall and the Law Society) is also great for travelers (three blocks from the Eaton Centre, a 10 minute walk to the Royal York and airport shuttle buses, and the Four Seasons performing arts centre is right across the street). The hotel is handy to the PATH so getting around downtown TO in the winter is no problem. The rooms are very smart. The beds and bedding incredibly comfortable. (We had a room high up and slept very well.) The lobby is very attractive, with good use of light and sound. A fitness centre is available, and the pool is such a treat: it is heated and extends outdoors. (What a great delight to float on one's back in the warm waters and catch snowflakes! The people passing by in parkas just stopped and stared.) The Tundra Restaurant serves excellent meals, including a very nice breakfast buffet. Cleaning staff were efficient, quiet, and very pleasant. Front desk staff were thorough and efficient. (On a previous stay, they were not, so something has changed for the better.) The only thing to note is that the bathroom in our suite was showing definite signs of age and will very soon be in need of a complete overhaul and upgrade. It was definitely not up to Hilton standards. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MRDYYZ
Reviews.Content: Overall probably one of the best in the Hilton chain that we have stayed in. Very nice lobby (not that that ever matters. Why do hotels pour so much money into their lobbies instead of the rooms !? anyway..) Great room, 17th floor. Awesome view up University Ave. towards Queens Park. Very quiet, given the location. Fit and finish in the room was good and cleanliness was about a 9 out of 10. Given Toronto room rates in general, also priced well for what you received. The parking is extra and you enter it down a ramp from the small entry circle by the taxis. Easy to get into/out of and included in/out privileges (I believe).

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Piza99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Scenic elevator is fun and the location is convenient for center city sights. Negatives: Housekeeping on our floor was not very good. Dust all over the tv and dresser. They were not around in the morning and then vacuuming at 9 PM. Our room was not tidied or cleaned very thoroughly on day 2. Room temperature was uncomfortable. The thermostat would not go lower than 60 and we were boiling. Front light was flickering and buzzing too. Steer clear of the bar - it's $10 for a glass of domestic beer. To the hotel's credit, the manager did acknowledge our dissatisfaction and his attitude and willingness to work on a solution was appreciated. So definitely speak up to the manager if you are unhappy. Don't both with the regular staff - they are not truthful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except third wheel maitenance man”
Reviews.Author: miss-ballerina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my birthday in oct boyfriend thought it would be a nice idea to go all out room was quite pricey and don't get me wrong very beautiful however there were just a few things that kinda grinded my gears, first we has a room with a jacuzzi in it very romantic? Think again the jacuzzi started making a weird sound as soon as we turned it on, so we called front desk in about an hour they sent maintenance up if you don't think very weird sound coming from the jacuzzi puts a damper on things the maitenance man in our room for almost an hour did but whatever didnt want to let that ruin our night because we were paying out the but for the beautiful room. So we ordered room service, quite pricey but very worth it food was absolutely delish!!!!! The problem with the room service we were told to put our tray outside of the door and it would be picked up some time before 11, no such luck we placed our tray outside our door at 9 20 I believe and when we checked out the next day our tray was STILL there looked and smelt quite gross. However the room was beautiful and the beds were amazingly comfortable best sleep I ever got.

Reviews.Title: “Style, Convenience, and Value”
Reviews.Author: DnA4Ever
Reviews.Content: ...And, if you are in the right room, a great view of the CN Tower. I have made a Black and White to put in my foyer of the skyline, including the CN Tower, that I took from my room window. Let me not forget the wonderful staff, cleanliness, and helpful concierge. Nice little bar downstairs. Easy walk to many interesting sites, and convenient transportation to others. All in all, a wonderful hotel and a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: gaspegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with weekend of the Santa Claus Parade. Top marks for clean rooms, location, hotel design and security. There was a security guard checking that all guests going to the elevators had room keys - that made us feel extra safe! I am not sure if this is done every evening. Only drawback was that the pool was under renovations. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter16
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for 5 nights over the holiday break and got a great deal. The hotel wasn't very busy but we were treated very nicely and got a free upgrade to the Executive level. The room size was good for two adults with two beds. We were able to get free wifi through our iPhones from an AT&T hot spot (great bonus!). The hotel was clean and looked like it was recently upgraded. The bathroom was stocked with Peter Thomas Roth products and had a waterfall shower head (my fave!). The gym was very nice and had all of the amenities you'd expect and more. We also got some free bottled water and fresh baked cookies on Christmas which was a nice personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: HouseOfHearts
Reviews.Content: We arrived 3 hours before check-in after a 6 hour drive and they got us in a room right away. The front desk staff where well spoken, knowledgable and friendly. The location of the hotel was perfect to explore downtown and for any sports lovers as the Air Canada Centre is a 5 to 10 minute walk. We where there for a Raptors game! We parked our car below the hotel for our whole stay at a cost of only $24 (we thought it would be closer to $40 so it was a pleasant surprise) Take note they do charge for local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Solid; nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: MichiganKansan
Reviews.Content: Went there for a Maple Leafs game and was able to use as good base for exploring. Nice Hilton, but typical Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people help the cause !”
Reviews.Author: Carl H
Reviews.Content: Biggest comment to this hotel is to hire only well mannered people who can handle situations with people. Bad attitudes at the front desk by a few spoil the remembrance. However that being said, the rooms on the Executive Level are nice, large with big windows. The Exec. Lounge is comfy but not elegant and the food is decent. Hotel is situated in a perfect spot in downtown TO and is an easy outside - or inside walk to Eaton Center, connected to many shops in the 'underground city' which are well worth exploring. In poor weather, forget your coat and just walk underground past hundreds of shops to Union Station, the CN Tower and the Entertainment DIstrict (Roy Thompson Hall, the Royal Alex Theatre, etc.). Hotel needs to inform people better before booking. Internet not working and the pool was closed a week before it was suppose to be. BUT one of the better buys downtown TO

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention...”
Reviews.Author: itrvl4work
Reviews.Content: Checked in, front desk was friendly. Curbside service was not up to par with other hotels I've stayed with in Toronto. No offer for assistance with bags, no 'welcome to the Hilton' greeting. Went up to my room, room was clean, nice design. Went into the bathroom, noticed that the ceiling showed signs of leaks, paint was peeling, looked horrible! I was tired and couldn't be bothered with calling the desk and asking for a new room. Later I called the desk to ask questions about Internet, wake up call etc. Not friendly on the other end. Westin Harbour Castle has much better service, I only wish it was closer to my office downtown. Location of the Hilton is good. Will be going to the Rizh next visit as our company rates are comparable to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “It's just too bad”
Reviews.Author: Debbie P
Reviews.Content: You would think that since the Hilton has always had a good reputation our stay would be pleasant, but it wasn't. This is a downtown Toronto hotel which is suppose to be competing with all the other fine establishments in the area but let me tell you it was not in the running at all!! We were there on Dec 10/11. OK, we were warned ahead the pool was not available and either was the Barrister's Executive Lounge (which would have been great to relax). However when we entered our room to store our items that had to be chilled, we discovered there was no fridge. I guess that's why they gave us 2 complimentary water bottles. Then I went on a tour to find the pop machine was no where to be found. I had to phone down to the desk to find out there wasn't one on my floor but there was one on the floor above and below. When I tried to use both machines they were out of commission. They sent up two complimentary cans of pop (I felt obligated to tip the porter). No continental breakfast was offered. Although I would travel to other Hilton NEVER AGAIN will I go to the Hilton-Richmond Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: richjeswani
Reviews.Content: We had great experience staying at Hotel Hilton Toronto last summer. Very convenient location in heart of Toronto. Excellent lobby and services. Hotel provides free internet service in their lobby. Very neat and clean. Located in the heart of Toronto near all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Views, comfort, central location”
Reviews.Author: lbdgt
Reviews.Content: My hotel preferences usually exclude large chain hotels, but the ambience created by the staff, the high comfort levels of the rooms, the large pool where there is sufficient length to swim laps and the proximity to the lakefront, theatre and shops will encourage me to book again. Having asked for a room on an upper level I enjoyed a view of the CN tower and its wonderful evening light show and down below a reflection of the hotel pool in the building opposite (see photo). My room was large and the bed and lounge chair were extremely comfortable. Ten minutes walk to the lakefront, a great place for a morning run, an excellent theatre (Four Seasons) Is situated just across the street and city centre shopping is 5 minutes away on foot. A real find was the hairstylist located on the ground floor of the interconnected office block - exit the hotel walking past their salon, down a short flight of stirs and turn left into the adjoining office complex - best cut ever, plus color and blow dry all in less than one hour.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient & Well Located”
Reviews.Author: MarilynBB
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for the visitor to Toronto as it is located on the underground shopping malls. We arrived in Toronto by GO train and walked directly into the lobby without heading out into the cool November weather. The scenic elevator provides a good view of University Avenue and riding it all the way to the top is worth it for the view. Everything in our room was as it should be including complimentary bottled water. On departure there are two places to leave the room key. One is for those completely satisfied as we were and the other is for those not feeling their stay was up to their expectations. This is a much easier way to give feedback than filling out a card with little boxes.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect with a Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel6768
Reviews.Content: It's a great location at the corner of Richmond and University. It started with great service, as I called the concierge the week prior to my arrival and David made some recommendations for dinning locations. He subsequently made reservations and emailed me confirmations. The self parking is easy and convenient (18.00) for over 24hrs. The lobby is clean and modern. The rooms also are just right for either business or just a place to stay for shopping or theatre. The location allows an easy walk to either the theaters or the Eaton centre. All in all a good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Toronto Ontario Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharonite
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Hotel in the Ffinancial part of the city is close to a Metro Station and an easy walk to the Prince of Wales Theatre. The Consierge was very helpful in suggesting day tours and transportation. This Hilton has the most comfortable beds and pillows. I wish I had them at home myself. It was nice to be able to make a cup of coffee or tea while relaxing and watching a flat HD TV. We would definetly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Consistent service”
Reviews.Author: finnsdo
Reviews.Content: Always a good dexperience at this hotel....except this time a minor slip up...laundry arrived a bit late. But room was very nice, good internet connection. I love the buffet breakfast..eggs benedict!! Lobby area is a bit cavernous, lots of space, a bit of a scando decor ... Hotel is across from the new Four Season Opera location and very close to downtown shopping. Walking to anything is easy...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: reino80
Reviews.Content: Pros: Central location - the Hilton is located across the street from Osgoode metro/subway station and the Four Seasons Center so it's easy to get around. It is also located near some great restaurants and shopping. The hotel is connected to the underground downtown walkway that has shopping and food. Clean & Comfortable Rooms - I am staying in a junior suite. It's clean and the beds and pillows are comfortable. Its spacious with a large desk , couch and rotating tv (swivels from bedside to couch side) . Wireless - available in lobby areas only through password. They also have computer work stations and a printer in the lobby. Lobby - clean and lots of areas to lounge. They play nice music and the concierge is very friendly and helpful. Cons: wifi is not available in rooms but you can connect via Ethernet. f

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel room”
Reviews.Author: littlemaggie
Reviews.Content: Bought a WagJag for this hotel. They put you in the corner room right by the elevators. It woke us up 4 times at night with the people in the hall coming off the evevators, talking. Our Hilton Member page asks for a room away from elevators and ice machines for that reason. I thought they would have told us, and given us a different room. It turned us right off of staying there another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but 'extras' are costly”
Reviews.Author: gerryn
Reviews.Content: Excellent full service top notch hotel, ideal downtown location. Excellent and efficient service. We had a Jr. Alcove Suite which was very spacious, had very comfortable beds and in all respects was a comfortable and nicely furnished and well maintained room, with a large nicely equipped bathroom. Although Wi-FI was available in the hotel lobby (along with free use of the hotel's computers with printing capablity), there was no WI-FI connectivity in the room (although there was high speed ethernet connectivity). Lack of WI-FI in the room for me (and I'm sure many others) is one drawback to this hotel; there is an extra daily charge for internet connectivity which is yet another drawback. Remember, this is downtown Toronto, so parking at this hotel (like all other downtwn hotels in Toronto) is exorbidant; check out the prices with the hotel before you go and make sure you undertstand whether you have unlimited in and out parking or have to pay a fee each time you enter and leave the garage. There are deals to be had which includes free breakfast (a very good buffet) which is otherwise expensive, and free internet; without those freebies, and coupled with the cost of parking makes this hotel overly expensive otherwise, it's reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option For Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: I just finished another stay at the Hilton in downtown Toronto. The hotel has a modern decor. It is ideally located close to anywhere you are likely to be called for in Toronto for a meeting. It is right across the street from the Four Seasons Centre (if you are an opera or ballet fan that is a definite plus). The gym is well equiped. The Executive Lounge offers great views of the city and a nice assortment of hors d'ouvres in the evening and a substantial morning breakfast. There is a Longo's grocery store in the Path not far from the hotel (in the basement of First Canadian Place) which offers you a solid and reasonably priced, healthy choice for supper (a good food bar offering healthy selections that you can take back to your room).

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: walkabout90
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at the Hilton Toronto. Little extras, such as Peter Thomas Roth toiletries, an air cleaner in the room, a two person shower with optional rain showerhead, a lounge chair, and large desk area, made it even more pleasant. I did notice on the back of the door that the room rate stated $599. Honestly, would not have given 5 stars had we paid that; however, the Hilton webiste offers nice specials and packages that did cut that price way down. The hotel is in a great location in the city, and offered us just what we were looking for in an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: I visited Toronto Hilton on business. On checkin (early in the morning) my room was ready and the staff quoted my advance booking request for early checkin which many before have overlooked. Checking into my room I found it to be spacious and clean, good decor and nice little touches like complimentary water and fruit in the room, little touches but so welcome to frequent travellers. The facilities in the hotel were always available not over subscribed so no waiting to use them, another bonus. The food in the hotel was of a good standard, breakfast was an experience due to the buffet style but tasty and hot. The restaurant was good too, the food was well presented and very well cooked, the chef and their team obviously have a pride in their preparation and service of food. The only one downside was the noise from the traffic. The Hilton resides on a very busy street intact an intersection so traffic noise can be an issue late at night or early in the morning but in fairness I didn't ask to change rooms to one at the rear which I could have easily done, and will next time. All of the staff from the valet lads outside to the checkin and restaurant were very courteous polite and friendly and helped me several times with recommendations for shopping and sight seeing (got to love that tower). All in all a good 6 day stay, comfortable and friendly, would definitely recommend to business and family travellers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: cbrunet_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend recently and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable - what more could you ask for?! We spent very little time at the hotel so can't comment on too much other than the state of our room and we were very pleased with this. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bryli
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights over the summer with friends. Great location, classy lobby, rooms were spacious. Restaurants and Queen/King St was a short walk away, as well as Eaton Centre. The room had a view of the pool and the adjacent street, made it feel a lot more open (positive). Service at check-in and check-out was mediocre, my expectations were a bit higher. I'd stay again if the price point was right, otherwise, there are quite a few options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD BE MUCH BETTER”
Reviews.Author: Retonias
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have stayed in many Toronto downtown business hotels, and each time I return to the Toronto Hilton, except for the location, I ask myselfâ€¦. why? Could it be the loud funk music blaring in the lobby to give everyone a bit of a rush whether they need it or not? Or is it the complacent front desk staff who are too busy chatting with fellow employees to smile and welcome you to their establishment â€“ especially when one is purported to be a â€œspecialâ€� Honours customer? Perhaps it is their seemingly total disregard of any preferences that may be on oneâ€™s profile, as invariably, the assigned room is next to an elevator bank. Of course, elevator bank to reception staff can only mean the public elevators, so by placing one as far as possible from the elevators in recognition of not wanting to be â€œnearâ€� them, oneâ€™s destination becomes directly adjacent to the rear service elevators, which â€“ together with other mechanical equipment - clang steadily through the night. No amount of feather beds and sumptuous sheets and linens will overcome a noisy, howling room. Of course, requesting a room change well after midnight is possible, but who really wants to do that? On the topic of the room(s), while there has been a somewhat dated attempt to modernize these with a contemporary application, they have long since lost their luster and are badly in need of a makeover. The entry doors are badly scratched from many entries and exits, the lighting in the rooms is inadequate, furniture with a cigarette burn, peeling paint on bathroom ceilings, dirty return air vents, black and spotty grout on lower levels of tub/shower tiles, metal sink stands are badly scratched and need paint, sink taps operate in reverse and generally, a similar lack of attention to detail expected of a hotel with Hiltonâ€™s reputation. Without specifically asking, there are no bathrobes, no complimentary water, no slippers or any other amenities which attempt to make one feel special or provide even a hint of luxury â€“ except of course, the room rate. The food and beverage, as well as the bell staff and some on reception were friendly and accommodating, but overall, the experience does not amount to the brand which Conrad Hilton worked so hard to achieve over his lifetime. I am most certain he too would be disappointed. Perhaps this is just another example of progress, but there are better hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great bed”
Reviews.Author: geejay123
Reviews.Content: After a terrible check in experience, the rest of our stay was wonderful. My husband and I spent our anniversary weekend downtown. We had called the hotel requesting a kind size bed earlier in the week, and upon arrival the front desk clerk (who wouldn't even look us in the eye once during our conversations) told us that he didn't have any to offer us. Tough luck. We had to keep pressing and pressing until miraculously his manager found a room for us. He was rude, condescending and arrogant, especially the lack of eye contact irked us. After that we were happy. The room was newly renovated, comfortable bed, and a fantastic downtown location, right in the middle of all the action, but none of the noise that we have experienced at other downtown hotels. The bathroom could have been renovated a little better, it felt like an old bathroom in a new bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: BritinVA
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at this hotel. It is well located in the heart of the city. Parking is on site but for a fee. Check in itself was straightforward. No upgrade was available but I was given a large, modern room on the 26th floor. Used the executive lounge for pre dinner drinks and snacks. Good quality as you would expect. There is an 'honor' bar for collecting cost of alcohol. I also used the lounge for breakfast. This was again of good standard but a little disappointed that only cold food was available. A few hot items would have been welcome. Overall a good location for for both business and personal visits to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: csumms
Reviews.Content: THis hotel is one of my favorite in the city for its location and always quick check in. While the pool was closed for renovation on my last stay, I have always enjoyed the pool which is half outside an amazing to swim out and see all the towers around the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of the financial district, entertainment district, theatres and the Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre. Rooms vary as some are not as updated as others but they have always been very clear. Check in is always fast and the parking right under the hotel is your typical city pricing. Lots of great resaurants within a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A 3.5 star business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aerocraft67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in October. Centrally located, near restaurants, good view. Expensive internet access in the room at CAD$15/day (although, WiFi was free in the lobby), and the Ethernet jack was broken, so I had to prop the jack into the laptop. TV remote didn't work well, either but I was too busy to get these things replaced. Room was amply sized. Bed was comfortable. Duvet was cozy. Lighting was good, although the entry light had a nasty industrial buzz. Iron worked. Shower was fine. Pool was closed. Front desk was friendly and helpful. With the expensive internet, I was able to print to the front desk and pick up the documents at my convenience, which was nice; I didn't exceed the five page limit for free printing. Perfectly apt for business, if nothing to write home about. I'd give 3.5 rating if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKingBrussels
Reviews.Content: On the whole very efficient, as you may expect from a Hilton-operated hotel. Located in the heart of the financial district. Also fantastic to attend conferences in the Rodgers Centre, which is not even a 10 minute walk to its Northern entrance. On the downside: the rooms, including bathrooms, are just that little bit tired. Nothing major, but taking into account the price tag, maybe not what you would expect. Nice to know: there are three free internet PC's in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! One minor complaint.”
Reviews.Author: Adam L
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It's located in a great area with lots to do around it. The room was clean, and the front desk did a great job checking us in. Parking rate was reasonable as well. My only complaint was that we had the late checkout option (3PM) and on 2 occasions (1 us not being there) the cleaning people came into our room. The first time we weren't there and left some sheets on a table. But the second time we were still in the room. They knocked and decided to open the door 2 seconds later without us giving them a chance to respond. In some certain events, this could have become awkward. Could have been a little more perfessional on their part and waited for a response before barging in. Other than that, I really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: francophileonthemove
Reviews.Content: Toronto Hilton is a large business hotel in the financial district of downtown Toronto. The lobby looks great and this theme continues throughout the building. I had a executive room, which was huge and well appointed. The shower room was wonderful and the toiletries great. Other positves: Very friendly and helpful staff; Superb level of housekeeping; Very comfortable bed, pillows and robe; Superb room service. Negatives: The lack of wifi throughout the property; It must be the only hotel I have ever been to where guests have to pay for drinks in the executive lounge!; Ruth Chris' steak house in the building is shocking - the service was indescribably bad - avoid it. Overall, I would recommend the Hilton for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: mek88
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Hilton Toronto. The room was large and the bed comfortable. When non-feather pillows were requested , they were delivered promptly. Cons: shower curtain held together be safety pins, bathroom had hair on tub and toilet, and the $15 a day Internet charge as free wireless was only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “ask about the dream team”
Reviews.Author: vigra
Reviews.Content: if you travel from so far area and miss your familly or search for a pradise in toronto ask for exuctive lounge in 32 ,if you so lukey you will meet the dream team mary & jim very kind peaple , profesional & helpful also Annette Punyi you dont see him but he always around you to help you ,Great location, downtown Toronto , Walking distance to city Hall, CN tower and other sites. Continental breakfast for the executives was not well supplied !!! compared with many other hilton group with exuctive floor , im diamond hh and i know the standard in hilton & other hotels also room servece is bad they only clean my bed and leave the room unclean why ??also i found 20$ detected from my master card in first day and till now no reply

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: rykmac44
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Hilton! I called to see if we could get early check-in and although they couldn't guarantee it, we were able to get into out room at 1:30pm. Very friendly front desk staff and answered all the questions we had. The rooms are very spacious and clean!! Great water pressure, clean towels and shower. The bed was extremely comfortable and for being downtown Toronto, quiet! No bar fridge for drinks or leftovers, but the ice bucket works! Lack of free outlet space or cell phone chargers and laptops. We chose to self park which was located below the hotel and easy to access. Check out was a breeze and the staff was kind enough to inform us of the road closures because of the marathon. We didn't eat within the hotel but did notice the room service menu was a bit costly. Overall a great stay with the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel and Room!”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Spent last year New Years Eve at this hotel and let me tell you i was very very Impressed!!! Stayed in the 1 King Bed Aclove Suite. Great view of the city. The room was very spacious! The Bed was very comfortable. Flat screen Tv, impressive work desk and 2 small sofa like chairs were in place. The room was clean. Checking in was a breeze on new years eve! Complimentary orange juice and cookies i remember which was nice. The hotel overall is very high class, the service was excellent. No free Wifi but majority 4 star hotels you have to pay for lots of ammenities. I enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay here again if i ever get the chance. Thank-You Hilton for being a great hotel and experience!

Reviews.Title: “Inviting lobby and comfy bed.”
Reviews.Author: JBalzli
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel looks a bit like a concrete fortress. But the lobby is warm, spacious, inviting and comfortable. Enjoy the scenic elevators on your way up to the room. Once in the room, melt into one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Unfortunately, the temperature controls didn't seem to work very well in my room. The layout of the room left a little to be desired for a hotel of this caliber. And, the bathroom was cold, uninviting, and not especially well designed. Sadly, there was no symbol on shampoo/conditioner bottles to indicate the type of plastic for recycling purposes. And, there was no apparent way for guests to decline unnecessary laundering of towels and bed linens. Hilton still has a few things to learn about corporate responsibility and sustainability. I was also disappointed in the surprisingly slow service at the hotel lobby bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay - Located in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: TheHubbardsOhio
Reviews.Content: Front Desk - Quick and friendly Room - King Sized bed, kind of an odd layout for a suite with a wide open middle of the room making it hard to see the TV from bed, but the room was very clean and nice. Express checkout provided. Bathroom - Very stylish, Tub/shower has older tile, but kept clean. They have a second hair dryer in the room which was more powerful than those little wall mounted kind. That was a plus. Green hotel - I like that they have a policy that assumes you don't need your sheets changed except every 4 days and towels you have left on the towel bar will be re-used and those on the floor will be washed. They also provide a recycling container in the room which was very convenient. Location - Since it was in the financial district, there are very few restaurants at nightime nearby that are open, but you can find some about 5 or 6 blocks away. I think if I go back I would stay near the entertainment district with would be around King and Peter Streets.... There is more nightlife and options. Otherwise, it's still fairly close to walk to alot of places from this hotel. Bellhop - Excellent service, gave us heads up about problems with the airport and suggested he reserve a car for us to get to the airport and advised that we leave early for the airport. He also arranged at the last minute for us to get a larger car to take 4 people. Tip - The flat rate for cabs from the airport to downtown is $55. Plan ahead and share a cab. I hear there is a charter bus somewhere at the airport that sells round trip tickets for $40 and is a nice ride, with wifi included. Restaurants visited while in town - Food at hotel was VERY expensive. Had breakfast every morning 1 block east on Richmond at Tim Horton's - breakfast items, coffee and donuts available. Had dinner at The Red Tomato - local place with a lot of character and good food. Had dinner at Joe Badali's Italian Restaurant at the corner of Front St and Simcoe Place - excellent Veal Parmagiana and appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: groovybluegirl
Reviews.Content: For it being the Hilton, I expected more. No exhaust fan in the bathroom, water drains very slowly from shower/tub, no free internet in the rooms (they want to charge you and extra $14.95 / day for internet access!). No mini-bars/fridges in room either, with the tiniest trash cans. On a good note, comfy beds, great water pressure and good location. I'll look for another hotel next time for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hilton for helping make a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: MartinJ_NE
Reviews.Content: I occasionally stay at Hilton Hotels on work trips, often only a couple of days, so rarely use the hotel as a base for a holiday, but as the reputation of the chain is generally good, picked this hotel for my vacation. Visited Canada for the first time a couple of weeks ago, and stayed in Toronto for a week. Checked-in in middle of a torrential downpour, but luckily the only rain for most of the time. The reception staff were really friendly and helpful, and was pleasently surprised to have a room upgrade on the 28th floor, with truly stunning views across to the CN Tower. Wireless in the room was fast, and reliable, and really handy for the IPad checking out places to go - the room itself was very clean and good condition, aircon worked perfectly, and the beds were really comfortable, and the shower was hot and powerful, perfect for getting going in the morning! Housekeeping were very thorough in making up the room round every day. The concierge was also really helpful in booking our trips, and general advice where needed. So thanks Hilton Totonto, you have a great team there! I'd stay again if visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hiltoon”
Reviews.Author: Jeff J
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Hilton. Being a Gold Honors member I got access to the executive lounge. It was nice, The poor person working in there was overwhelmed. They ran out of food as fast as she could bring it out. The tables were all dirty every morning we went there and she had no time to clean them off. I think she needed a helper. The room was nice. I thought I would have been upgraded to the executive rooms but was not. The parking situation well $40 per day to park a car OUCH. That's about what I paid to rent the entire car. It is noisy outside here and it is surrounded by one way streets. Very confusing in the beginning to drive in. In all fairness it is close to everything and we walked most everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “BIG thank you to everyone at Hilton Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Marc1968
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 15th anniversary weekend in Toronto. My wife and I had decided to spend Saturday and Sunday in Toronto and take part in many of the fun things Toronto has to offer. We had picked Hilton Toronto as our place to stay and we couldn't of been happier with the accommodations, the service and the overall experience! Prior to us leaving Saturday morning, we had contacted the hotel to see if we could be located on one of the top floors with a view of the CN Tower. Edwin Frizzell, the General Manager at Hilton Toronto took it on his own to upgrade us to the top floor and placed us in the Executive Suite that had a gorgeous view of the city and the CN Tower! The suite was amazing - it was beautifully decorated and was huge. We were absolutely floored with this pleasant surprise and it really set the tone for what turned out to be an amazing weekend. We could not say enough good things about everyone at the Hilton - the people who worked the front desk to those at the Tundra bar and restaurant and everyone else who we came across. Edwin even arranged to have a bottle of Champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us after we returned from our day in TO. He also included a handwritten card wishing us a happy anniversary - a perfect touch to a truly great weekend. You guys certainly know how to go above and beyond and make our trip a memorable one. Thanks you so much and we will be back to spend future weekend getaways at the Hilton Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Sarah154960
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September while on business. I reserved a club room andy whole experience was perfect. The room was well appointed and clean, the service excellent. I really enjoyed the club floor and took advantage of a great breakfast. My meeting wasn't until late afternoon so I checked out and sat in the club room and read. Very enjoyable. Within walking distance if everything. My only suggestion would be to add an additional concierge, there was consistenly a line up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with updated interiors”
Reviews.Author: sunilmurthy
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location - close to almost everything prime in downtown, including the bluejay stadium and restaurants. Front desk was very friendly and check in was a breeze. If you are a hilton gold/diamond - you get a 32nd floor access to the lounge - which is highly recommended for evening with the views and sunset - great to stretch after a long busy day. Breakfast was awesome - try to get it included in your room rate as prices can be steep.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Friendly, Clean”
Reviews.Author: EveMarieR
Reviews.Content: I traveled solo to say good bye to a friend who was leaving the country. I've only been in Toronto a handful of times so this hotel's location and proximity to everything was essential. An easy walk from where the Porter shuttle drops you off, close to the Eaton Center, dinning, and the clubs where we went out. Being able to walk to everything was fantastic. The hotel its self is lovely, and I enjoyed my glass elevator ride to the 12th floor every time. I booked with hotwire.com, so I certainly lucked out with the room I got. It was Standard King but I had a fabulous view of the skyline and the CN Tower. Everything was clean and bigger than I anticipated. The TV was ginormous, and I loved the little bar area in the room. The bathroom is on the small side but modern and sufficient. I didn't lack for anything. The only two negatives was that 1) the pool was closed for renovations, but had I felt like it, they offered us use of the Sheraton pool across the street. And 2) there was nothing vegetarian listed on the room serviced menu. I'm sure if I had called they would have fixed me something, but I was discouraged and went out instead - a more fun decision anyway. After check-out, I found out my ride home was significantly delayed and with luggage (and a highly embarrassing hang-over) I ended up sitting in the lobby for 3 hours waiting. Never once did I feel like I was abusing my welcome -the staff were so friendly. Also the free computers that were available were great for passing time. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -”
Reviews.Author: Axel K
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday night for one night for a short trip to Toronto at the Hilton. Flawless Valet and check in. Got a very nice top floor room with a view. Room was spacious, modern with great floor to ceiling windows. Everything just worked fine incl. Internet. Location is great for shopping, dining and nightlife. Can only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jescott888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a family vacation in August. The location was perfect for enjoying all of the sights of the city. Note: the harbor area is not as desirable to stay as one might think.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, restful rooms for the weary. The hot tub is pure heaven!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianHere
Reviews.Content: This hotl is in a great locaation in downtown Toronto. There is a subway just outside the door on University Avenue that makes it easy to get almost anywhere you need to go. The rooms are clean and quiet and have coffee-makers and other conveniences, like blowidryers and nice shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and body lotion. The pricy breakfast buffet is worth every penny and sets you up for a great day. It includes everything you could possibily want, hot or cold, and more. There is a problem with the safety of vehicles parked in the underground garage at the Hilton, but I didn't have any negative experiences while a guest there. However, others have, so if you're worried about this issue, this might not be the home away from home you're expecting while visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: PacoandLupe
Reviews.Content: I'm so going to stay here again. I've been staying at the Sheraton so many times looking at the Hilton from the window wondering, how come I don't try the Hilton again? So I did. Wow, they really spruced the place up! Rooms are spacious and super clean. We stayed on the 5th floor facing south. Not much of a view but it wasn't that important. The location alone will convince you to get out and roam. So close to either the entertainment or crazy-fun Queen St areas. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Close to metros. The reception staff were friendly. No WIFI though. Seriously, I say this again...it's 2011, people! Free at the lobby but it was slow as molasses in January. And I say again...find a Starbucks, get coffee and enjoy the free WIFI. Hilton, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “My worst Hilton Stay ever”
Reviews.Author: mgolf27
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights from 8/25 thru 8/30 I am a Hilton Gold on my way to Hilton Diamond POOL CLOSED FOR RENOVATION NO NOTICE NO WIRELESS IN ROOM COMPUTERS IN EXECUTIVE LOUNGE MUST BE ON DIALUP RIDICULOUSLY SLOW AND FREEZING CONTINUALLY WHILE THERE WAS WIRELESS IN LOUNGE YOU WERE NOT ABLE TO ADD TO A PRINTER FOOD IN LOUNGE PRETTY MEDIOCRE but here is my main complaint Told the front desk my dtr was flying in from Italy and asked to be upgraded ( this is usually automatic with most Hiltons and gold or diamond status. Front desk extremely disinterested. Was told all they could offer was a regular room with 2 beds yet hotel was nowhere near full. On the top floor where the executive lounge was almost every suite was empty. So we stayed 3 to the room with lacklustre room cleaning shortage of towels shampoos etc beds were doubles not even queens but were the usual extremely comfortable beds that I am accustomed to at a Hilton. Final straw was my departure this morning Had to load 4 suitcases into my car myself because the doormen and valet attendents were too busy talking to all the waiting cabbies and each other. In the past month I have stayed at the following Hiltons Hilton Toronto Airport ( twice) Hilton Garden Inn Markham Hilton Molino Stucky Venice Hilton Garden Inn Saskatoon Hilton Garden Inn Edmonton Hilton Rome Airport and finally this poorly run Hilton Toronto Every other of these properties received a positive review I am not one to complain often. I was going to come back for 4 more nights next week but booked the radisson instead

Reviews.Title: “Good to be back at the Hilton Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: It had been a while since my last visit to the Hilton Toronto. As with many other corporate travellers, my business travel is subjected to spending limits, which has pushed me toward the two Hilton Garden Inn in the area, as well as the underwhelming Delta Chelsea. It was very good to be back in this above average, slightly upscale and business oriented property (Of course, the fact that I was upgraded to one of the impressive suite on the Executive Floor helped!). Staff at check-in were very friendly. There were more than enought staff to handle the volum of incoming guests and check-in was a breeze. Housekeeping was just done "refreshing" the suite and cleaning the carpet as I walked in the oversized HBC suite, which decor is inspired from HBC/Hudson Bay fashion and decord (and featuring the famous "striped" HBC linens). The room features separate libing and sleeping area as well as a small kitchen area. Of course, most travellers will not have access to this suite unless being upgraded but this property underwent regular upgrades and maintenance over the last few years so most rooms are in good working conditions with modern layout. The hotel features the typical Hilton Fitness center (by Precor) with sufficient equipment to accomodate a mid-size group (2-3 of each items such as Elleptical, treadmill,...) All equipment is equipped with LCD TVs/screens This hotel features one of the most impressive Hilton Executive lounge in Canada. It is very spacey, modern and well attended. The food offering is acceptable and an honor bar system is available. The executive lounge features complimentary Wi-FI and two computers. Staff in the lounge, once again is friendly and responsive. The Hilton Toronto is a "business" hotel. Tourists may find it somewhat sterile and HHonnors members may find this place to be a relatively poor value when it comes to use points for free stays (compared to European locations for example). That said, the Hilton is centrally located between the shopping area (Yonge street), the Entertainment district and is surrounded by several dining options (including newly opened Earl's and Joey's, two well-known and highly popular chains within Western Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, modern, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ncegrl
Reviews.Content: Check-in staff were very friendly, and the lobby and common areas were modern and sexy, with great decor and low lighting. Very impressive. The room was spacious, comfortable, and the toiletries (Crabtree & Evelyn) were a nice touch. We also had a great view - from our 20th floor room, we could see the curving government buildings, the AGO, etc. On the downside, the comforter was so thin it felt empty and patchy in most places. Also, there wasn't an ice machine on our floor. Overall, I enjoyed staying there, and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, and convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: qryche68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid-August. Check-in smooth and friendly. Room was clean, comfortable, and quiet with a nice city view/view of CN Tower. Did not use restaurants/bars in the building. Did not use pool or workout room, although visited both and they looked nice...largest hotel workout room I've seen recently. Parking is expensive...you can park more cheaply in nearby local lots...it's up to you whether the convenience of valet is worth it. While not neceesarily right next to anything, the hotel is close to everything. Queen St. shopping is just blocks away, with a slightly longer walk to many other attractions. Cabs are numerous if walking is not your thing. I understand Toronto's underground walkway runs past here, but I never went looking for it as the weather was beautiful. Overall, a very friendly and accomodating place. i'm coming back here on my next Toronto trip!

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent experience"”
Reviews.Author: CaptainMike63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toronoto Hilton for 6 days on a vacation trip last month. The staff were accommodating to our needs and went out of their way to accommodate our requests (small fridge in room, please). We found hotel personnel to be helpful, efficient, pleasant, and accessible (quick...I need a screwdriver!). The breakfast buffet in the Tundra restaurant is pricey ($26 CAD) but excellent. Many guests had room rates that included breakfast coupons, which I'd recommend. Executive lounge was spacious and relaxing for those guests fortunate enough to have room rates that included access to it. Downtown location is ideal for walking to some attractions or catching subway to others. Would recommend this property without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for an anniversary celebration!”
Reviews.Author: strawblonde48
Reviews.Content: Although the room we had this weekend was part of an upgraded special they were giving away, everytime I've been to this hotel I've LOVED it! This weekend we had a room on the 31st floor so we had great views of the city. The staff are always so helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was very good as well. Thoroughly enjoyed my 29th wedding anniversary weekend and a big part of it is because of the hotel. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: yehaaw
Reviews.Content: It's a Hilton; it is what you expect from a Hilton. Staff was very friendly; the front desk agent was very accommodating when I had trouble using my debit card at check in; problem was solved graciously! I didn't use the pool or fitness room but checked them out during my stay. Pool is very nice and looked very clean; an oasis in the middle of the city. The fitness room had everything I would have wanted if I was compelled to exercise. I was on vacation so I didn't. Restaurant is Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. Parking was $24 per day and easily accessibleâ€”very safe and clean. WiFi was FREE! I was expecting to pay, so complimentary access was a pleasant surprise! Because it was free, I can't complain about it and I didn't let this affect my rating of this hotel; still the WiFi was a bit unreliable. This could be because my room was in a dead zone so I can forgive that (I was unable to use the WiFi at the desk, but found a stronger signal by the door). Again, I am not complaining about this, but mentioning it in case you need to have a reliable connection! At check in, ask for a room with a strong signal; I'm sure they have a general idea where the dead spots are. I was on the 29th floor; perhaps that's not a great location? Hotel is very close to Yonge Street so you are in the middle of it all. There is a subway station right across the street and anybody who has used Toronto's subway knows that it is the easiest and most accessible in the world! Hotel is also close to Queen Street which has many great shops and restaurants. While in Toronto, I went with my parents to see a baseball game. My father is in his 80s and can get tired out pretty easily. He found the hotel to be close enough to the stadium that we could walk home from the game without any trouble. Room was CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN. It's a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorOT
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Toronto is a well established hotel. The location is close to downtown and various communities including Chinatown. The rooms are spacious and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service in a hotel that needs a room refresh”
Reviews.Author: TXN60613
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 3 day business trip. This was the first Hilton I have ever stayed in - traditionally I am a Marriott or a Starwood guy - but I wanted to try a new hotel on this trip. I booked online and was offered a Junior King Suite at time of booking. I checked in online (what a great feature) and the hotel sent me a message via twitter indicating the room I had selected wasn't the best and they would reassign me to a better room on a lower floor. Upon check in, I was given a rundown of all the amenities offered at the hotel and headed up to my room. I was surprised to find a tray of "cookies of the month" and a bowl of fresh fruit waiting for me. The fruit was very tasty but the cookies were a bit stale. The first morning we visited the Executive Lounge for a light breakfast. My colleague's room had a funky smell (turns out the shower curtain had mold issues). We mentioned this to the woman working the front desk in the Lounge. She quickly requested a thorough cleaning of his room and gave us complementary restaurant breakfast for the next morning. Unfortunately the room still had a bad smell after the cleaning - the second day they finally replaced the shower curtain and voila! the smell was gone. Each employee I interacted with at the hotel was quite helpful - they truly understood customer service. I felt at home away from home. The hotel is centrally located is a quick walk to Eaton Center, shopping, the ACC, Rogers Centre and the CN Tower. The only negative thing I can say about this property is that the guest rooms are a little outdated and in need of a deep clean (my room had a lot of hair on the furniture and linens, the tub had a dingy yellow tint to it). The room was a great size for one or two people - with a separate alcove for the very comfortable king bed.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel,5 star stay!”
Reviews.Author: JWLChicago
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Toronto planned for a thursday and decided to bring my wife along as well. We had been here many times and there are a myriad of areas to stay but the Hilton Toronto was the best stay yet. We were greeted warmly and enthusiastically by Stephanie at the front desk and given a newly redecorated room on the 17th floor with outstanding views of the city. The Concierge floor was outstanding with top floor panoramic views of Toronto and a very nice cocktail hour and really good breakfast provided at n/c. As far a location goes,walk out the front door,turn right and walk just a few blocks and you are on Yonge street and the fantastic Eaton Center for shopping and food. Overall a great place to stay in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good Hilton but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Holly11Wales
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the Hilton group. My husband and I use them a lot and by and large they rarely fail to deliver. Arriving at the Toronto Hilton was a smooth and calm experience which is very important after a 7 hour flight. Check in staff were efficient and polite. We had a room on the Executive Floor which was spacious with a queen size bed and ample pillows ( I adore the Hilton beds and pillows)! The flaw in the room was the lack of draw space and a particularly small bathroom. Toiletries were plentiful but the sink area was very cramped (us women do tend to take a lot of potions away)! Tea/Coffee facilities in the room are a must and although we had them, they weren't particularly straightforward. Firstly it was a coffee machine which double up for tea as well - ok but a kettle would have been so much easier and a lot quicker. There were no English tea bags and not enough milk sachets. But the biggest sin here was PAPER CUPS!! This is a Hilton for goodness sake, where were the china mugs? We had breakfast for the first four days in the main restaurant which was fantastic. Lots of choices, very friendly staff and excellent service. After that, we went to the Executive Lounge for breakfast which was a bit like a rugby scrum. Absolutely packed in there, not enough tables to sit at and tables not being cleared for ages. Maybe they were short of staff, I don't know. At least there were china mugs in there, although trying to find hot water for my tea took ages. The croissants were nice, the bagels tasted as though they'd been sitting there for a week. We had dinner one evening in the Barrister bar which was great although the quantity of food was immense! Very friendly bar staff and good service. What was surprising though, was that this bar is closed at weekends - very curious. I used the gym a few times which was fine. A variety of machines, each with a tv, and several weights. It was never very busy. The outdoor pool was a bonus as the weather was pretty warm, nice pool area, although the pool does need a bit of upgrading around the sides. In summary, this was, as the title says, a pretty good hotel. We were there for six days and had a very relaxing time. But please, Hilton, can you ditch the paper cups in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Selks
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 10 nights in July 2011. Rooms were of good size. Only thing missing was wifi in the rooms which surprisingly was not available, even though I was told it was available when I made the booking. Otherwise could not fault the hotel. Location was perfect, easy access for everywhere in Downtown. Car Parking was expensive but that is common in all Downtown hotels and it was on the same level as other hotels - around $30 for 24 hours ($40 for Valet which allows you to exit and re-enter parking for no extra charge). Would definitely stay here again - thanks to everyone who made it enjoyable.
