Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but some areas unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Chelseagirl1066
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton twice in July 2011. We stayed on the executive floor. The rooms were spacious, clean and everything youâ€™d want. The bed was really comfortable. We arrived earlier than check in time, as our plane arrived early and were let straight into our room, which was great. The concierge (Dave) was really helpful and better than many that I have dealt with over the years. He was amazingly knowledgeable and personable. The check in staff were also well above average. The downside of the hotel, was that the bar snacks were just so limited and when we ordered some one night, they were not good, with the fries being inedible. The other issue for me with the hotel was the swimming pool. The edges were cracked and dirty. The patio area was bland and did not have enough seating. Even though it was 36 degrees, the pool bar was not operating. These issues would not matter, to everyone, but for me they were disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiscomeBay
Reviews.Content: I had a very large suite type room at this property and found my stay to be quite pleasant. The hotel appears to have been recently renovated, or at least they have kept up on renovating small parts of the hotel, as they go. The lobby is large and mingles a lounge/restaurant which offer great service and food selections. It is conveniently located and well priced, at least during my stay which was February. The only complaint I had during my stay was not even about the hotel itself but rather the construction site across the street which began making significant noise about 7am. This property would be a good selection when traveling to downtown Toronto and is certainly service oriented with many friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite but expensive”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Nicely located downton just a few vlocks away from the waterfront and Chinatown. luxurious beds and pleasent rooms. Pool and workout room available in fact only thing I found wrong was the cheap ironing board. Ruth Chris steakhouse on the premises with a street full of pubs and restaraunts just a couple of blocks away. Very Pricey but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: talkshowsonmute
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location near to everything. Just a 10 minute walk from Dundas Square! Room was spacious and clean with a very nice view! The only downside was I thought the service wasn't the best! Having stayed in Hilton hotels before in different locations I found this to be my least favourite for service. The door men (except for one man) were not very helpful at all and the reception lady did not say a whole lot when I checked out! Barely got a thanks or a goodbye. There was one lady who worked in the hotels shop in the evening that was very friendly and spoke to us about our trip and always had a smile on her face! Dave was quite helpful also. Overall this hotel is in a great location and the rooms are very comfortable and spacious. But compared to other Hilton experiences this did not top the list for service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Constable82
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a Saturday night in July. We booked through Priceline and got a great rate. The valet was helpful enough to direct us to the underground lot saving us some money. The elevators are undergoing maintenance but that didn't seem to be an issue getting from the garage to the lobby. Check-in was fast, friendly, and efficient. I inquired about upgrading to a suite upon check-in but none where available. We were however given a king size bed on a higher floor with a view of Nathan Phillips Square. Upon arrival on the 30th floor, it was unbearably hot in the corridor. Saying the air conditioning wasn't working would be an understatement. It actually seemed as if they had the heat on. It was 30 degrees Celsius outside and honestly seemed cooler than the hallway did. Our room was nice. The bed was amazing. We both had a great sleep. The TV is your standard 32 inch LCD hotel TV- LG I believe. Our bathroom needed a bit of work. It seems they have made an attempt to update it, yet there was still an alarming amount of rust and residue around the fixtures and furnishings in the bathroom. I also cannot wrap my head around how a 4 star hotel such as the Hilton cannot provide a fridge in their room,meanwhile the Holiday Inn or other similar price-points provide them free of charge. I've never understood that, and I never will. For dinner, we ventured 5 minutes west on Queen to the Korean Grill House. It is an amazing place where you grill your own food and it gives new meaning to the term " all you can eat". For the more expensive and refine tastes, Ruth's Chris is on the lower level and if you like butter and USDA prime, that is the place for you. Upon returning to our room, we were hungry. As expected, a sandwich from the room service menu can be had for the mere sum of your first born and then you add on the service fee and tax and tip. For the price of one person getting a sandwich from the hotel, two of us dined from Pizza Pizza for less money. Ultimately- we got a great rate and had a great sleep but the dangerously hot temperatures in the corridor, the lack of a fridge and the bathroom are what keeps this hotel on the 3.5 side of 4 stars instead of inching up towards that 4.5 mark. I am truly curious to find out what hotel management has to say about the heating issue.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: PJM24k
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the one night stay - walked down to front street area - looked around Osgoode Hall. Took a streetcar to and from the Amphitheatre. Large room, felt spacious, good view north to Osgoode Hall and University Ave. Pool was busy but it was saturday. Great idea with the executive lounge - internet, continental breakfast and snacks in the evening. Valet or regular parking - chose regular as it was in the same place. A quick trip with a good central hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, outdoor pool, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: IA_Canuck
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were friendly and polite from the moment we arrived. Being a gold honors member I was upgraded to the executive floor. The afternoon snacks in the executive lounge were great, and the views from the 32nd floor were great. The buildings are growing up on the lake side, but the north side is still interesting to look out on the city. The breakfast was substantial, but the volume of guests overran the staff every morning we were there. It seemd unorganized, and the guests had to pile up dirty dishes to get a table to . The ladies serving and stocking were really nice, but some guests were rude about the lack of speed in the restocking of supplies. I felt bad for them The rooms were nice, but a fridge would have been a nice added touch, but at least, we had a cooler. Having an outdoor pool and deck in July was great, but during cold weather the pool would be very small. The tile and pool were looking in need of repair, lots of cracks and a little grungy, but we had fun sunning and playing in the pool. Restaurants, shopping, subway etc are all very close and theatres are even just a short walk. We had a nice stay, and may return another time...in the summer, to enjoy the outdoor pool

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mbellny
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was modern and clean. Staff were very attentive. They moved us to a better room (away from the elevator)without us having to ask. Good steak restaurant on the premise and plenty of coffee shops and restaurants near by. Their breakfast is very expensive, I would recommend going to one of the coffee shops for breakfast instead. Bed was very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel for touring around Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but just okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilac7272
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to go to the Medcan Clinic. If this is what you're doing, I would definitely recommend this hotel since you can access Medcan very easily. I would also recommend parking your own car - it isn't difficult and is located right below the hotel, so save yourself a few dollars. The thing I find frustrating about this hotel (and many of the higher end hotels) is that you have to pay extra for internet access. It's SO irritating. You pay so much to stay in a hotel and you have to pay $15/night or sit in the lobby to do any work on the computer. The lobby was small and not particularly welcoming though the staff more than makes up for this. The room was just okay but there was an odour when we first came in that smelled a bit musty. This hotel is good for location but there are probably better options for quality.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: 0401980p
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in room 1601 with a stunning view of the CN Tower. Hotel is very close to Union Station (bus and rail) and has many of the cities main sites well within walking distance. As you'd expect, service was very attentive with staff happy to help you with as much, or as little, as you need. If you are going to Toronto this is the hotel to stay in for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed, Quiet/Comfortable Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: darcibuoy
Reviews.Content: Very impressive first impression as you enter the lobby with friendly, accommodating staff. King room was large and well appointed with extremely comfortable bed/pillows, day bed, business area, flat screen T.V. free in-room safe, drawers, cupboards and lots of lighting. Large walk-in shower area had 2 different types of shower heads and water temperature guage. No in-room frig. All phone calls/internet has a service charge. Very disappointed with the indoor/outdoor pool area. Outside pool area was in need of repair...broken tiles, etc., pool was extremely dirty around the outside edge and stuff on bottom of pool floor and didn't seem to be much cholorine in the pool. Didn't appear that area was looked after on a regular basis throughout the day. Shower/Sauna/Dressing area needs upgrading also. Whirlpool was hot and fitness area more than adequate. Location is ideal for restaurants, nite life, theatre, shopping and transportation. Look for Vacation Getaway Specials which include hot buffet breakfast....great deal! Enjoyed my short stay and would definitely return to the Hilton and can only hope the pool area will be cleaned-up.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: MHarry
Reviews.Content: My sister in law and I stayed here one night while going to a concert and had a great deal from Travelzoo in a "club level" room. We had access to a top floor, large lounge with free appetizers in the evening and a good breakfast in the morning. We rode the elevator back down from breakfast with Donny Osmond! We enjoyed a nice swim in the indoor/outdoor pool and a great dinner in their restaurant under the Summerlicious program. They check for room keys at night prior to getting on the elevators which made you feel a little more secure. Our room was spacious and clean and had a great view of the city and the bed was very comfortable. The location is central to many attractions including the Eaton Centre, the entertainment distrcit and Queen Street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninjas2
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to a king suite. Gorgeous room with a fantastic view of downtown Toronto. The indoor/outdoor pool with sunning deck and sauna were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a sneer...”
Reviews.Author: djwgilroy
Reviews.Content: Gave me a room with a dining room attached, second bath and two tvs then LOCKED THE DOOR with my luggage on the WRONG SIDE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location would stay again for sure”
Reviews.Author: lprimeal
Reviews.Content: Hilton downtown Toronto was awesome. Location fabulous. Walking distance to almost everything you want to do in the city. Plenty of places to grab some drinks or eats in the hotel. Serivce excellent. Hope I get to go back!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service-exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: botenika
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for a weekend on business- but decided to take my (then) 14 months-old baby with me. You have some expectations when you go to the Hilton but this hotel exceeded my expectations. A few examples include: I inquired at the reception about the best way to store milk for my baby and a fridge was sent up to my room in about 2 seconds. At another point I asked for herbal tea (they only had coffee and caffeinated tea at the room) to be brought up to my room and again, pretty much by the time I put the receiver down it was at my door, and replenished everyday for the duration of my stay. Everything was spotless clean, and looked updated. The room was spacious. I found all staff members to be courteous and friendly. The bed was amazingly comfy. The only thing I did not enjoy was their restaurants - one is exceedingly expensive- I couldn't afford to have an appy there- and the other one is like a sports bar, with big screen t.vs everywhere you look. That's not how I like to have my dinner so that was disappointing, and I dined at neither and had to venture out. However, I was just so taken aback by the hotel's excellent service that I cannot knock a star off my review for that. I got an amazing deal via priceline so I'm not sure what to put for the value section. I got great value for money! Swimming pool was under renovations (we were directed to the Sheraton across the street which was great)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: panky5
Reviews.Content: Went for vacation with family. Its one of best hotel I have ever stayed. think this is one of THE nicest hotels I have stayed at! A wonderful wooded escape in the heart of the downtown. The rooms were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Still great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MontrealTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: As I have regained my HH Gold Status, I returned to the Toronto Hilton, curious to see how the hotel was doing. I did the online check in, chose (since it was offered) upgraded accomodation to a junior suite (room xx22). It was fine, just a little bit more (sitting) room. I was pleased to hear that the hotel's management found the way how to keep the lounge on the 32nd floor open during the weekends. There is no full-time receptionist there with the exception of Mary (nice lady referred to by the previous poster) who works only during peak hours. They have a person preparing the food only. At breakfast time, they did away with the table settings, which was fine. The food on offer was quite ok regarding the quality and quantity and nicely presented. During my recent stay. I noticed that most lounge patrons were senior citizens, many of them hoarding the food, bottled water and the internet stations. One couple took both PCs and decided that it was their own private office, brough along even salt and pepper shakers and left lots of mess after they finally left. I am not sure how the hotel could eliminate such guest behaviour. They cannot police everything. Also, the main lobby is quite impressive, clean, spacious and makes you feel welcome. The reception staff is also quite pleasant and I felt to be more personally welcome here, as HH Gold, than at the nearby Fairmont Royal York as PC Platinum. Very well done, Toronto Hilton, thank you! Note: The same was also posted on www.flyertalk.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Fayzer
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Wag Jag so got an excellent price for the accommodations, which included breakfast. Think it could have been a little pricey otherwise, but we loved the stay. Had some problems with guests on the floor above but a call to the desk quickly quieted them down. Easy to get anywhere with cabs or by walking!!!

Reviews.Title: “fun overnight stay, not great service in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LLPCanada
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took advantage of a great package through Dealfind - updgrade to a junior suite, drinks, breakfast, shopping centre gift card, late check out. The junior suite was lovely - it was great to have the couch and chairs to sit on and spread out a bit while we got ready for the theatre. Great location next door to the Four Seasons Centre. We had to phone three times to try to get a dinner reservation, then finally went down to the concierge - they couldn't find anyone to take our reservation either. We left phone messages, asking for a 5:45 reservation, got confimration at 5:30. The Tundra Restarurant had a delicious prix fixe dinner for theatre-goers - the food was terrific, the service was not good. My friend had a garlic allergy, and after telling the waiter he brought dip with garlic to the table when he brought the bread. Buffet breakfast was also in the Tundra - delicious, lots of hot and cold options, but again, the service was not good - the only thing our waiter said was "coffee?" That's it, through the whole time we were there, until we finally asked him how to use the voucher to pay. A little friendly conversation would have been helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Parking”
Reviews.Author: DanT21
Reviews.Content: I am planning a trip to Toronto in August and have already booked the Hilton Toronto for my stay. I am trying to find out more information about the parking situation at the hotel. There seems to be fees of $40/day for valet and $24/day for self-park but no mention of in/out privileges associated. Can anyone help with this?

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Toronto is WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: suesthelma
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Hilton Toronto and it continues to be a beautiful, comfortable hotel. The public areas and executive floor rooms are on par with some Conrad properties that I have visited. The Executive Lounge offers a spectacular view of Toronto and you can walk to almost everything from this Richmond Street location. We were in town for the U2 concert and the walk to the Rogers Center was a breeze. We stayed three nights in an executive floor king room that I was told had been recently renovated. The colors were subtle and the room tastefully decorated. The bed was oh-so comfortable and the bathroon, though a little on the small side, had granite countertops and very nice contemporary fixtures, I recommend this hotel without reservation and will definitely stay here again when I return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “We are British”
Reviews.Author: Dave418
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton Toronto as part of a package. Nice but typical large chain hotel. A minor nigle but for such a big hotel you get paper cups and two camamile tea bags. After a bit of thinking we managed to make tea with the coffee machine. I supose we could have complained but we were to tired to complain. Other hotels we stayed at asked if we would like a kettle and tea bags wich we thought was odd but now see why.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: manswa
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a good quality, clean hotel. Well equipped, large room with very comfortable king size bed, desk/working area, safe, coffee making facilities, etc. The only thing missing for us was a fridge. Our room had good views over the financial district and whilst situated in the business area it is not far away from the main tourist sites - CN Tower, etc. Room service was good, if a little pricey. We found staff - front desk, waiting staff, room service - to be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton vs Sheraton: Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MaxEntrophy
Reviews.Content: I find that rooms at Hilton and Sheraton in downtown Toronto are often priced similarly so I thought it would be useful to offer a comparison of the distinguishing features of the two hotel. I've stayed at both hotels on a number of occasions and location is not a factor since both hotels are within seconds of each other. In my experience, I have found the rooms at the Hilton to be more spacious than the Sheraton and the bathrooms to be more modern and better appointed. The Sheraton, on the other hand, has a larger pool (especially useful for families) and allows, unlike the Hilton, children to accompany adults to the business lounge after 5:00pm. Overall, when prices are within a few dollars of each other I prefer to stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel even on busy weekend”
Reviews.Author: totraveller12342
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying here again last weekend (June 25/26) and even though the hotel was very very busy my spouse and I had an amazing time. Love the location of the hotel and the beds are sooooo comfy. Great service from the staff from the moment we pulled up. Can't believe/understand some of the negative reviews posted here. Having stayed at hotel several times, the hotel is amazing as are the staff. Love the breakfast/brunch buffet and room service is great too. Views are great from either side of the hotel and if you can upgrade to executive floor - do it. The executive lounge is wonderful! My choice for best hotel in downtown Toronto to take advantage of all the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: nik112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying in Toronto for the first time. We thought we shouldnt cheap out as it was our first time there. We wanted to remember our first trip to Downtown Toronto. The minute We walked in we thought we had made the best choice in hotels. We were very wrong. As we walked into to our room I got a glass from the table to pour myself a glass of water, I found the glass to be stained around the rim and a big smage the size of a golf ball. To top it off while i was putting the glass back, i noticed something was moving. It was a bedbug. I called the front desk and a manager came up. He moved us into a executive room on the 21st floor, we went from 29th to 21st which was fine by us. Getting there we wanted to get some sleep, as we were very tired from travelling. A lot of noise for that high up, I am getting tired from just writing about my stay..........lots more i could write.

Reviews.Title: “excellent you have the good restaurant steak right there”
Reviews.Author: cancunfunny08
Reviews.Content: the best steak right there in the lobby, you only walk to the restaurant dont need to drive any where, is just like room service

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel - excellent location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimosabi
Reviews.Content: We got to Toronto a few times a year but had never stayed at the Hilton. Overall we found it to be a good experience and would return. The room was a good size and was clean. There were some signs of age in the bathroom but it was a just a minor issue. The bed was reasonably comfortable except there was a bit of a sag in the middle of the king. We didn't notice until sleeping on it for a while. I would likely not get a king if returning. We were on the 7th floor and had a nice view of the small herb garden and the pool. The location was great. Easy walking distance to the baseball stadium. The valet parking and front desk staff were very pleasant and efficient. A great night's stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to all attractions.”
Reviews.Author: csumms
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located central to all major attractions with walking distance to ACC, Rogers Centre, Eaton Centre, all theatre and the entertainment district. Pool is not huge but is neat with an indoor/outdoor section. Lots of parking under the hotel. Front entrance is always congested, use the other two entraces to the parking lot to the south and east of the main entrance. Most rooms have been updated but my last visit I had an older room, still clean and spacious. 30th floor with great view, however there is a large condo being built across the street which has cut down on some of the view.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern city hotel”
Reviews.Author: PullmanCritic
Reviews.Content: Situated within central business district and within walking distance of convention center CN Tower, and entertainment district, this is a modern hotel. Room was large and well appointed; higher floors have excellent city views. Executive club is on 32nd floor and provides the usual North American Hilton executive club benefits and hors d'oeuvres in the evening (charge for alcoholic beverages, free sodas). Restaurant for breakfast was average in quality but service was prompt. Room service arrived punctually as well. Staff overall were friendly. Only noteable area for improvement was housekeeping, which was inconsistent in quality across the three days. Also, the housekeeping staff tended to be noisy by 7:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Amyjess
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had our second annual "Moms' weekend in Toronto" and stayed at the Hilton through a Wagjag special that included breakfast, cocktails, and shopping cards. Check-in was fast. The room, an alcove suite, was spacious and the view was fantastic overlooking the pool. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever had at a hotel; absolute heaven!! The breakfast buffet was quite good. Location of the hotel is perfect. We will definitely consider staying here again. A very relaxing, enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely city. But a few niggles.”
Reviews.Author: living-der-life
Reviews.Content: As a Hhonors Gold VIP, I lurched into choosing the Hilton Toronto. And I'm glad I did. I chose a breakfast rate and a King bedded basic room. On arrival, the lady at the Hhonors desk was extremely welcoming, and seemed particularly welcoming on the basis of my Gold card. She upgraded me to a room on the executive levels and told me I was welcome in the Executive Lounge. After a bit of discussion, we were given our breakfast vouchers. The room is lovely. Beautifully appointed and generously proportioned with a great view across to the water and the CN tower. The executive lounge is truly stunning: large windows on either side and a decent selection of cold drinks, tea and coffee. In the evenings, alcohol is available (chargeable) and hot pasta was available. And it was delicious too. The location was great too, within easy walking distance of everything in this beautiful city. But sadly, I must report some niggles with the breakfast. The buffet is in Tundra restaurant on the ground floor: the selection is outstanding including very fresh Eggs Benedict and all the food is of excellent quality. Unfortunately, they insist on serving orange juice to the table, and service is unreliable. This morning we waiting 30 minutes before our first glass of juice was delivered...on request. Yet more worrying still is the insistence of the staff on, as soon as you arrive, that you have to go to the bar where the "buffet is identical". Well yesterday we took their word for it. The bar is dark, dull and the tables are tiny. The food seemed much less fresh (less turnover) and there were no Fruit Loops. Orange juice was available on the buffet, but ran out after our first glass and was never topped up whilst we were there. So in conclusion: great room, outstanding executive lounge and good food at breakfast. But being shunted over to the dark lifeless bar denies an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: meve_11
Reviews.Content: Great location,10 minutes from the Rogers Centre / CN Tower,eaton center, nearby the subway and many stores. The hilton are very nice, clean rooms and spacious. Very comfortable bed ! :) Great view on the CN Tower! Everything was perfect except the pool was closed all the three days we are there, my son was a little disappointed especially with the warm temperature outside, a little swim been appreciated! Otherwise, staff was very courteous! I would go back without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good service”
Reviews.Author: mot29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Toronto for a meeting that was being held across the street at the Sheraton -- much better price and my status at the Hilton tipped the decision. Very comfortable room -- king with club access although on a "lower" (23rd) floor. I'd checked in online and took the "assigned" upgraded room -- an 02 room. When I checked in the desk agent suggested that he could move me to an equivalent room with the same view (north facing) because the 02 rooms back up to the elevator shaft and some guests find them a bit noisy. + for that. Similarly competent service throughout the hotel. Nice club lounge on the 32nd floor. Long hours, free wifi. Pretty good evening food and breakfasts -- boiled eggs, oatmeal, continental type things including two very good artisan bread loaves for slicing. The club attendants (servers), both morning and evening were excellent and are great ambassadors for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissy_gal
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay at the Hilton. We stayed in a King bed Jr Alcove Suite. Looks exactly as in the picture on the site. The bed is big and comfy. Nice sitting area and desk. There is a scenic elevator that faces outside so you get a nice view of the outside on your way up. Tundra restaurant on site is amazing! Had drinks and sliders there for lunch and buffet breakfast the next morning. Great spread of food, highly recommend eating there. Great service overall in the hotel! Parking is $24/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for central Toronto but...”
Reviews.Author: ranger2705
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Toronto that required me to be in the City for 5 nights. I looked at a number of different hotels in the downtown area, but on balance I made the right choice. In summary: Strengths Excellent location, close to subway, opposite the opera house and a quick walk to both the business district and Chinatown. Not too large, the lobby area does not give the impression you are in an airport terminal or shopping mall. Fantastic breakfast spread with good service. Nicely appointed lobby area with free Wifi. Good size rooms with an excellent table (I needed to do some work) Large window brings in lots of natural light and a good view. Responsive. We had some minor defects with the bathroom door which were immediately rectified. Good gym and pool. Weaknesses. The main draw of the hotel was its large windows. Why then do they not clean them? I can understand during the winter months regular cleaning is not required, but as the days grow longer, leaving the windows so dirty is simply an own goal. High price for wired internet connection within room. On balance, happy I made this choice.

Reviews.Title: “So good it should be maple-frosted.”
Reviews.Author: Rompy
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in downtown Toronto. We were able to walk to the Air Canada Centre, CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc. Also has plenty of nearby food options, including The Keg and most importantly... sandwiched between a Timmy Horton's and Starbucks (pick your poison). Also several good nightlife spots from which we stumbled home. Our favorite part of the stay was the 15 minutes spent with David, the concierge. An incredibly knowledgeable and friendly sort of chap!

Reviews.Title: “Another Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Toronto has proved yet again to be a solid choice for an overnight stay while in town for business. I was upgraded to an executive room and thus had access to the lounge both for hors d'ouvres and breakfast. The evening fare was quite good and because of it I didn't need to have supper elsewhere. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were as well. The gym is quite good at the Hilton Toronto as well. All in all another job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rodman4e
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice and has two very good restaurants. My wife and I traveled here for a little vacation and we caught a ball game and enjoyed the Royal Ontario Museum and Medieval Times. In my opinion here are the pros and cons of this hotel: Pros: Location. Right downtown and most things are within walking distance, including Rogers Center. Concierge service. The man who helped us (David, I think) was tremendous. He got us reservations to the ROM and Medieval Times - both at a discounted price. Hotel Room. Very comfortable bed and pillows. The shower head was much better than most hotels I have stayed at. Swimming Pool & Hot Tub. Clean pool and swimming area. The pool in half indoors and half outdoors which is neat. There is also a hot tub which is very nice. Employees. Very accommodating and willing to answer any questions you have. Cons: Internet. You can only gain access via WiFi in the hotel lobby but you need to get a password from the front desk. Also, in room internet is available for around $14 per day. Parking. There is no onsite parking but you can pay $40/day valet or $24/day to park in the attached parking garage. All in all, the Hilton Toronto is a very nice hotel but I feel there are plenty more options that are less expensive and you would get more for your money. The onsite restaurants are pretty expensive. We're not cheap by any means but a meal at the Steakhouse was $60/person and that was their "special" the night we ate there. Other than the cost, I would highly recommend eating there. The Bistro is rather expensive as well - $18 for a hamburger... Anyways, there are plenty of restaurants right around the hotel that are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: ymas2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for almost 10 days - we found the location perfect. 5 - 10 Minutes walk to Union Station, 15 minutes walk to CN Tower, 5 - 10 minutes walk to Eaton Centre...many things were within walking distance. The service was great. We stayed in the Junior Suite and it was a pretty spacious room. There was free wifi in the lobby which was great and access to fitness centre and swimming pool. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mature Couple -”
Reviews.Author: cpflynn
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave us a room by the elevators it was noisy all night but as we stayed just the one night we didn't complain. There is no WIFI in the rooms and the WIFI in the lobby did work well either. We did unfortunately use the hotel valet. They told it was $35 for the night but we could go in and out else $12 each time you left we used the valet parking and then they charged us $40 after quoting us $35. To top it off, we found they damaged the car. They scraped the curb and damaged the bumper where one could not Easily see it and didn't own up to it. They parked it close to the curb where it was not visible when they returned the car. When we noticed the damage the next day and called the hotel to find out if they would do something to address the problem. The manager Erickson told us that if we didn't point it out to them at the time it was our fault. The fact that they hid the damage from us nothing to do with it. It was our problem not the TORONTO HILTON was not responsible. We have a brand new car that didnâ€™t have a scrape before now we have a couple hundred $$ repair bill. They overcharged us and then damaged the car. I will be protesting their bill on our credit card both for the room and the valet parking. I would not recommend the TORONTO HILTON hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Comfortable stay but.....”
Reviews.Author: Businesstravellerr8
Reviews.Content: Two gripes: 1) No wireless in the rooms - very annoying. 2) Breakfast is awful. Rubbish food and copiously overpriced. Concierge staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place tp stay whilst in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Jinxysmaw
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Hilton two weekends in a row. Both times were noted to be very pleasant experiences the only downside...... one nights stay is not enough to enjoy the amenities. From the beautiful fragrance on entering the hotel to the pleasant & courteous staff at the reception desk . Even housekeeping staff who we encountered on the 12 & 14th floors were pleasant. I recommend The Hilton and a bonus is the very comfortable beds and the magnifying mirrors in the bathrooms were an assett.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in nicely renovated room”
Reviews.Author: REDLondon1959
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and looked great due to the recent renovations. Having space is important to me and it can be hard to find larger rooms, particularly in the downtown area. Rates were competive and the location puts you close enough to walk to the entertainment area and plenty of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Hilton in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: meldaigle_2000
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton hotel in Toronto was very nice. The room was big and clean. The bed was very confortable. The only thing that I noticed was that the bathroom counter could have been cleaner...but overall, my experience at the Hilton hotel in Toronto was wonderful and I would recommend it to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PaulSimmons8
Reviews.Content: I was trying to make changes to a reservation at the Toronto Hilton and must say I had nothing but problems. It took me over an hour of dropped calls, calls forwarded to several people who had no idea why I would be forwarded to them, and then one instance where no one answered the phone at the hotel at all for over 10 minutes. I was very surprised to find this level of service at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Robsmodern
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night. There initially was a problem with the booking (the online service gave the hotel the wrong night) but the staff were friendly and honoured our intention regardless. Typical of the good service that I have experienced recently with Hilton. The hotel itself was great. Nice big room, clean bathroom. Fantastic bed too ... good thing I don't have the same one at home, or I'd never leave. Location is great. Around the corner from all the major tourist attractions, culture, and nightlife, and you're practically on top of the subway. Would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hilton, love the Executive Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: researchnerd
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hilton Toronto in early February and was quite impressed with the property. A friend and I were going for dinner in Toronto and since we both lived out of town we decided that getting a hotel would be the best idea. Unfortunately arrival at the hotel was not the greatest, we booked over the phone at Hiltonâ€™s central reservation number and the individual we spoke to did not have many details about the Hilton Torontoâ€™s facilities. We were promised valet parking as my friend had a truck too tall to fit into most underground garages. When we pulled up we were informed that there was no valet or reserved spots for oversized vehicles, the porter was friendly about it and directed us to a neighbouring outdoor lot. Upon checking in the front desk continued to apologize for the mistake and even upgraded us to a nice room on the executive floor. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable, I do believe they were doubles though, and I think most 4 star hotels should have queens. Not sure what the difference in the layouts of the rooms is between the executive floors and regular ones, but having access to the executive lounge was great. In the evening a wide variety of snacks, appetizers and pastries were available, along with an honor bar. The computers were all being used but the views of the city (i.e. other buildings and a partial glimpse of the lake) were pretty good. After dinner in Toronto followed by drinks in a bar we returned to the Hilton around 2am, and were confronted by large groups of people milling about the lobby. I guess since itâ€™s close to the clubbing district lots of partiers meet up in the lobby and wait for taxis?? I donâ€™t know, but at least the hotel had a security guard checking for room keys before you could board the elevators. Our package included breakfast the next morning, we choose to dine at the Tundra buffet. Nothing special about the food, typical hotel breakfast fare with watery eggs and overcooked bacon, not worth the $20 I believe it costs. The waiter was also a jerk, expecting greater than a $5 tip for 2 people when he did not come to the table once to clean up our used plates or offer us more coffee. On our way out we stopped in at the executive lounge once again, the breakfast trays set up there looked much better than Tundra, and the coffee/cappuccino maker was a great way to end the stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: totraveller12342
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Hilton Toronto in February and the only bad part of my stay was that I was only there for one night. From the time I entered the hotel I felt welcomed and enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel with the candles in the lobby, the music, the cool vibe, etc. Loved loved the beds. So comfortable and had a great night sleep. Location is very convenient and can't say enough about how much I enjoyed my stay there. No hesitation about recommending this hotel. Also was able to have an amazing dinner at their restaurant in the lobby, Tundra. Worth every penny - the best meal I have had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “If possible, I hope to always stay at a Hilton hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kim_McGill
Reviews.Content: We got our executive suite on special and boy was it worth it. The bed itself was incredibly comfortable and those pillows were to die for. The room was fantastic but the best part was access to the executive lounge which pretty much provided a delicious free breakfast and light thing. On top of that, the food provided was generally vegetarian-friendly! The location was perfect; we didn't have to use public transportation at all since everything was walking distance away. Lastly, the staff was amazingly helpful and helped us have a wonderful weekend that we won't forget. And of course, next time we go to Toronto we'll be staying at this hotel again,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, technology lacking.”
Reviews.Author: Hurls55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located in downtown Toronto. The staff and the service they provided were excellent!! The rooms were quite nice. However, the street noise was clearly audible from a 12th floor room. The hotel has underground parking which is relatively expensive ($30/day), but convenient. The hotel staff advised that if you just parked using the same lot and entered publicly without the hotel system, it costs $24/day. The restaurants are extremely pricey, but staff suggested other less expensive eating places very near by. There is internet service available in room, but it is wired and not wireless. As well, the price is ~$15 per day a little higher than most hotels with wireless access available. All-in-all, this hotel was quite clean and the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at the Toronto Hilton”
Reviews.Author: travbuddy_28
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Hilton. I stayed just across the street at a rival hotel for a different business meeting a few months ago, and this hotel was far better. The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating, the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the bathroom was modern with a great shower (double shower head), and the temperature in the room was very easy to adjust. The meeting rooms are also excellent, and the location is convenient. Even minor details like the black and white architectural photos on the walls were carefully selected, adding to the pleasing atmosphere. I will gladly choose this hotel again on subsequent trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Badb88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Toronto over the weekend and were very happy. The rooms were very nice. We were in a junior suite outstanking. A very large sitting area, wih the nicest business desk I have seen in a hotel. Bed was very comfortable. The negatives all though minor. The halls were out of control with partiers, they were very loud. But they left for the clubs about 11:00 and never heard them again. Also we ate breakfast at the buffet in the Tundra Restaurant. It was very weak! Very little choice and not even hot. Really disappointed for a Hilton Hotel. Other then that it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen_24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a GEM! I was a Hilton employee so I got a discount, and the rooms were fabulous. We asked for two adjoining rooms (which we didn't get) but we had rooms that were side by side, and one room was about 6 feet longer than the other room (both with 2 queen beds), so we had extra space in that one room to hang out. Great business downtown location, short cab ride to ACC and bars/nightlife. Nice lobby, very professional staff, I have stayed here twice and do not want to look any furthur when it comes to staying over in Toronto. This place does the job nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: jwsmd3
Reviews.Content: With the executive lounge for breakfast/ evening snack, etc, this was a flawless choice for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but little focus on the smaller details”
Reviews.Author: Ontarian222
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel. The first time I was very impressed with the service and accomodations that this hotel offered so I thought I'd give it a second try. Overall, I was pleased with my stay but I didn't get the same "wow" factor that some other hotels offer. When I made my reservation, I had requested a room on a high floor with one of the rooms offering a special "rain shower." The girl that was checking me in seemed to be in a hurry and assigned me a room that didn't meet either of my small requests, which was surprising considering how empty the hotel appeared to be that night. In addition, the hotel staff seemed very snobby which added to the cold and uninviting feeling of the hotel. Seeing as there are many other great hotels in Toronto, I will be staying at one of them when I return to the city in the future.

Reviews.Title: “4 star rating? Really?”
Reviews.Author: maira_k
Reviews.Content: I've been a huge fan of the Hilton chain. Fallsview Hilton is hands down one of the best hotels that I've stayed at, and is my hotel of choice anytime I'm in the Niagara region (which is quite often!) and I recommend it to ALL my friends who've also went on to stay there and loved it. That said, I was excited about my stay at the Hilton Downtown for my birthday. I figured it would be a treat, getting to stay in the heart of downtown, with everything at a walking distance. Boy was I in for a surprise. From the moment I arrived, the service was anything but the 4 star quality I've become accustomed to at the Fallsview Hilton. We were told I had the option of one of TWO rooms: A smoking room, or a room with a single bed, and they'd put in a "cot" for my friend. My friend's allergic to smoke, and a "cot" was definitely not the quality of sleep my friend and I were looking forward to. Now this is in the middle of June, nowhere close to any big events like new year's, so the I found the availability spiel a bit ridiculous. Moreover, when I requested that I speak to the manager, I was told he/she was unavailable. And worst all was the attitude of the front-desk staff! I've NEVER had to put up with anything like that, and I've had to stay at some really cheap hotels the odd time out! Was it because my friend and I are young so we were automatically assumed to be not worthy of good service? We're PAYING guests for crying out loud! Granted, we booked our stay on the "discount website" hotwire, but really, if there's a different standard for treating guests who book through those sites, maybe you should not be affiliated with these sites at all! Long story short, I was very, very disappointed, and especially because I've always had great things to say about Hilton hotels. I'm definitely not recommending this hotel to anyone, and especially not my friends and family. I'm sticking to recommending Fallsview Hilton and not the "Hilton" chain since there's such a vast difference in the quality of service. My two cents: get the staff from Fallsview to come down and train at least the front desk staff at the Toronto location! The service turned us off so much, that we barely enjoyed the room or whatever else the hotel had to offer. Only came back to the hotel to sleep, and get out first thing in the morning! I wish I hadn't paid up front so I could have taken my business elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 7Am to the hotel. I tried to check in early and was lucky enough to have my room ready! So did my two other colleagues. I was not in my room very often due to being there for business but the time spent in the hotel was good and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “reading previous reviews made us apprehensive”
Reviews.Author: salmonangler
Reviews.Content: After reading through these reviews, we were were bracing ourselves for a disappointment....BUT NO, everything was fine from the moment we parked, checked in, found our room spotless on 13th floor, quiet and very comfortable beds to boot. From the reviews, the hotel's GM takes the time and pays attention to his customers. We highly recommend this hotel just across from the new opera house. Bravo Hilton Downtown Toronto...

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted! No better than a cheap motel.”
Reviews.Author: dazzlin
Reviews.Content: I have been booking 4 star hotels in Toronto over the last 3 or 4 months through Hotwire which doesn't let you know where you're staying until after you've paid. This time we got the Hilton and when we checked in, they informed us they DO have smoking rooms so being smokers, we thought GREAT! This doesn't happen often anymore. Off we went to our room and were DISGUSTED! I had not read any reviews because ITS THE HILTON! It should be GREAT! But wow, this was far from great. We went down to the check-in counter and were informed that the renovations to the smoking rooms would be done after they stopped guests from having the option to smoke in the rooms. And they figure that would be at the end of December. My beef is that when I pay for a room that is 4 star, I expect a 4 star room. The coffee maker, while modern, had no instructions on how to use it so that was useless. The carpet (Room 1520) was torn, stained and generally disgusting. It was no better than that of a cheap motel. The noises coming from the other rooms around and above us disturbed us all night including an incessant knocking at 3 am!?!?!? Out of the 4 hotel rooms we stayed in over the past 3 months, this was the worst and we expected the best. :( So disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and elegant Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ZacEU
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night on a trip from NYC up into Canada through Niagara Falls. As my reviews show I am a big Hilton fan and try to stay in them whenever possible. Parking is available under the hotel for a good price, equivalent to the private parking halls found nearby but with the added convenience of a lift directly to the hotel. This room was booked at a good rate and using my Gold VIP we upgraded to an Executive room. When we walked in our jaws dropped as the room was gigantic - easily the largest I've ever stayed in and probably as big as our entire apartment at home! The view was stunning, the room simply but elegantly furnished. All amentities were of a high standard and it seemed the room and entire hotel had been refurbished. The lobby hall reflects this as does the Executive Lounge which was a pleasure - internet freely available, bright and spacious with a constantly stocked drink and food range. The view here topped even that of our room. The location of the hotel was very good and a short walk to the metro station. Toronto is a big city so this was essential. The staff were very friendly and we left with a smile on our faces.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.... not so great everything else. "Simple" rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cac1005
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Uncomfortable beds! The Duvet was old and clumpy, making it impossible to have a good night's sleep. (Really... These need to be replaced!) The room was bare, bathroom and bar area small. It felt very "simple". At check in, we asked for 2 beds, we were told none were available. After check in my travel partner told me that the group behind us was offerd the opportunity to wait 20 mins for 2 beds.... I woudl have taken that option. However... what was very positive about the hotel was it's location. And it was clean. There are much nicer hotels in downtown toronto that are nicer, cleaner and similar in cost though. I'd stay there next time; I wouldnot return to the Hilton. It just does not meet the expectation. I've stayed in many hotels all over the world from top hotels in Europe to Small town Inns. Aside from location, the scenic elevator, and nice lobby, it was very average.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Toronto! And my favorite Hilton!!!”
Reviews.Author: anniemark99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. I have been traveling to Toronto the entire year of 2010... and will have stayed 39 times - usually Monday thru Thursday. The staff is very helpful and friendly... its nice to see familiar faces as much as I travel. The renovated rooms are wonderful... the gym has a great assortment of cardio equipment, machines and free weights. The location is great... 5 minutes from the Gardiner Expressway... walking distance to the Air Canada Center, Rogers Center, CN Tower and the subway line... as well as many restaurants and shopping. And on those overly cold/rainy nights - there are three restaurant options within the hotel. I've dined at Tundra and Ruth's Chris - both were fabulous and the wait staff are great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location...”
Reviews.Author: matrxica
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel since its renovations and enjoyed my stay. The location is excellent, right in the entertainment district near shopping, bars, and restaurants. The hotel is very clean with a relaxing lobby with its Zen like theme. The king size bed was awesome and the rooms were clean. My disappointment during the second stay was that the room I had did not have a shower stall like the one during my first stay. Also, once again, I found the hotel restaurant to be quite expensive and the service was pathetic during breakfast - there was only one server. I waited for 15 minutes before I had to go speak to the hostess to request some service. This should not be happening at a hotel of a 4 star caliber - especially when the expectation is to get excellent service for the prices they charge. I hope the management improves on this aspect. Until then, the suggestion is to go to other nearby restaurants with better service and relatively much cheaper. Other than that, I did enjoy the hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location! Love the updated bathrooms and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in November 2010. Loved the updates to the room and bathroom (we had stayed here before a very long time ago... maybe 8 or 9 years ago now). The bathroom now has a glass wall enclosure instead of a tub and shower curtains. The shower has a ceiling spout or a handheld spout whose height can be adjusted at the front wall of the shower stall. The BEST shower I've had in a hotel EVER! You can actually adjust the pressure high enough to get all the shampoo and conditioner out very quickly. You can also adjust the temperature of the water via actual numeric gauges on the handles (unfortunately only written in Farenheit, not Celsius). All the staff were very nice: when I walked through the front doors, at check-in, everytime I walked in or out of the hotel, at breakfast in the main restaurant adjacent to the main foyer. One down-side was that they wouldn't grant me a late check-out. I had brunch that morning with a friend, who showed up slightly late. So my plans to pack after brunch were going to be a bit hurried. I had for an extra 30 minutes, but unfortunately, they couldn't give it to me. I think it had to do with the Santa Claus parade going on that afternoon. I managed to check out just after noon with no penalties. So that was nice of them. Brunch buffet was on the better side of average for a hotel. Coffee and orange juice tasted fresh. There was lipstick on my coffee mug. Luckily I didn't wear any that morning so I could tell for certainty that it wasn't mine. They gave me a new mug immediately with a huge apology. Best things about the hotel: 1) about 1 block from subway station, 2.5 blocks from about 3 different Starbucks (one just south on University Ave, 2nd just south and east on Adelaide Street, 3rd just north and east on Queen St and a block further east would get you to The Bay and The Eaton Centre!). Note the location of the Starbucks because you get free wifi access, which you don't get for free in the hotel room! 2) the showers and the water pressure level 3) the panoramic view elevators (I only managed to ride it once during my stay, but it was enough). 4) the $7 cab ride from Union Station (train), the 2 minute walk to Queen St cars and subway stations! Worst things about the hotel: 1) no WIFI in room for free 2) have to pay for local calls made in-room

Reviews.Title: “Bizarrely poor service for a Hilton -- so many other better options”
Reviews.Author: CanDoc1976
Reviews.Content: This was very strange experience at what is supposed to be, but isn't, a five-star hotel. At arrival, there are no staff outside the front doors. Eventually a guy comes out and tells me there is *NO VALET* at this 'five-star' Hilton hotel. There's also no more space in the parking garage, so now I'm late for the conference while I cruise the financial district to find parking. The executive level room is adequate but no minibar, and decorated -- inexplicably -- in an early 80's orange-brown. The room is dark and cold when I arrive, like they weren't expecting me. The little things just continue on from there: there's no bathrobe in the room; calling the front desk results in a recorded message telling me to hold; there are *NO BATH TOWELS* in the room (more holding before I can talk to the front desk); I get three bottles of conditioner but no shampoo; housekeeping doesn't replace bottled water and it takes 3 phone calls and 4 hours to get more; the clock radio tells the wrong time and can't be reset without a screw driver; the pool is empty except for a ladder and construction debris, etc, etc. Summary: Hilton has their act so badly together, they have no business charging luxury hotel rates, especially when any of Fairmont, Four Seasons, Park Hyatt, Sheraton or Westin can easily do better. You know, funny thing: on check out, the desk staff woman _never_ asked "How was your stay?". Perhaps she's tired of hearing an honest answer.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotyogagirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the executive level which allowed me and a guest to use the executive lounge, a real perk. The views and location were terrific. The room was clean, and the bed very comfortable. For the price I thought this was good value since it's a walking distance to downtown meetings, restaurants, and fun stores!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: AHMED81
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. we had to wait almost 1 hour for the check-in and then we met with the front desk manager who tried his best to speed up the matter. then he sent for us a bottel of wine and 2 cards to access the Lounge. so after all we were not upset. the location is amazing in the city center. few steps away from the underground station. i will stay there again next time

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hallways resulted in frustrating stay”
Reviews.Author: stratfordinnowner
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this hotel was not quiet enough to allow for restful sleep. There was excessive noise in the hallways from 2-4am, and then again at 6am. When I called to complain in the morning, I was told that there were many noise complaints that night. We booked this hotel on Hotwire, so fortunately we didn't pay full price for our room. Parking was tricky, due to construction, and the pool was closed for maintenance. On a plus side, the parking was only $24 for the weekend (we opted for no in/out access), and the hotel is centrally located with updated, clean rooms and friendly cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to experience Toronto, Ontario stay at Hilton Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Vegasgentleman
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I stayed at the Hilton for six evenings and must say the service, room, and the cleanliness of the hotel was supurb. The view of Toronto from the rooms were grand and the staff at the Executive Suite Lounge were friendly, courteous, and knowledgable about the city. If you do plan to travel to Toronto the Hilton conceirge service will provide the information necessary to put your mind at ease. The only downside to the Hotel was finding that their restaurants a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LovetoGolfMontreal
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire for a weekend in Toronto. For the price I payed I think it was fantastic! We stayed in the newer rooms, they have been redoing all the rooms. The one we stayed in was clean, spacious, bathrooms really nice and clean. I was surprised to see how well sonorised the rooms were because their were a few parties going on on our floor and could not hear a thing in our room. The hotel is well situated in the restaurant and shopping district. The staff were very polite and eager to please wich that is a plus! We did not try any of the restaurants within the Hotel but hurd that they were pretty good. The only downfall is the parking, way expensive! Thats where they make the $$..be prepared to pay 30$/day before tx's. Part from that it was great

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location and a great base for seeing Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Kashla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Toronto with my husband for 4 nights. This is a great hotel. The rooms are spacious. We had a Junior corner suite. The decor is a little dated but the rooms are very clean and quiet. The hotel is in an excellent location. It is really close to all the sights, shopping and night life. Everywhere is accesible on foot from here. Try to get breakfast included as part of the deal as it is very expensive to have it added onto the bill. The hotel has an outdoor pool and gym. It also has a little shop for any forgotten items/ souvenirs. We used the business centre. There was a small charge for this but it was a quiet private room. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again if we were in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: chareng70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with 3 teenies. The staff were all very friendly, specially the Executive Lounge staff. Rooms were clean and big enough. Now the strange part is the Executive Lounge.Since they start serving alcohol at 5, no kids are allowed inside the Executive Lounge -not even with parents. It's the canadian law, but they allowed us to take some drinks and snacks for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton...”
Reviews.Author: pavlovsdawg
Reviews.Content: There are good things and bad things and bad things that come with being a Hilton (good: points, solid beds, clean and easy check in; bad: CHARGE FOR WIFI, not a unique experience) The staff at this hotel was very accommodating and kind. I came in on a red eye and they had a room ready for my even though it was a few hours early. Sure it's not as cool or fun as the Drake or the Le Germain but it's fantastic for a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: lionsfan1999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of my birthday weekend. Upon check - in we casually mentioned it was my birthday to the desk clerk, Mark. We went up to our room on the 20th floor and were delighted with the room. We then left for our afternoon in the city. When we returned to the room, we were surprised to see that the hotel had delivered a birthday surprise to us in the form of 2 fresh desserts!!!!! This was above and beyond anything we had expected. The hotel is in an excellent area if you are in town for a play. It is a short walk to King Street. We dined at N'Awlins on King and it was fantastic as well. Parking was a bit tricky because of the renovations they are doing, but we didn't have a problem getting from the parking lot to the hotel. The room was large and had fantastic amenities. The bed was comfortable. My only complaints would be that there was not a fridge in the room and also at about 3am a bunch of drunk people were yelling in the halls (nothing the Hilton can do about that though). I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay with basic amenities. Worst parking experience!”
Reviews.Author: doraemon1023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night. Here are the pros: The room was 2921 on the executive floor, and it was clean, modern, bright and spacious. The bed was nice and firm, and the pillows were comfortable. The coffee machine was good. We were able to see parts of the CN Tower, just that the weather didn't corporate during our stay. We were at the end of the hallway, so it was very quiet. Location of the hotel was convenient too. Few complaints here. We had initially requested a double bed non-smoking room. They ran out of the double bed rooms, so we were given a non-smoking king bedroom instead. The front desk was friendly, and promised to bring us a cot bed, but unfortunately it never came. A bit disappointed, but since it was only one night, we didn't bother requesting again. Amenities were basic. There were only 2 sets of towels, we ended up calling room service for more towels. There were no bathroom fans. Also no bottled water, no mini-fridge, no wi-fi, no newspaper outside our door in the morning. The biggest problem was parking. We parked at the gargage at night just right beside the hotel entrance on Richmond Street. The gargage inside was extremely dark at night, may be they were trying to conserve power or something so they dimmed the lights, it was very difficult and dangerous to drive down there. We had a hard time looking for elevators to come back up the street level. We ended up getting our way out of the garage at the back of the hotel alley. It was late at night and we felt extremely unsafe. After checkout on the next day, we tried many ways to go back down the parking level where we parked our car, walking up and down the stairs, including the suggestions from the help desk, still not successful. We ended up finding our car back after one hour, carrying our luggages, following the exact driving route as we did the night before, except ON FOOT! It was simply the worst indoor parking lot experience I have ever had! The parking elevator inside the hotel simply could not get us down the same location as we parked. Initially we thought it would be the most convent to park right beside the hotel, apparently it's not the case. You would better off parking your car at Green P right beside the City Hall! We booked the room through Priceline, and so the price was good for the value. However I would think it would be too pricey for the room's worth if paid full rack price.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Everything I Needed to Accomplish”
Reviews.Author: CedarConsulting
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located right in the middle of the Toronto business district. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel clean and bright. The convenient parking allowed me to leave the car and literally walk to all my appointments. This is my new base of operations in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing :-(”
Reviews.Author: Tych0Brahe
Reviews.Content: The Hilton stay at the end of a long driving holiday was meant to be our bit of luxury, but it was quite disappointing. Reading other reviews, it looks like we also got one of the "yet to be renovated" rooms - perhap I should have complained with the possibility of getting an upgrade!! The location was quite good, but I was also disappointed by the level of service. I'm used to a concierge service that will do as much for you as they can. These guys treated us like we were an inconvenience! The concierge staff we had contact with were very young, and completely unable to assist us to get to a College Hockey game, and even to find a supermarket! The HUGE extra charge for internet access ($15 a day!!) was ridiculous, and just made us feel ripped off. Next time we're in the area, we'll be looking for a smaller boutique place as they are generally much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Stay”
Reviews.Author: SudburyRunner
Reviews.Content: I really wish I read some of these reviews BEFORE booking this hotel....I wouldn't have stayed here otherwise. I'm in town to run a half marathon tomorrow and I can only hope I can sleep through the night, however, the paper thin walls may make this an impossible event. Luckily, I brought my ear plugs. I've always stayed at the Delta Chelsea downtown and can't say I've ever been able to hear my neighbours like I can at the Hilton. I am truly disappointed in this hotel. The rates are high and for that I expect a great bang for my buck....hopefully I don't hear any of 'that' later tonight...ugh! I'm thankful I didn't bring my children on this trip, as the pool is closed for renovations and the frat house/dorm room atmosphere isn't ideal. The street noise is incredible...I'm on the 10th floor. The room is okay...nothing to write home about. There's no microwave, or fridge and my window is covered with greasy forehead marks and handprints...ew....windex the thing. Upon checkout, I'll communicate my disappointment, express that I will not recommend this dump and suggest they clean the windows. I'm not impressed.....do not stay here, unless you're looking for a party place...then it's right up your alley!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was exactly as described, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cooperdoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Toronto for an overnight stay and found the Hilton to be very accomodating. There is so much of Toronto to discover that we try to stay in a different section of the city each time we visit. The Hilton was only a few blocks from the Eaton Shopping centre (the primary reason for our trip...shopping!) and a few other interesting attractions. We were going to dine at the Ruth Chris steakhouse (right inside the Hilton), but due to time constraints ended up eating at the Keg Steakhouse right up the road (excellent food as well). The hotel was exactly as we expected, very modern, clean, and friendly staff. Basically, exactly as we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected given the reviews”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stay in Hilton Family hotels at least once a week. This particular Hilton was very nice. I was in 2818 and the room was clean, modern, spacious and everything I would expect in a Hilton. My only complaint, and it is a VERY minor complaint is that I'm a super-duper-Diamond-whatever member and I would have liked a room on the other side of the hotel that faced the water, SkyDome, Tower, etc.... for the view. I didn't know to ask as I'd not stayed there before.

Reviews.Title: “Way below average”
Reviews.Author: AnonymusLondon
Reviews.Content: Apparently I had one of the "due to be renovated" rooms, but at over $300/night I was truly shocked to check in after a very long trip and a very long day to find that there was not even a minibar or let alone a bottle of water in the room. It was late, I was tired and just wanted some water, before going to bad, but it was not to be had (without calling room service). The carpet was badly stained and dirty. The room was so sparse, that it looked like someone had broken in and stolen all the furniture. Whichever furniture was left, was old and dirty. Paint was peeling off the walls and the bathroom suite must have been over a decade old. And this was a junior suite. As per previous reviews, the soundproofing is non-existent and you can hear everything. Admittedly, the location is great and the staff was rather pleasant. Unless I had no other choice, I would not return. I fully understand that the rooms is going to be refurbished, but that does not justify leaving a full paying guest without even the option of having a glass of water without calling room service. I would also recommend anyone staying here to request a room far away from the lift and the ice vending machine, as unless you are a heavy sleeper, you can hear every single guest filling up their ice bucket.

Reviews.Title: “Am disappointed that an Executive Club room was in the state it was in.”
Reviews.Author: RubyWooNYC
Reviews.Content: I am not too familiar with Hilton hotels and the level of service. I booked this solely for a business event that brought me to Toronto; this was the closest venue. Check in was ok. The young woman who took care of me was very pleasant, and helpful in seeing that I was given a non-smoking room. Once in the room, I could not believe how bare, cold, old and drab it felt and actually was. No bottled water, no turndown service, no slippers, no robe. NO MINI-BAR. I was on the top floor, an alleged Executive level floor, and the room felt like a big, cold soul-less room. Bathroom had peeling paint and did not look too clean. Wore my flip-flops while in the shower. I called for soap and it took over one hour. I called for my dinner tray to be picked up, it never was. I eventually left it outside, cant say how long it was out there. Not the most comfortable stay, sadly. I will not book this hotel again, and I won't recommend it for business. The wi-fi in the room was fine for about 10 minutes, then dropped out too many times. Couldn't get help, even after two phone calls. The hotel is a bit overwhelming in terms of size and layout, but in a fairly good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Everything!”
Reviews.Author: WDS717
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September. Everything about this hotel was perfect. The location was great! The rooms were clean and fresh. The staff was extremely helpful. Thankfully, we got a great rate through priceline, but it would have been worth the full price to stay there. We had a great room on the 25th floor that overlooked the city and the harbor. We were right by the subway which made travel to and from the airport and around the city easy and convenient. HIGHLY recommend for a couple for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “VERY thin walls, people go here to party”
Reviews.Author: wsujen
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, comfortable beds, nice staff, location Cons: NOISY, NOISY, NOISY, caters to party-goers I had a terrible experience at this hotel. My husband and I chose the Hilton because we were on a romantic getaway and wanted a hotel that would be upscale and luxurious. Well, our first night there (a Friday) we were awoken every few hours by loud, drunk 20-somethings returning to their rooms. The next morning, we asked someone at the front desk for a quieter room and were upgraded to the business-level floor, which was nice. However the walls were still extremely thin on the business-level floor. The only reason it was quiet was that the guests there were more polite. There are 2 problems that lead to this level of noise: 1) the walls of the hotel are EXTREMELY thin, doors are not insulated. This hotel was just not built in a proper way. 2) the guests, for some reason, feel that the Hilton is a place to stay when they want to party in the city. I have never seen so many young men and women standing around the lobby at 11 pm (when my husband and I were coming BACK to our room), ready to go out and party. They then came back at 3 or 4 in the morning completely drunk. I do not know why these guests are choosing the hotel but the Hilton Toronto seems to be catering to this kind of clientele, which leads to a bad experience for the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great business location with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: WanttoGetoutMore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the G20 Summit! They were well-prepared and it felt like it was business-as-usual. The concierge had great recommendations and the accomodations were just great!

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: winedown1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Toronto for 1 night Sept. 22nd. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. To start off, no shuttle. We couldn't believe a hotel chain in a city the size of Toronto wouldn't provide shuttle service. The rooms are sparsely decorated and worn. We actually had mildew in our shower. The rooms look like they have been decorated from a thrift store. Bring your own pillow, theirs are flat and uncomfortable. We had just traveled from Niagara Falls where we stayed at a Hilton property. I wrote a review of that property as well. It was excellent. That is why we were so suprised that this hotel was not up to par. No free computer access in their bussiness center, no newspaper outside our door in the morning. No mini bar. Not even a corkscrew in the room. This hotel is way over priced for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel right in the center of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ewh211
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times, and I've never been disappointed. The rooms are always clean. I like the modern furnishing and decor of the rooms, and the beds are extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: trippin_it_up
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hilton not far from subway and restaurants. Well kept and trendy - reminded me of a Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hiker100
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern and clean hotel. Great decor. Beautiful and comfortable rooms and beds. Friendly professional staff (except concierge who was not very helpful or knowledgable but that seemed to be an outlier). Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Tundra restaurants located in hotel very convenient. Only ate at Tundra which was excellent but a little pricey. Great fitness center with free weights, machines and cardio. Nice pool too. Parking is $30/day. Conveniently located in the center of city not far from shopping at Eaton Center. 15 min walk to Air Canada Arena for sports.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service from beginning to end, a complete failure”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxbound
Reviews.Content: My wife went up to Toronto for a weekend getaway and since she is a Diamond VIP and I'm Gold, we figured we'd spend some points and spend time at the Hilton Toronto. Huge mistake.
