They under staff so there was a wait for everything, our room was not cleaned, it was damaged, (electrical wiring hanging out, and the Exec club is a joke. I live on the road and have stayed at dozens of hotels in this price range, and this was embarrassingly bad. We wrote a long letter to Hilton detailing our experience hoping for some decent feedback, got a two line response and no follow up. First bad experience with Hilton, so don't be fooled by the location (great), this Hilton is a cut below. Stay nearby somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Christina1205
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has a fantastic location and very comfortable rooms, it was the exceptional service at the downtown Hilton that made our stay such a pleasure. Little things, such as the front desk staff remembering our names after seeing us later in the day after check-in, to delivering adapters to our room while we were away, to helping us with our bags after we checked out, the staff went above and beyond what I normally expect from a chain hotel. The staff were exceptionally helpful -- five-star service from a reasonable four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton offers terrific location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tosca027
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Hilton is beautifully located to explore all the sites of Toronto using the convenient subway system (a station is literally across the street from the hotel) or streetcar system. The lobby is very beautiful with great use of wood, stone and alabaster. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel's restaurant, Tundra, is exceptional with excellent service and food, and another restaurant option onsite is Ruths Chris Toronto. My room was quite large and well appointed and was located on an upper floor. My room looked south toward the lake which was visible through the downtown office towers. I was particularly interested in theater, opera, etc. This hotel is the best place to stay as the beautiful new Opera House (Four Seasons Performing Arts Center - home of the Canadian Opera and Canadian Ballet) was across the street and other theaters including the Royal Alexandra Theatre and symphony hall (home of the Toronto Symphony) were a very short walk from the hotel. Museums such as the Royal Ontario Museum are easily accessible via subway or streetcar -- and these systems are fun to ride and quite safe. I hadn't been to Toronto in 25 years and downtown is a revelation with beautiful buildings such as a collection of 4 Mies Van der Rohe towers -- all within a short walk of the hotel. Attractions such as the CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, the "Bay", Eaton Centre, City Hall, etc. are all within an easy walk of the hotel -- yet other shopping areas such as the York area are a short subway ride away. The new, very upscale Shangri La Hotel and private residences are being built across the street which underscores the great location of the Toronto Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed. Not up to Hilton standards at all.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHiltonGuest
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond HHonors member and have been for several years. I travel all over the world on business and pleasure with Hilton. This is simply not up to Hilton standards at all with very poor guest service focus. I got a strong impression of a hotel trying to squeeze every cent in profit at the expense of guest enjoyment and providing Hilton standard amenities. Room: no minibars in any room; executive room - paint peeling from ceiling; bathroom extractor fan choking full of dust; chipped and stained furniture; bed comfortable; used glasses from my second night left out with contents in them for the rest of my stay. Several requests to speak to hotel management were ignored. Calls to room service for drinks to be brought to the room as no minibar in the room were answered by an helpful "we are not allowed to bring drinks to the room". The same request in person at the front desk in the evening obtained the same reply. Nearly 20 dollars for a cold sandwich on room service and no drinks is ok As there are plenty of nearby fast food joints to choose from. Staff generally helpful but clearly let down by poorly focused management If you're paying for an executive room don't bother. The lounge breakfast is continental only. There is no afternoon tea as in other hiltons worldwide and all the alcoholic drinks are charged for so all you really get is soft drinks and deep fried canapes. I have never written a review in this site before as I have always been so happy with Hilton. On this trip everything failed at every level. The location the best thing about this hotel Oh, before I forget, the pool has sediment gathering on it's floor due to poor or lack of cleaning, the concrete is literally crumbling off he walls into the pool and you can see the rebars pushing through. The whole outside pool deck area is 2 to 3 star standard with no service and dirty. Hilton, please move in on this hotel which is just not up to your standards... Executive lounge

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown. Had a fantasic stay.”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_46383
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary when I saw some of the negative reviews on here. I was there over Labour Day weekend and had a great time. There are cons...but they were minor: The internet was horrible, the parking expensive, the lobby minimal. But I expect expensive parking in a downtown environment (although if it were free or cheap I would give this place 5 stars). Wired internet was horrible at $15 per day. I canceled the hotels and found an outside wireless source for $9 a day. I don't hang out much in hotel lobbies but it was sparse. OK, we have the bad stuff out of the way (which was MINOR!) First, I got the hotel on priceline by bidding $85. At this price point, it was very much worth it. Full price and I would have had more complaints. The staff was excellent! The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. I was really impressed. We were in 903 and the room was beautiful and had a wonderful view of the CN tower. The bed was excellent. The only thing we wished was that there were a small fridge in the room....no biggie, but it would have been nice. The bathroom was large and very clean. Room service was accommodating to our late departures. The location was fantastic. We drove several places and then took the subway (1 block away) to Dundas and Yonge Streets. Great time! I would recommend and return to this hotel. We never experienced any of the problems other people mentioned. It is hard to complain though when you get a great downtown hotel for the price we did. Great job Hilton! We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seemed like a "boutique" hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllenA720
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in the King West area of downtown, this Hilton is convenient and within walking distance of all the attractions and restaurants we needed in this short weekend trip. The ease of parking under the hotel without first checking in was a bonus as was the later automated garage parking check out. The public spaces and lobby were busy but not manic and loud. Maybe it was the design or the lighting or the demeanor of the personnel, but this hotel seemed smaller and more boutique-like. The staff we encountered were impeccable in their appearance and helpful. The upper hallways were extraordinarily quiet and the room (an upgrade at check-in) while standard Hilton fare was immaculate. The workout facility and pool were well appointed. A very pleasant couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “The Best I've Stayed At In Toronto”
Reviews.Author: DetMI
Reviews.Content: In my lifeftime I've stayed at six other Toronto hotels, two which are no longer in existence. or business. Others remain. The cleanliness, service, & location make the Toronto Hilton a worthwhile destination. No complaints. One of the best. Outdoor pool is quite inviting on hot or warm days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mircoe_mcc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hilton hotels before and they have been...meh.... nice, usually a bit older, and basic. I was really impressed with the Hilton Toronto. The location is great. Right in the heart of Toronto - About 4 blocks from Easton Centre. We booked the hotel on Price Line so we got a fantastic rate. It looked like the hotel had just gone through renovations. The lobby was very modern. They had some really yummy home made ice tea in the lobby that was free. Our room was on the 28th floor. Our room was by the elevator so it was a bit nosy at night. The room was renovated so it was very modern. Had a flat screen TV. The room was a great size. It was clean. We went down and used the pool. It was too bad it was cold outside because the outdoor part of the pool looked fabulous! The hot tub was a bit small but the pool it self was a good size for a hotel pool. All in all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was OK but not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ash04925
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August. The location is great! Its within 3 blocks from Front street and nearby Rogers Centre. It is also fairly close to Dundas Square. The hotel itself is very welcoming. The lobby is beautiful and well decorated. The one drawback of this hotel is the elevators. During the time we stayed 2 elevators were down for repair. I had only known this because I checked the website before hand. No one told me this at the hotel, nor did they have any sings posted. Other guests seemed very upset about this. On the day of check out-which is 12, we waited for 20 minutes for an elevator. Since we were ont he 10th floor, every elevator that stopped was full. We ended up carrying two large suitcases and a cooler down 10 flights of stairs because we were tired of waiting. Then, our next hurdle was the parking garage. Again, there was only one elevator working and for some reason the stairs were locked. We then decided not to wait in line and go down the car ramp into the parking garage. This was extremely anoying. Parking is also very expensive- $32 for the weekend. The room itself was clean but the decor could use some updating. The bed is extremely comfortable. The staff is also friendly too. The pool is great because you can swim inside and out. However, I was surprised to see so many people at the pool during the day. A chair is really hard to come by. We tended to use it in the evening just before close. It also closes at 11pm which I felt it should be open 24 hrs. We did not eat in the restaurants because from looking at the menus, they were way out of our price range. There is a fantastic little diner about 3 blocks from the hotel and breakfast is under 10$. Overall I would recommend this hotel to friends and family solely for its location and cleanliness. But with every hotel, there are drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, large room, gym/swim; some big minuses”
Reviews.Author: lalloRoma
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel 2 times in August, in 2 different floors and rooms. Rooms are large, the hotel is equipped with a gym and sauna and swimming pool internal/external with terrace. Directly connected to Toronto PATH, with a shop, a bar, a steak house (huge prices). The breakfast is continental (please note the best Benedict Eggs ever), but be sure to have it included in your price, the cost is very very high. The hotel is beautifully located, with 2 magnificent scenic elevators (it seems to fly...). The hotel offers free wifi in rooms (+), as said very good breakfast (+) at high cost (-), in a central position (+); offers many services (+), also the possibility to arrive from Toronto airport with an external service bus for a fee (+), great sauna and pool (+). Check in very fast, very professional (+). Safe, iron and board, flat tv are as usual for a Hilton. Wifi in rooms is free (+), but many times you can't get enough bars or the signal is hiiden (-). Some minuses. The rooms have no air fan in the bathroom. The first room (27th floor) had furnitures old and over used, the second (25th floor) with not enough towels at the arrive (a fast call to Room Service and the problem was promptely solved). No flip flops at all (-). Rooms (both) were very dirty, with hairs all over. This is a serious problem. Picture. Minibar is absent, this is another serious minus. Personnel, apart room made, is very nice, concierge (not sure to have the possibility to write the name of the guy) and receptionists are VERY professional. I'll write my compliments to Hilton management for this.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, clean hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: clarehelen23
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night at this hotel, but it was lovely and clean in an excellent location in downtown Toronto. Shops and restaurants are close by. Rooms are large and airy with very comfortable beds and big bathrooms. We had an excellent view of downtown Toronto from our room. Breakfast was excellent too, with a huge choice of food made available. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Would Expect At A Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Sheikyerbooty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at end of August. The hotel is well located, which I would say is it's main selling point. I usually use Priceline or Hotwire, but was travelling with someone who really wanted a smoking room, so we booked directly with the hotel. To my surprise none was available despite being assure upon making the reservation weeks prior to arrival. So essentially I received what i would have gotten on Priceline or Hotwire, but at twice the price. We were told the room would be available the next night, which it was, the hotel staff was very efficient moving our belongings to our requested room while we were out for the day. Nothing was offered for the inconveince (ie: internet in our room, or a breakfast). 1st room was on the 13th floor, very typical room, with need of an update. 2nd room (#1518) was much the same, but needed the update quite a bit more. I understand hotels do not feel the need to keep the smoking rooms in AAA shape, but this rooms carpet was disgusting, giant stains in a couple of places.....I would have to say this would be the dirtiest carpet I have ever seen in a supposed 4 star hotel. I have stayed at many of Toronto's 4* hotels..(Inter-Continental, Royal York, Sheraton, Westin HC) and stay in smoking rooms about 50% of the time.......and as I said, most need an update on the furniture, and can understand not wanting to invest too much in these stinky rooms....but this carpet was dirty...not just old. As well, the beds in the smoking rooms were inferior to those in the non-smoking room. They also had problems with their elevators, the sceinic ones were not working all weekend, and on Sunday morning, upon checkout, the 3 remaining ones (yes there were lineups) would not let you out in the lobby, only the pool area, so you had to carry your bags down 2 flights of stairs to get to the lobby. I have stayed right across the street at the Sheraton many times, would have to say it is a much nicer and efficeint hotel, despite being a much busier place. My one other pet peeve about the place is none of the rooms have windows that open, so if you are stuck in a smoking room...and you don't smoke, you get no fresh air at all. and even if you do not have a smoking room, it's always nice to have some fresh air as opposed to the same recycled air in the room all the time, I would give the Hilton a definate miss on my next visit, as a matter a fact, I would have been disappointed if I would have gotten the place at half the price on Priceline or Hotwire...let alone paying full price! Oh btw, I am a Hilton Honors Member...for all the good that did me this past weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: costa68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Toronto Hilton in August to celebrate our anniversary, and decided to try a different hotel than our usual. Boy, are we sure glad we did. The Hotel is perfectly situated in Downtown Toronto, allowing guests to enjoy the sites of the city without much hassle. The room was absloutely amazing, clean, spacious, modern, the bed was sooo comfortable, the bathroom was updated and spotless. We tried the buffet breakfast the next morning and found everything to be prepared very well, everything we tried was excellent. The only thing that wrong was our t.v. wasnt working in our room. We called the front desk, and within 10 minutes, maintenance was in our room looking after our problem. Very courteous and efficient. Over all, I would greatly recommend this hotel to anyone was wants to be in a beautiful, clean hotel in the downtown core, close to everything. We look forward to coming back next year for our anniversary again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was as expected for a Hilton property, clean and nice, "but"....”
Reviews.Author: PoorDaddy
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected for a Hilton property, "but"....being a Diamond VIP member, I would sure have appreciated if they had given me the room upgrade to the executive floor. I always wonder why these upgrades are never available. This was a 2 day getaway to see the Chinese Terracota Warriors at the ROM and the Harry Potter Exhibit at the Ontario Science Musuem. among other things. I rarely travel with the family so I was hoping the upgrade would be available and we would have a little more space to move around in the room. Anyway, everything was clean and we had access to the executive breakfast which was very good. Staff was friendly and helpful, parking was $30.night, better than DC and London. This hotel is centrally located, the CN tower was looming right outside our hotel room window and everything was within walking distance. Bring your walking shoes, there is lots to see. Took the CN Tower ride and the views were spectacular, however, the $97 for a 15 second elevator ride was a bit steep but as the children never been there, they enjoyed it. Overall, very nice hotel, that's why I stay at Hilton properties. The only negative is they wanted $14.95 per day for internet which is just about free everywhere else. The lobby had free wireless if you need to connect to emails etc...

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in a first class city.”
Reviews.Author: eatondog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Saturday night and had a fantastic time. The location can't be better! Our king bedded room was a good size and updated. The executive lounge was super in the evening. Sunday morning breakfast there was only one staff person working and everything ran out; the poor man was run off his feet. I would definately stay here again and would reccomend it to anyone planning a trip to downtown Toronto. We wished we had stayed there for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Hotwire not the Rack Rate”
Reviews.Author: johnmOttawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel while in Toronto to see and show and we found the hotel to be very conveniently located in relation to Toronto's theartre district. it was an easy walk to the show as well as shopping and resturants. The hotel itself is nice although the rooms are in need of some updating. The carpets and furniture in the suite were on the older and well used side which is surprising for a hotel that is supposed to be four stars. Given that we got a good rate on hotwire it was worth the money but I would not pay the rack rate for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: buckigirl
Reviews.Content: We splurged on a real Hilton, although we almost always stay in members of the Hilton family. Since my husband is a top level member, mostly due to business, we were given a lovely room on the top floor with a great view of the CN Tower. However, for anyone who is staying here, we had the wonderful (but not free) breakfast buffet. Because we usually rely on public transportation for the sake of economy, when we are tourists, it was very conveniently located to the subway system -- just ask for directions at the hotel. It was a quick walk -- a real benefit after pounding the pavement seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ,but...pool needs renovation.”
Reviews.Author: sharono11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Hilton DT location with family the first week in August. The interior of the room and hotel's ambiance where nice and up to date, but the indoor/outdoor pool needed a lot of repairs especially the concrete overhang which l crumbling. It would have been nice not to look at the new building being put up across the way also too. The construction noise was loud.They did have a pool bar, but it had no service. I was disappointed especially since the pool was busy and thehotel seemed to be full.

Reviews.Title: “Really big beds,nice design”
Reviews.Author: Marialena P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hilton several times since i was visiting being a flight attendant. I didn't have the chance to explore Toronto but i explored the surroundings of the hotel. My rooms were always clean and comfortable.Bed was extremely big!! i loved my sleeping there!! Receptionists were friendly and the concierge booked a Niagara Falls trip for me and other colleagues!we had a great time. i had breakfast in the hotel sometimes and although it was quite expensive i really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Malveiradaserra
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´ve been here 5 years ago and were happy with it so we tried through Priceline Negotiator which worked excellent to stay there again. We booked for 2 nights 2 rooms. At the reception the check in was quickly and we got our rooms close to each other. They were clean, beds comfortable etc etc the only remark I have is that we could hear the noise from the streets, next time I would ask for a room higher up. As it was late we had a bite in the bar which was good. The location of the hotel is very central and very convenient if you have like us an event at the four seasons theatre. Both mornings we had breakfast in the hotel, good quality but not enough different breads if you were not there early enough. And but that count for all these hotels, breakfast buffet in general cost $25 per person, I think itÂ´s very expensive. Tried to go to the pool but was too crowded and there were no chairs left, was very hot and like me more people thought about a dive after a day of walking around. The staff at the reception, bar and restaurant were all friendly. Overall a very good experience and for sure next time I will try to book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Midatlanticmom3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a slightly quieter area (near financial area) of Toronto but still close enough to the action of the Eaton Center. The decor was absolutely beautiful. We stayed in an upgraded executive room with two beds as we were traveling with children. The room was pretty standard in size so we are glad we did not stay in an actual standard room. They did not have a frig but asked for one and immediately received one. We were told that 2 years ago they took out the mini-bars and thus no frig in the room. The service was superb! The pool was nice but a MAJOR MAJOR WARNING....the floor of the pool as well as the floor surrounding the pool was very slippery..wear pool/water socks. DID NOT like the garage. Very hard to navigate. The breakfast with executive lounge area was just okay...can not beat Marriott. We are Hilton Honors Gold members and felt that the overall quality was acceptable and would suggest for those to stay here..ESPECIALLY if you are there for business. It is not as "kid friendly" as other places but that did not bother us one bit.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up! Nice stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: rebel1
Reviews.Content: As someone who used to go to the University of Toronto, I lived for a number of years in the downtown core. I've returned regularly both on business and leisure and have had the opportunity to stay in several of downtown Toronto's hotels. This was my first stay at the Hilton Toronto and it did not disappoint. I had booked the trip through a discount online 3rd party and received an excellent rate. Having done this before, I have stayed at some of downtown's 4-star hotels only to find the hotel would place you in the worse possible, outdated, in-need-of-repair room (ahem, Sutton Place...), even if there was vacancy in the hotel. After confirming that I was booked at the Hilton, I read the reviews here on TripAdvisor, which were generally positive. I also noticed that the Hilton's manager regularly replied to people's reviews of the hotel. This was encouraging as it does show his concern for his guests and people's opinion of his hotel - something any potential guest should find commendable. Upon arriving, one first notices the lobby area is very nice - worthy of what one would expect from the Hilton brand. Check-in was effortless. Parking is below ground at $30/night (this is the usual high cost of parking in any downtown Toronto hotel) with in/out privileges. The parking is public (ie. not exclusive to the Hilton) however the elevator connects to just outside the Hilton's inside entrance from the surrounding Adelaide building. Location of the hotel is great and connects directly to the PATH (an underground downtown walkway interconnecting much of Toronto's core). We received a renovated room on the 7th floor that was very nice and spacious. Bed was very comfortable - something my wife really appreciated as she rarely finds hotel beds to be back-friendly. Room also had wired ethernet and a programmable safe. Others here have noted the lack of WIFI, which was a little disappointing but truly a minor detail. I frequently stay at the Hilton's Garden Inn chain when on business, and WIFI is available there. Mind you, the Garden Inn is more geared to the business traveler, who presumably would be more inclined to make use of the WIFI. We had one slight noise problem with another guest down the hall, who apparently was celebrating a birthday with about 30 friends. The celebration, guests and noise extended into the hallway and into the wee morning hours. However, the hotel staff acted quickly when they were made aware of the problem and quickly put a stop to the hallway festivities. The only other small issue we had was that there were carpet cleaners running noisy machines at midnight. Looked like an external company performing regular cleaning, but would have been nice if they didn't do it at midnight when people were trying to sleep. All in all, I found the Hilton to be one of the better hotels I've stayed at in downtown Toronto. We've stayed at the Sheraton Centre, King Edward, Sutton Place, Westin Harbour Castle, Delta Chelsea, One King West, Renaissance (Rogers Centre) to name a few, and I'd have to rank the Hilton among the best we've stayed here. I wouldn't hesistate to stay here again the next time I'm downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: adrosenb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in April. It was a solid hotel downtown. Had a nice lobby and friendly atmosphere. Room was very nice. Seemed like a standard Hilton to me. Pretty roomy with a nice chair and big desk. Very comfortable bed as well. Location was perfect for us. Close to the major attractions we hoped to see in town, but the area right around the hotel was more a downtown business district than a place you'd want to be on a weekend. Convenient for us, but if you are looking to be more in the heart of nightlife, you might not like it. The one problem I had was asking the concierge for the nearest liquor store and he sent me to one that was 3 blocks away, but closed on Saturdays. This just seemed like something he should have known. I know it's minor, but it was annoying at the time. Overall, I'd recommend for a stay in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for large chain.... perfect sleep!”
Reviews.Author: joaniemmm
Reviews.Content: Was in Toronto for business, and had a great experience at this hotel. The room was very clean, and the beds were actually a delight to sleep in. so comfortable! The staff was very friendly and the hotel connects underground in case of rain to many other downtown buildings. The executive lounge serves great cookies and the steakhouse on site was delicious. Also right next to the Keg which was great too for steak lovers

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service and Style”
Reviews.Author: Urbanherb
Reviews.Content: I send congratulations to the staff and management for a wonderful stay at the Hilton Downtown. I surprised my wife for our 12 anniversary and arranged roses to be delivered to the room upon arrival. I phoned ahead of time to make sure the staff was aware of my delivery and they assured me they would be in a nice room when we arrived. They did more than that! They had a bottle of Bubbly and some Chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us as well. Nice touch my friends! The staff was attentive while there and the room had an amazing view on the 27th floor. Couldn't hear a thing in the room and had a great sleep in their comfy beds. The pool is a bit small but it was nice to take a dip in in this humid weather. Keep up the good work Hilton and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pro: Good location Con: Late room service and no towels!”
Reviews.Author: Molly57592
Reviews.Content: I was very displeased with the housekeeping and guest service at our recent stay. This Hilton did not measure up to the other Hiltons, Embassy Suites, and Homewood Suites I have previously stayed. Each day of our 4 night stay the room was not cleaned until 4 pm or later. This was upsetting because I was traveling with my 9 month old and we would leave the room early in the morning and return after lunch and still our room would not be cleaned and it was time for my daughter's nap. In addition one day they didn't have towels ready until the evening. On the last day of our stay housekeeping neglected to leave any bath towels only 3 face cloths. I woke early the next morning to discover this and made a call to guest service. I told them that it was urgent because we had an early flight to make that morning. After 15 minutes the towels still had not arrived. So I made a second call. With the second call I said I wanted to make a formal complaint. Guest services told me that there are no more complaint cards left. An additional 10 minutes later the towels finally arrived. After receiving the towels and showering I began to blow dry my hair. Then the power went out. Consequently my husband could not shower in the dark bathroom. I called guest services again. The maintenance worker showed fairly promptly and had the power back on in 5 minutes. Both of these incidences caused us to miss our airport shuttle. Consequently we arrived at the airport for our international flight with only a few minutes to spare the hour cut off! It was very stressful and the guest services person was not even apologetic. It was a good central location to different areas of town and pool was ok. However no drink or food service by the pool, only high priced restaurant and room service food. No wifi in the rooms and the wifi available was only in the lobby for $14.95. Cash bar for the conference was $8-10 per drink! Coffee pot sucked and made poor coffee. Luckily Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Second Cup are all a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for preventing our homelessness....”
Reviews.Author: vexredo
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon,myself and my husband decided to go to Toronto for a few days, we decided to book into a bed and breakfast. However when we arrived at the venue we discovered it was really a room with a toilet in. We were mortified and did not want to spend the weekend there. We started to trawl the streets of Toronto and ended up getting soaking wet from the rain! We came across the Hilton and asked about availability. The girl behind the desk was so friendly and sympathetic that to save us waiting for a standard room, she upgraded us for free so we could go into a room straight away. We went out for the evening and when we arrived back in our room we discovered that we had been given a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries which was a lovely touch to the evening. Well Done Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Well, I think it's so-so”
Reviews.Author: travelparty
Reviews.Content: Why do I say so? This is my 5th Hilton hotel after LA, S Francisco, Seattle and Vancouver for this business trip. My honest opinion of the Executive Floor on 22nd Floor: Room: Spacious; Working desk and chair: great; Bed: great; View from room: great; TV: Not digital channels and 32 inc only but programmes are great; Complimentary bottled drinking water: great; Front office staff: great especially the female staff who helped to buy a stamp for my postcard since the gift shop personnel is off; Internet: great especially Michael who in the wee hours helped me to reconfigure my network to accept local area connection; Bellman: very helpful with location enquiries; Executive lounge on 32nd floor: Very disappointed (it's the little things that matter): We flew in late, arrived at hotel at 9.15pm and was happy to learn that executive lounge was still open. When we went there, no food was served. Only cookies! Wow! The next day, I came back after meeting at 9pm and went straight to the executive lounge, the male staff there said they only serve some appetizers from 5pm - 7pm but again we were not informed and caught by surprise! What a big disappointment and letdown!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Leyla_79
Reviews.Content: It was really clean and a very friendly stuff. What was missing was a bus service to the city or airport but anyway they order for you a taxi for your so was fine. Very friendly they are in the restaurant it was also a big variety of food and very excellent is fish there.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel - dated building, usual internet rip-off”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during Toronto's Gay Pride event, so it was packed, as much as most other hotels during the pride week period. Accordingly the price I paid was roughly double of what I would have paid had I stayed a week earlier or later. I am mentioning this because I was hugely irritated about the hotel trying to charge 15$ per day for internet access, when cheaper competitors (Best Western Primrose Hotel in Toronto) offer it free of charge. It's sufficiently annoying a business practice that I do not recommend this hotel. I hate these rip-off attempt once you've booked your room. The rooms are what you'd expect of a 4* outfit, flatscreen TV, decent bathroom, good views, but not as good as from the Sheraton Downtown that's just a stone throw away. Ditto for the pool. The Sheraton's is light years better. The beds were OK, but honestly, I slept better in the Best Western Primrose. Their switchboard is understaffed so expect to wait when you ring them. The check-out from the TV didn't work, but they were OK w/ me calling instead of queueing in the lobby to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel in a good central Toronto location that is let down by a number of small details. Despite the solid feel to the rooms the insulation isn't that great, so I was woken up by noise neighbours. Although I was on the 25th floor the noise from the streets was noticeable (there is a complex of hospitals nearby) and the air conditioning made an irritating clicking noise every time it came on. There was also no bath in my room and it was occasionally tough to get the water hot enough in the shower, even early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: HippyChic101
Reviews.Content: Food was good. Executive lounge food was passable. View from my executive room was great and room was clean. Apart from nicely done lobby, hotel appearance is dated as another guest said. Inconsistent customer service - some staff are excellent, most are atrocious. This is by no means a 4 star hotel - it is more of a 3 star and not a very good one Always used Hilton or Hyatt, now shopping around for another chain to replace Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: thai4006
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by this hotel. I thought because I had selected a Hilton brand that I could trust the quality. Not so!! 1. Could not check in till 8 pm (not the usual 3 in the afternoon). For some reason they did not have the rooms cleaned in time. 2. There was a tattoo meeting/convention there which meant that there was partying in the corridors all night long, people shouting and laughing outside your door at 2,3,4 in the morning (not to mention noise of traffic outside). 3. Lobby was dingy and dark. 4. Bulb missing in elevator light for the two nights I was there which made it very dark. Liquid on elevator floor each time I used it. 5. Garbage on floor outside elevator. 6. Food very expensive 7. No free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Incredible Location...”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazyguy
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is "Wow", this Hilton was very impressive. I've had disappointing stays at Hilton brand hotels in the States, but this location left me wanting to come back for more. I came to Toronto for a week for business and the team chose this location due to its proximity to the subway without really seeing or knowing the hotel. The staff was welcoming and helpful. I have diamond status at Hilton, so I was upgraded to executive floor with lounge access which was extremely valuable for work with colleagues after being with clients all day...it was very roomy with free food, coffee bar, and honor bar for alcohol (free breakfast bar if you have status is incredible). Even if you don't have status the hotel is quite impressive. The room had an incredible view of the CEN(sp?) Tower as well as the whole downtown area--the executive loung view is even more impressive with wrap around windows on the 32nd floor. You can pretty much go anywhere in Toronto with the subway station literally outside the front door of the hotel. There is a Ruth Chris' Steakhouse attached to the hotel and the food is incredible...although it is pricey, it is worth a visit. Other restaurants on on the lobby level of the hotel but I didn't visit them. There is much to see in walking distance to I would recommend not staying in your room if you can help it...Toronto is an incredible city not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay while in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JFrancois
Reviews.Content: Hilton toronto offers great location, good staff and modern stay. The sleep quality was simply amazing! Good breakfast in the lobby. Lots of business conference (so quiet nights!). Osgoode subway station around the corner. Hotel parking at 18$ (during weekend) and 24$ (week days). The staff at the front deask could be more helpfull...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kristy31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton in downtown Toronto for one night on June 4th. Booked 2 rooms for myself, my spouse, and two friends. Overall, good choice for a downtown hotel and we had a pleasant stay. The location is fantastic if you are looking for a central hotel, close to shopping, attractions, and transit. LOCATION: Again this is a great location. Walking distance to Queen Street and Eaton's Centre shopping (about 20 min) and even closer to some of Toronto's biggest attractions (CN Tower, Skydome (I still can't call it the 'Rogers Centre'), Hockey Hall of Fame, Union Staion and AC Centre). Lots of nearby restaurants as well. Our room had a great view of the CN tower. PARKING: Definitely a plus for a downtown location. The Hilton has its own underground secure parking. The rates are very reasonable also. The rate on the hotel's website ($30) is a flat rate per day and useful if you will be in and out with your car during the day. If you are just parking and leaving your vehicle at the hotel (as we did) it is much cheaper to pay at the machine near the entrance to the parking garage then through your room. We arrived around 6 pm and left the next day at 1 pm and parking was only $16.50. Very good for this area. CHECK-IN: Went smoothly and we received the room preferences and bed preferences that I asked for when I booked. The staff at the check-in was my only complaint. STAFF: We encountered/spoke to very few staff members and for the most part there were no complaints. The only complaint I have (and where this hotel lost 'points' for me) was with the front desk staff. When we checked in they were not very friendly. I have stayed in a number of Hilton Hotels before and they always have the best staff. They usually go out of their way to help and be friendly. The staff member that checked us in was not very friendly, did not smile, etc. She wasn't 'rude' but not what I expected from a Hilton employee. I had a number of bags with me and was obviously have trouble and she did not offer to have someone help me bring the items up to my room. When the other 2 members of my party checked in about 30 min later they told me the same thing, that they found the front desk staff person unfriendly and said she was 'snobby'. It could be because we are young but I just expect more from Hilton. ROOM: Clean and updated. Nice view. Good water pressure. Good bed/bedding. Quiet and the a/c worked well. Only complaint: no fan in the bathroom so the mirror was always fogged up. ELEVATORS: I have seen a couple of reviews saying that if you don't like heights to avoid this hotel because they have glass elevators. I thought the glass elevators were really nice actually, and gave a wonderful view (especially at night). That being said, there are 6 guest elevators and only 3 are glass. If you really did not want to take a glass elevator you could just use the ones of the opposite side which are normal elevators. POOL: Looked very nice however we did not use it so I can't comment further.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: gorstanel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel early, asked if we could check in, was told no problem. When told it was special occasion, we were put on higher floor and later that evening they sent up champagne and chocoate strawberries. Things just got better,room clean and bright,view fantastic,morning breakfast superb. In this world where everyone complains it was remarkable to us that they went above and beyond and should be commended for this. Mark Beaton and staff went above and beyond and we have told friends who are considering a trip just because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel. At best a disappointing three star.”
Reviews.Author: Gidds91
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel and rooms were tidy and clean. The employees did a fantastic job and were always polite and helpful. I booked two Alcove King Suites through www.priceline.com and received each suite for 154 CAD. When arriving at the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff and a modern looking lobby. We checked in and proceeded up to the 16th floor where our suites were. Both suites appeared to be very dated (short of new headboards on the beds and a flat panel tv). The furniture had scratch marks , the ceiling in the shower had rust on it, the walls were marked up and peeling, the one suite had two large, what I think were, fuse boxes beside the bed, The one rooms numbers on the outside were falling off of the door and by the next day someone had taken one of the numbers and run off. Internet is not free and despite having a King Alcove Suite the rooms did not have a mini fridge. That costs extra! The location of the hotel is great and the rooms, although a little run down in my opinion, appeared to be fairly tidy. The bed was very comfortable. To sum up everything, save your self a few bucks and choose the Holiday Inn a few blocks away. I have stayed there and was completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwhuffman
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, but if you want the Executive Floor Lounge Access, you must book an executive room....However not all Executive Rooms are on the executive floor, but still allow lounge access. My Friends two kids loved the glass elevators, that looked outside while going up to our room. Hotel is a ways off from the airport.....average cost for a Cab from Airport to the hotel is between $50-$60CAD. The hotel can arrange a "Flat Rate" Towncar for $60CAD. Hotel is located across/diagonal from the subway system, which is needed if no car, as Toronto is spread out. However, if you have a family of 4 and such, you can purchase a Family fare which is good all day and is multi-use as well...was very cheap compared to buying 4 seperate subway tickets. Hotel is within walking distance of the CN Tower and can be viewed from most rooms at this hotel. If you are a Hilton Elite member and are upgraded to an Executice Room or are staying in an executive room, the lounge is great on the food products. There is a Ruth Chris on one of the lower levels of the hotel, as usual this type of restaurant is expensive, but good food. The restaturant seemed to always open around 20-30mins after their advertised opening time in the afternoon/evening. This hotel seems to always have different conventions while I ways there for the weekend I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , Great service”
Reviews.Author: adeysh
Reviews.Content: Couple of my friends came down to toronto and we wanted to go clubbing and hang in the city so we stayed at hilton downtown which was great location to eaton center, all the attractions and clubs were easy to get to. It was simple very clean room with double beds. Only issue was no wifi service in the rooms. But overall great bang for your buck. And no free parking.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but dirty shower”
Reviews.Author: osmary
Reviews.Content: hotel was good , frontdesk staff were very friendly, unfortunately the the shower was dirty and left a bad impression of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unerwhelming”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonKiwiJo
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the hotel has excellent amentities but I left vowing never to stay here again if I can help it. There's a real lack of customer service across all levels of the hotel - some great friendly staff but most who just didn't care. The hotel was overbooked and I ended up being offered a room by the noisy elevators or a smoking room. Despite promises to move me the following day, this wasn't actioned. The seater in the breakfast restaurant was taking her bad day out on customers and one of the evening receptionists was way too cool to be doing such a demeaning job as checking people in. Churned in, churned out.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: CCMcC
Reviews.Content: If you are scared of heights, the first thing you should know is that the Hilton Toronto has more than 26 floors and a "scenic elevator" that is the one most likely to haul you there. This glass exterior elevator is a fun ride--if you don't have any elevator or height phobias. That said, the view from the Hilton of Toronto is a beautiful one. The rooms are large and comfortable and stylishly appointed. The bathroom is dark tile and the lighting is dim, which doesn't cater well to women travelers. But the shower is large with two shower heads (rainfall and handheld), which is very relaxing. The hotel has a restaurant and a bar. The restaurant was typical, but the bar and its fare was very good. There's also a steakhouse that is embedded in the hotel, if memory serves. The advertised coffee shop within the building closed a long time ago, so be aware there is only one breakfast option in this large hotel. There's an extra charge for the internet and wireless only works on the first three floors. Overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, but something was "missing."”
Reviews.Author: JTravel16
Reviews.Content: We stayed on points for one night, and the second with a fantastic on-line deal for $130 a night, so the cost was fairly manageable. The rooms are clean and spacious, we had a nice view of North Toronto and the Court building (#2504). Rain showers with dual-head were a nice treat, as well, but I felt there was something "missing." Perhaps because this is a business hotel, there is not such a cosy feeling. Also, note that the internet was $14 per day. I find that a bit obscene for a hotel that normally charges $269 a night for a standard room. If I were to pay full price for the room, I would prefer the Fairmont Royal York for a similar price range. However, the staff were friendly enough, and the fitness centre was very nice. Just needs a little bit more of a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Service Was Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: JWHarlow
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff, desk, bellmen, concierge, bar, restaurant went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and warm. Each individual made an effort to ask if I needed anything, how they could help, if they could get me something that wasn't even on the menu. I felt very special and taken care of my entire stay. The room was comfortable, very clean, the bed was very soft. It was also quiet and I could really sleep all night with no noises at all. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “WIll not return”
Reviews.Author: brittanyyy
Reviews.Content: Three of my friends and I stayed at this Hilton location this past weekend. At first we were very excited, despite the less than friendly greeting we relieved by the two young women checking us in. They did not smile or engage with us whatsoever. However, our room was large, clean and had a great view. However, we were not aware that we needed to pay for internet services and spent almost an hour on the phone with two different people. The first person we spoke to said we needed to pay for 24hrs but couldn't help us. The second person resolved our issues and told us the internet was free. We went on with our night as planned. In the morning we woke up to find a bill with 3 charges for internet usage and 2 phone calls even though we were only speaking to people within the hotel. When we checked out the staff member erased two of the charges but simply said "Oh well" when we complained and said the person on the phone had told us it was free. Overall we were not impressed with this hotel because of the poor and confusing service. No one seemed to know what was really going on. I will not be staying at this hotel in the future and my friends said they felt the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMac31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great area in downtown Toronto, which is nice. The bell-hops that met us at the door were very friendly and informative. The check-in process was very efficient and smooth. Our room was on the 26th floor with a nice view of the CN Tower, which is within walking distance to the hotel. The rooms were nice but not worth the $288 (taxes included) for the night. It was more of a $100/night hotel once you got to your room. There was nothing special about the room itself. The bathroom, although nice, had no trim around the inside of the bathroom door. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable but I like a good "bang for my buck" and this hotel did not offer that. Room service was a crazy price...the breakfast was $20 per person for eggs, bacon, toast, juice and tea. We ended up venturing outside and heading 3-4 blocks to the Sunset Grill for an amazing breakfast for half the cost! However, there is a great Irish pub, McCool's, attached to the hotel, which has amazing food for an affordable cost. Because this is the downtown Toronto area, when we walked the 4 blocks to the restaurant we saw not shy of 6 homeless people sleeping on the streets so although the area is centrally located, the "curb appeal" is lacking. Also, for this price, high speed internet should be included...it's $14.95 extra per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Leb_OK
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Toronto, and the location of the Hilton Toronto is centrally located with easy access to anything one needs. But this was not the best thing about the stay. The friendliness of the staff, cleanliness and quality of the ameinites made a business trip feel like a vacation. Definitely would recommend the Hilton Toronto if you are in Toronto and want to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations of the brand, and exceeded them!”
Reviews.Author: kballtex
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were upgraded (Hilton Gold Member) to the Executive Floor, and were given a wonderful room. Plenty of room for my wife and I, plus our newborn son who was traveling with us (he slept in a pack 'n play). Loved the bathroom with the look of a very recent update to the entire hotel! Executive lounge was really great, had to do some work during the day and was extremely comfortable using the lounge thanks to the great staff for making us feel truly at home! PROS: Location, Value for Money CONS: Can't think of any, aside from the expensive parking - but if you desire less pricey parking there are plenty of municipal options in Toronto Nice touches: Letter from the manager on arrival welcoming us, Executive Lounge staff, excellent concierge staff (Nathan was just great in finding us a restaurant!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: Manatus
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton Toronto as part of a King Tut exhibition package - so right off the top, good job on Hilton for being a part of major city events like this, I was definitely encouraged to travel to Toronto for the exhibition because Hilton, Le Meridien, Westin and other top-class hotels were partners for it. Good things: - Excellent value as part of the package, really good on Hilton, Ontario Tourism and the other parties involved who made this possible. - Location was great. Right downtown, literally next to a subway station, walking distance from Union train/bus stations, lots of restaurants etc nearby. Easy walking distance to the Art Gallery of Ontario (where the exhibition was), as well as the Eaton Centre and many other places. Excellent location for exploring without having to use a car, which no one wants to do in downtown Toronto anyway. - Rooms were very clean, well-maintained, up-to-date and modern, just what you'd expect from Hilton - a nice size too. - Scenic elevators were a nice touch. - Restaurant (Tundra) was a little pricy, but the food was top-notch. Not your usual touristy bland hotel fare. No problem if there's bad weather, eating at the hotel is not a wasted meal. Bad things: - There were a lot of drunk, rowdy groups of teenagers/college students on our floor, coming from/going to bars until 4am, yelling from room to room as though it was a dorm, banging on the walls, generally being jackasses (why are people like this in big groups?). Couldn't sleep, and judging from other patrons on the floor yelling things like "why can't you respect the peace", a lot of other people couldn't as well. Staff dealt with it pretty well (they gave us another room the next day, higher up, with no problems), but there was the attitude that "it's Saturday night so we can't really do anything about the noise". The other nights we stayed were fine, just wish that more could have been done during the night itself, as the next morning was pretty much a waste for us (had to sleep in!). - The hotel was pretty noisy in general, perhaps because of its age? Could hear pipes rattling occasionally, soundproofing wasn't great i.e. could hear people walking/talking in the hallways, doors closing etc. Not a big deal once you get used to it, only noticeable at night. - If I'd paid the full room rate, I'd probably be a bit annoyed at having to pay an extra $15 for Internet access. You can choose e.g. to eat breakfast elsewhere if you want to save money, but realistically in this day and age not having Internet access really impacts your stay, e.g. needing to find maps, find restaurants/attractions (thanks, Tripadvisor!), so people have no real choice but to pay it. Having said that, the Internet access was generally reliable and pretty fast for a hotel. All in all, given what we paid, it was a very good stay. A bit noisy, but more than outweighed by the good things. Would maybe avoid Saturday nights next time. Good job though once again organizing the link-up with the exhibition, if this was done for future major events in Toronto, I'd definitely consider the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, if just slightly overrated.”
Reviews.Author: qqqqqqqq_7
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at the Hilton recently while in Toronto to see some museums, etc. The hotel is an impressive 32 storey building slightly north of the financial district near City Hall. It's at the extremity Toronto's vast underground network of shopping concourses and therefore (to a person with a good sense of direction,) provides completely indoor access to the Eaton Centre, Union Station, the subway and all the downtown office towers. I can honestly say that every single staff member I ran into was extremely friendly and helpful - the hotel has a great staff. The room was a typical hotel room - no frills, but nothing wrong with it either. It had comfortable beds, a TV that worked, it was clean. I booked through Hotwire, and got a very good rate of about $74. However, out of curiosity, I checked the rate directly with the Hilton web site and found that the normal rate was about double this. At $74, I have absolutely no complaints about the value of this room. However, I don't think it would be worth double that. It is listed as a 4 star hotel, but I feel it lacks the "specialness" to earn that 4th star - I would rate it a good 3, perhaps 3.5. The hotel has a couple of restaurants which look good, however being in downtown Toronto, we chose to chose to seek out specific types of food elsewhere, therefore I can't comment on the in-hotel restaurants (but can say that within a 10 minute walk, there is literally every type of food in existence).

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, up to date hotel”
Reviews.Author: billsinaz
Reviews.Content: My company rate made this hotel a bargain. Very clean. Good location. Modern room. great bed. Downtown noise was the only issue, but that's normal in any downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “HILTON TORONTO GOLDEN PACKAGE DEAL”
Reviews.Author: debra60143
Reviews.Content: A weekend get away for a couple of days, but couldn't afford to fly anywhere far away! I wanted to be away from Illinois and enjoy some quiet time. On the radio shopping show I saw a certificate for the Golden package at the Hilton Garden Toronto and decided to go for it! The trip is only one hour and fifteen minutes away and yet you feel like you are in a different country when you go to the Hilton Toronto. I first was greeted by Suzanna who checked me in and welcomed me there. She told me anything I needed and wanted to make my trip enjoyable let her know. We talked a little afterwards after she checked me in. She made certain that I knew what my trip included. While I was out of my room for maybe twenty minutes to my pleasant surprise I had a bottle of champagne of ice and a cheese and fruit tray big enough for three people to eat off of. A card with my completed name on it says Welcome to Hilton Toronto, Enjoy the exhibit and your stay and wake like an Egyptian, Cordially, Edwin. The King Tut was very easy to get to and a real interesting exhibit. The Hilton Toronto was outstanding! The rooms were clean and so comfortable. My favorite part was definitely the executive lounge. There I met Jim, one of Hilton's employees. That guy went out of his way to make certain I was enjoying that executive lounge. On that Monday, March 1, 2010 I met Annette. This is truly someone you should know. Annette kept in touch with me from my getting there and my leaving. Everything was so organized for my trip. I would definitely, recommend anyone or ones that want the royal treatment goes to this place and your life will never be the same. By the way, Susan you help me to by telling me call the hotel and tell them about my needing more time to correct my passport book and just as you said I was accommodated to the highest. Susan, thank you. Radio Shopping, I am going again your deal or mines Again, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Much improved internet bandwidth”
Reviews.Author: arahantatl
Reviews.Content: I have complained about the internet speed for the last few weeks, and finally it has been resolved. Now, I get a good 2+ Mbps connection. Now I'm a happy customer :-)

Reviews.Title: “Canada”
Reviews.Author: catchman22
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip for business and pleasure to Canada and enjoyed my stay downtown. Very nice bar downstairs and nice view from my 7th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great property. Location is great, easy...”
Reviews.Author: APMD
Reviews.Content: Great property. Location is great, easy walk everywhere in downtown and quick access to highway. Rooms are nice, views amazing (don't miss the glass elevators) and breakfast is amazing ( not included). Toronto is lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Experience! New Years Eve King Tut Package - KING FOR A DAY!”
Reviews.Author: Jokopuppy
Reviews.Content: This has been a long time coming. I would like to thank Jason I believe he's one of the many supervisors... for his attentiveness. The first time we stayed was December 3rd:) test run - not good! We made many attempts to contact the GM asst to no avail! I spoke with Jason and once again the rest is history! We came back as we were booked in advance for New Years Eve King Tut package and had a fabulous time! What a difference. It's really sad though one has to complain to get the service one deserves. Well lets start this magnificent experience. The room - upgraded! I'm sure thanks to Jason! Beautiful! We did assume with New Years it was going to be noisey and sure it was but it was because we had a whining baby and two youngins in the room next to us! For the most of the night you could hear one child yelling karate moves Hiiiiiiiyaaaaa redundantly! We went to Nathan Phillips Square and when we got back around 1230pm the child was still Hiyaaaaing! I thought I was going to be awaken the next morning to that....surprisingly I think we were up before the family next to us! Thankfullly! Also, when we returned from our dinner we observed cheese, crackers and a bottle of Vosse water in our room! I don't know if everyone got this but it sure did make us feel good about coming back! Jason really took care of us and I'm very grateful for that. There was one thing we found gross but didn't complain because the good outwayed the bad:) something sticky on the surface of the granite countertop above the mini fridge! Not sure what this was but it wasn't from us. Oh ya, the body lotion in our bathroom was open and appeared used so I asked housekeeping for a couple on our way back from the pool, which needs renovating! If it weren't for jason I don't believe this hotel would have much else to offer in the way of service. He gets r done! Thank you and because of you Jason we may just return. I've noted from previous reviews Jason appears a lot....maybe the hotel GM should take this into account give the guy a promotion or even a raise. He definitely stands by the Hilton name! When I first saw the GM respond to all the reviews I thought it was a nice touch....now I see it's all just a charade! I did exactly as he said to do and it didn't happen! Like I said jason got r done!!! Restaurant in HIlton- King Tut packages including dinner is a set menu! Mainly consisting of apple infused something however the supervisor tried his best to be accomodating! I surprised myself and found dinner enjoyable. Breakfast no omellet station-bummer- but there was a good variety. If you stay at the Hilton and plan on eating breakfast at the Hilton Restaurant I highly recommend getting breakfast included. It is pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really special”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvergrl
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Sheraton but decided to try somewhere new after some bad service. The postives about this hotel are the beds and pillows (very comfortable) and the service (I forgot a toothbrush and one was brought up right away). The negatives are no mini bar and no wifi...I was pretty surprised that these would not be included at a chain like Hilton. I stayed on the Executive Floor the Hilton's free breakfast was pretty meagre when compared to the huge spread offered at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: kiraA
Reviews.Content: We've been to Toronto three times and have stayed here twice. The hotel is immaculate and the staff attentive. The location is perfect as well. Both times we paid extra to stay on the club level, and it was well worth it. The drinks, snacks and so on (best chocolate chip cookies) were all very nice to have access to. We didn't take advantage of the continental breakfast because our room rate included the hotel's full buffet. It was also quite good. The rooms are a bit small for a family of four, but it's primarily a business hotel, so that's to be expected. Although I didn't get to the pool, my husband and girls did and they enjoyed it very much. I wouldn't dream of staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Hotel in Downtown Toronto on Richmond st.”
Reviews.Author: YosefB
Reviews.Content: It's not the cheapest hotel you'll find but you'll definitely get what you pay for. It's in a great location near Yonge st. and The Eaton Center. A lot of places are within walking distance. The service at the hotel is great as well. Personally, I have no reason to look for another hotel when I'm in Toronto unless I decide to go for the cheapest thing I can find but then again why short yourself lol.

Reviews.Title: “Enough is Too Much”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler0
Reviews.Content: I had started staying at this hotel beginning in January, 2009 and from February forward the hotel started to cut services and amenities decreasing the value of staying. The final straw was being put in a room next to an unbalanced compressor and being told I would just need to put up with the noise. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms, over charged”
Reviews.Author: Angela_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice, it's in the Hotwire roster of hotels in the area. The first time we stayed here my husband used the term, "lipstick on a pig" it's a cheap reno job on an older hotel and the decor is already outdated. The room fixtures are what you would expect of a Hilton, slightly cheap and main stream, flat pack desks and dressers. The hotel has removed the in room fridges and the coffee fixings are poor. Recently this came up for us on Hotwire again. We stayed at the hotel because we were attending a large charity function. We left our room at 7pm and arrived back at our room around 4:30 am. When we checked out at 11am we were told we were being billed $200.00 for smoking! The crazy thing was, when we arrived back my husband wanted to complain about the smell of smoke on our floor but I didn't want to as it was late. The hotel offers smoking rooms so why anyone who smoked would stay in a non smoking room is beyond me. There was no room for discussion about the fact neither of us smoke and nobody ever addressed the issue with us further despite saying they would do so. I've had to resort to involving my credit card company. Since Oct we have stayed in Toronto 9 times at various hotels as well as the UK and Costa Rica at no time have we ever been accused of smoking in any of these non smoking rooms. Both times we have stayed at the Hilton Toronto we have been disappointed and now ripped off as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: debbi8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great downtown Toronto location, walking distance to many places and on the subway line.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: health123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff friendly, reasonable prices and a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: rlirish
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Dec 9th and was greeted by "Jason" a warm and friendly guest agent. We had actually spoken earlier in the week and to my surprise he was there upon my arrival. I had a very quick and pleasant check in experience. And was also told that I had been upgraded to a Jr. Suite at no charge. Upon arrival to the room I was pleasantly surprised as to the size and cleanliness. The bathroom was a nice size and the towels were nice and soft. I had been informed by Jason that the room had been recently redone. The locatioin of the hotel was great. I actually never had to go outside. Under the hotel they have a walkway to the "path" which can take you down to Union station all the way up to Eaton Centre without ever having to go outside. I actually went to see the Raptors play and never walked outside. Concerige was very helpful and had a map of the "path" that helped me get around underground. Should my plans include Toronto in the future I will definitely stay at this hotel again. And again a special thank you to "Jason" for all the hotel information provided to me prior to my stay and at check in.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which encompasses warmth, hospitality, optimal decor, fantastic views, and is good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Traveltime44
Reviews.Content: l was recently welcomed back to the Hilton Toronto for what would be my fifth stay at the hotel, very well situated in the downtown Toronto area. l remember my first visit to Toronto in 2002, being most impressed upon my arrival at the Hilton, there was something magic about the wood and stone-like decor as you entered the lobby, as well as the general layout of the ground floor, not to mention the fantastic view from the bedrooms looking out towards University Avenue. l have since stayed at two other hotels in Toronto, but have always wished to return to the Hilton Toronto. There is something special about the location of the hotel and the light effects around it.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a Hotel We can count on”
Reviews.Author: Tamakwa
Reviews.Content: Finally a Hotel that we can count on. My spouse and I were so please from our past stay at the Hilton. We have now found the hotel that meets our needs. We've stayed at different hotels in the downtown area over the past couple of years. We have a budget as well as requests due to the fact the reason for our travels are for medical reasons. The staff was the most pleasant and helpful staff we have ever come across. We actually had a good nights rest, the food in the hotel was amazing. It was quiet and clean, not just in lobby but the room was fresh and very comfortable. Even though we must go back to T.O again in the near future for medical reasons, at least now we have a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: KCKCKCCCMC
Reviews.Content: Great facility. Clean rooms & common areas. Very comfortable bed. Up-to-date electronics. Well appointed fitness facility. Convenient location. Courtious & responsive staff. Be sure to upgrade so you have access to the executive lounge (32nd floor). It's a fabulous perk.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming warmth, comfort and convenience. We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: KelvinOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful lobby, very grand yet welcoming. The front desk staff were helpful and courteous. Our room was on the 12th floor overlooking the pool. At that height there was still street noise (mostly sirens) but nothing that disturbed our sleep. The room was a very comfortable size, we had two queen beds, but there was limited drawer space for clothes. The bathroom was well appointed and the shower was great. Very clean. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Eaton Centre shopping (3 blocks I believe) and the subway. The pool is great. The fitness centre is well equiped but like so many hotel fitness centres it has a bit of an "after thought" feel to it. Overall we had a great stay with great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: USCalum
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at numerous hotels across North America and the Hilton was exactly what we wanted. Friendly staff, great rooms, and a reasonable price. The view is absolutely amazing as well. We were in 2707 so we could see lots of south downtown Toronto. We actually stayed there for halloween and it was a bit noisy at night and in the morning but what do you expect? If it wasn't October 31 i doubt there would be any noise at all. Overall a great experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a very nice modern hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Staff could have been friendlier?”
Reviews.Author: Regalina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the weekend with my husband, 12 year old daughter and her friend who were going to a concert. Arrived Friday night and running a little late...doorman tells us we can get a bellhop to take our luggage but we tell him we can carry it ourselves, he than tells us..."you can drive down to the underground parking and you can unload from there." We informed him we will be unloading on the spot. We upgrade so we can get the internet access and entry to the executive suite , for comp breakfast and h'or dourves as the girls can grab a quick bite before the concert. We are informed at the exec lounge that children are not allowed after 5 pm...(we checked in at 6:10) Very uncomfortable. Called for extra towels...(4 people, 3 towels) never arrived. Extra coffee..nope. Printer didn't work in executive lounge and called down to front desk. They immediately sent up a maintenance person and he informed that I could get my documents printed at front desk. The concierge was not happy that I interrupted him as to whatever he was doing on the internet and sent me to front desk. Manager then in turn sent be back to concierge where he allowed me to use his computer to print off our tickets to the Cn Tower. I guess I just felt like since we were dressed in blue jeans and not suits that we were treated differently. The only person on staff that was friendly was the hostess at the Tundra when I asked her the quickest way to the Eaton Centre. Our room was a smoking room so this floor was not renovated, so nothing to write about there. I was informed that 27 of the 32 floors were.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: hanspa
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for the weekend because our house is up for sale. As such we approached this like it was a 'Stay-cation'. The location is fabulous and close to all amenities - Eaton Centre, City Hall, Yonge Street, Restaurants, Queen St., Subway etc... The view from the room was great. We were on the 29th floor and faced north - stunning at night with the lights. Room was a good size, very clean, and nicely decorated. We liked the decor and modern bathroom. Nice small separate area for coffee and drinks. We didn't get to see the pool or the gym, however we had room service (small continental breakfast for $33) which was nice and noticed they enhance security at night by locking side doors and checking room keys before granting access to the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value & Facility”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFleece
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my recent 2 night stay at this downtown Hilton property. Having read some other reviews, I made sure to request a room that had been renovated (I was told upon making my request at check-in that I had already been assigned to one.) The two members of the staff with whom I interacted at the front desk were friendly and accommodating. All areas of the building that I ventured to were clean and well-appointed. The results of the renovation are quite respectable (even the hallways are contemporary and inviting.) In my room, the bed was comfortable and the various finishes (especially the bathroom) were elegant for the price that I paid. Although I didn't have a room on one of the highest floors, I did take advantage of ascending to the top of the building on one of the elevators that is marked as being scenic and the result afforded me a sweeping view of the city (it's a great treat that will only cost you about 2 minutes of time.) I was able to walk to my nearby meetings and to a good dinner at a restaurant in close proximity, so the location worked out quite well for my needs. Upon check-in, I did grab a quick lunch at the hotel's more informal tavern-like eatery and I was very satisfied with the quality of food and service. If there's anything that I wasn't thrilled with it would be the fact that I had to pay for an internet connection, though I know that's a standard policy of Hilton hotels and nothing unique to this property; I remain hopeful, however, that this will become a complimentary amenity as it is as other, lower-priced members of the Hilton hotel family. This will certainly be my hotel of choice for any future Toronto visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and surroundings with professional service”
Reviews.Author: Centenarian
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Hilton was perfectly situated downtown to allow for exploration by foot without having to summon a taxi. If you enjoy views like I do, get a room as high as you possibly can - you won't regret it! My room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed. I was worried initially about the quality of the wireless internet with such a large building, but it was for no reason. I had excellent signal strength and no problems whatsoever. The staff seemed very professional, although nothing was wrong with my stay, so I had very little contact with them outside of check-in. The only minor gripe I have at all with this hotel is that, like most full-service Hilton's, it does have central air conditioning and heating; if you travel a lot like I do, you appreciate the much better performance of an individual room unit, along with its ability to create more white noise to keep light sleepers like myself protected from outside noises (hallway, surrounding rooms, street). Like I said however, it's a minor flaw and many of you wouldn't consider it as such anyway - so enjoy your stay at this property. It's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mikeancaster
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay here proved extremely frustrating beginning with lack of valley parking, crowded under construction and poorly signed underground parking(took us 20 minutes to get out of the parking area to the main lobby), room ventilation system frequently blew cold air despite trying to heat the room, dangerously sharp ceramic peeling in the tub, dirty carpets, couches worthy of a 1 star facility and restaurants that were closed on weekends. Combine all of this with rates that are comparable to reasonable hotels in the area, do yourself a favour and stay @ the Sheraton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Found the hotel and staff to be great”
Reviews.Author: reese123
Reviews.Content: Needed to be in Toronto last week and my regular hotel was booked. Tried a discount service and ended up with a room at the Hilton.
