Read the reviews and had mixed feelings about what to expect. I was surprised. Found the hotel to be great and will return. Arrived early and the person at the front desk was very accommodating. Although my rate guarantees a basic room, she put me in a great room (king bed, high floor). The room was clean and except for a standard TV (not a flat screen), disagree with the prior reviews about the cleanliness and furnishings. The location worked well for me. My meetings were all within walking distance. Access to the underground PATH and shops is easy. Only bit of confusion was around the parking garage. One doorman said it is only self parking and to take the ticket to the front desk for in-out privileges. The front desk said they donâ€™t offer it, not sure which is correct, but just a minor inconvenience. (The garage is undergoing renovations and parking is an experience. First time I experienced traffic lights in a garage.) The fact that the manager of the hotel takes time to publicly respond to comments is a very good indication of the commitment to customer experience. Would gladly rebook.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and location”
Reviews.Author: ranjet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 9/4, through a good Priceline rate. Lobby was dark, and could use some updating. I came from the Marriott the night before, whose lobby and staff were excellent, so the Hilton had a lot to live up to. Room was not ready, and luckily the check in agent was able to get me a 2 doubles, non smoking. Checked in around 3. Nice, clean room with view of the pool. Also had a view of a construction pit across the street, which believe it or not, was not noisy at all. The pool was great, as were the lounge chairs surrounding it. The weather was nice, so to swim outdoors was a treat. Also has a small indoor part to the pool. Didn't use the gym, and the business center computers were expensive. Must use Public Parking, which was higher than another lot just around the corner. Not a far walk from the lot to the elevators, and luckily didn't have the car break-ins that others experienced. Housekeeping was very attentive, and responded promptly to the requests we had. Seemed to be a mix of tourists and business travellers. Great location, 10 minute walk to the stadium where we went to see the Yankees. I would stay here again if the price was right, as the room was comfortable and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: africandreams
Reviews.Content: My husband had a professional conference in Toronto this year, so I tagged along. He got a great deal on the Toronto Hilton over expedia - buy two nights, get the third free. The listing also said we got free wireless and a room on one of the upper floors. When we arrived at the hotel on Thursday afternoon, our room wasn't quite ready and we were told we would have to pay for wireless. After my husband told them what our online deal said, they flagged our account and we had the internet charges removed upon checkout. We were given our room key around 3:15pm and were very impressed with the room. We ended up on the 28th floor with an amazing view of the city. The location was perfect as well. It was close to Queen and King Streets, so there was plenty to wander to by foot. Overall, we had an excellent time in Toronto, and the Hilton provided part of the excellent weekend! Random notes for travelers: Internet is not wireless and costs $14.99 per day. If you bring a car, the garage connected to the hotel is a public garage. There were a few reviews on tripadvisor about break in problems, but we had no problem with our car. We just took everything out that would look appealing to a thief! We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants or use room service, so I can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pool, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: JohnEO
Reviews.Content: Got a prepay deal on this business hotel in downtown Toronto for a convention. Having driven down from Upper Canada â€“ for the last part along an extremely busy Yonge Street â€“ we arrived at the hotel to find helpful bell and valet staff. Upgraded to a junior suite on the 28th floor at checkin by a less than friendly staff member. The suite was certainly pleasantly large with a great views of Lake Ontario, the CN tower, and the city; and just 15 minutes from the Convention Center. (The hotel is also easily walkable from Union station, which is where we dropped off our rental car.) Although fairly spacious, however, the room was short of closet and drawer space: only 2 drawers and no bedside cabinets â€“ which was a problem, since we had extra clothes for sightseeing. Inexplicably, there was space enough for drawers beneath the TV, but the space was inaccessible. Apart from the fairly large desk, the room also has few surfaces. Complimentary wifi was provided in the room as well as in the very spacious executive lounge on the 32nd floor. The usual Hilton continental breakfast and late afternoon hors dâ€™oeuvres were also available in the executive lounge. However, there were often too few staff in the lounge and both the breakfast and hors dâ€™oeuvres ran out and was not replenished until requested. (When we drew the exec lounge managerâ€™s attention to the problem, she fixed the problem.) One of the really nice features about this hotel, apart from its central location, is the excellent swimming pool (which has an internal and an external part). The water is wonderfully warm and it is large enough to swim. There is also a large area with sun loungers. Again, however, staff are either in short supply or nonexistent, and the towels ran out on a couple of occasions. For the tourist, there are also plenty of OK restaurants on nearby King Street, although you need to be careful which you choose: the Indian 309 Dhaba Excellence is OK to good, Le Saint Tropez is also OK, as is the less expensive Quiznoâ€™s (Wellington Street). However, the NOT inexpensive Il Fornello at 214 King should be avoided; if you want something better, try the very good Portuguese seafood restaurant, Adega, on Elm Street, a few blocks uptown. For something even better, take a 20-minute cab ride to Il Molino on Eglinton Avenue West for a really great Italian (albeit pretty expensive) restaurant. We loved Toronto and will certainly return â€“ and despite some problems return to this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but do not park your car at their public garage!!!”
Reviews.Author: sherwin_r
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of it all! It is close to bars, restaurants, and the mall. Inside the hotel was nice. The room was comfy and the bed was extremely comfortable! The issue with this hotel is that the parking garage is a public garage. You also have to pay and absurd fee to take your car in and out of the garage. You have to pay every time you leave and come back. Luckily, everything is within walking distance so we decided to pay the one time fee. This means if you keep the car in the garage without taking it out, you just pay a fee of just $30 I believe for the entire weekend. Our car was there from 4am on Friday until Sunday. On Saturday morning, I got a very disturbing phone call from the hotel manager informing me that my rental car was broken into! Apparently, the person that broke in the car tried to steal the GPS that was mounted into the rental car. However, the crook was unsuccessful. There was glass all over the place. He/She did steal my car keys and house keys for god knows what reason since they would be no good to the crook since I live in New York. I guess I should have taken everything out of the car. I did not think it would be a concern. He crook didn't bother to take some expensive cologne, giorgio armani and expensive shades, ray bans and dior. I dont get it! On that same day, 7 other cars were broken into as well!!! Later, we learned, from one of the restaurant employees and the toronto police, that this public garage has been one of the main targets for theft in Toronto! This public garage has no cameras what so ever and only one or two security checks during the night, which was how it was discovered my rental was broken into. ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?! Thankfully, I decided to get insurance on the car, which was something I have never done before on any rental car in the past and I have driven to Mexico and Canada before too! I was able to drive to the Toronto airport and exchange the car without any issues. I must say kudos the manager for he took great care of us. He was extremely apologetic and very sincere! He almost made me feel sorry he was put in the position of telling me about the incident. The had a nice bottle of wine, cheese, crackers and fruit sent to our room. He paid for breakfast in their hotel restaurant and free dinner with anything we wanted from the menu. He also waved the hotel parking garage fee from the bill. He also allowed me to park the new rental car in the pick up and drop off area directly in front of the hotel along with 7 other cars that were broken into. It was crazy seeing all these cars parked there with busted out windows and a clear plastic tarp and tape for a replacement. I had no intentions of eating at the hotel for I know hotel food could be expensive, but since we didnt pay for it was great! Since we had the unfortunate incident of having our rental car broken into, I had to give this place an average rating. That made a huge difference! Otherwise, I didnt have a problem with this place. If I were to recommend this place to anyone, I would suggest he or she should park at a secure location.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location - but service?”
Reviews.Author: wakanaman
Reviews.Content: As some previous posters noted, nothing can beat the location of Hilton Toronto - it is well located for both business and leisure, and one might even decide (as we did) to turn a blind eye to other issues with this hotel (crumbling exterior, aging infrastructure, leaking toilet, awful smell in the rooms straight from the last century etc) as they are well disguised with Hilton design - and anyway, it's just a place to crash after sightseeing. What's pretty hard to ignore though is the very low level of bell service. Upon check-in, after spending minutes of waiting in front of the (otherwise empty) entrance, we decided to load a trolley ourselves, which finally prompted someone to show up. After check-in, we again couldn't find anyone to help with the luggage (front desk didn't seem too concerned about it either, although the lobby was practically empty) so we had to take the trolley to the room ourselves. Again, not a problem, although somewhat unusual in Hiltons. Upon checkout, I had to wait some 20 minutes for the bellman to show up (my wife was already downstairs: she later noted that she had seen plenty of bellmen chitchatting at the entrance, and zero guests checking in our out) - then another bellman, who helped to push the trolley out to the car, reminded me to tip... I found this rather distasteful: I would never forget to tip a bellman, but I prefer to keep it my own prerogative as to when I do it, and how much I give. Unfortunately we were in a hurry so I didn't have time to ask his supervisor about this unusual practice, but will certainly do next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable but aged hotel”
Reviews.Author: HRaeP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on a weekend get away. We used Hilton points and were placed in a junior suite on the 8th floor. It was a recently rennovated suite and had lots of space to relax. Not all suites and rooms have been rennovated - so ask for one that has! The pool area is small - but suffices. The outer building is made of concrete that is showing its age and has crumbled in parts. This hotel is in a GREAT location if you want to explore all of Toronto. You are in between the Queen and King street cars and the Subway stations - and a 5 minute walk to union station. If you are in Toronto on the weekend, buy a day pass for the public transportation. It covers two adults and up to 4 kids on the weekend for only $9CAD per day!!! You need to purchase then at a subway station but they are good on all public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location. Great city.”
Reviews.Author: CycloneHog
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Hilton Toronto and really enjoyed our stay. What a wonderful hotel! We relied a lot of Trip Advisor before our trip, so we thought we would give our best assessment of the Hilton Toronto. The Hilton Toronto's location could not be better We were a 15 minute walk from any destination in downtown Toronto. We loved it! The subway was a block away when we needed to take it to far away destinations like the Royal Ontario Museum and Casa Loma. The desk and staff was very helpful. Check-in was a breeze and several times we asked the hotel staff for directions and they were always helpful to point us in the right direction (We never used the concierge as they never seemed to be in when we needed directions.) We had a king room with a great view of University Avenue. The maid staff was timely and everything in the room was clean. We were on the 6th floor, so I suspect this is one of the newly renovated rooms. With the king bed and all our luggage, the room was a tight fit. At times it was a bit frustrating moving around a smaller hotel room. The bathroom and showers were adequate for our needs. The hotel has a great pool/hot tub area. We utilized this nearly every night. The pool is an indoor/outdoor pool where you can swim between locations. There were always clean towels available. Another neat feature is the "scenic elevators" where the glass opens out to a view of the city...the CN Tower looks great at night. We took it up to the 32nd floor to get a full-city view. The hotel is also connected to the PATH--Toronto's underground walkways. This proved very beneficial when we were caught on the harborfront as a thunderstorm blew in. We were able to walk from Union Station to the hotel indoors. I would imagine the PATH is a great benefit in the winter. We did not eat at a hotel restaurant nor did we need to park a car, so I can't offer advice on any of these services. Internet service cost $15/day. They really nickel and dime you on this one. Overall, we loved the Hilton Toronto. We could not ask for much more out of a hotel and would recommend to anyone that they consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: y996d
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, no issues or problems at all. Nothing negative. Good location, Amenities were OK. Spend most of the time out of the hotel so not much to say. The ambience of the rooms was a bit dark but the views were nice. Bathrooms a little bit tiny Would recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hilton is consistent at being inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: The title of the review says it all. I stayed three times at this Hilton, once in November 2008 and twice this past June (2009) and received a different level of service every time. Since the fall review might not be as accurate of the current situation, I'll based my comments on the last two stays in June. GENERAL COMMENTS: Overall, the Hilton Toronto is centrally located on Richmond, across pretty much from City Hall and an easy walking distance to the Eaton Centre. Even though it is a large hotel (602 rooms), it certainly feels more human in size than the massive Sheraton Centre situated diagonally across or the Delta Chelsea for that matter (both 1000+ room hotels) and the dÃ©cor in the public areas and rooms is more modern in style. Unlike some reviewers, I don't mind not having Valet Parking as I'd much rather park my car myself but it's pretty pathetic a city centre Hilton hotel would not provide such a service for those who want to use it. Parking is cheap on week-ends at the attached public garage (9$ a day). Service levels have been consistently declining (valet parking included, they just took it away) ever since Hilton Corporation, which used to own their city properties in Canada (Hilton Toronto, Toronto Airport, Montreal Bonaventure and Quebec City), sold them to Westmount Hospitality (same could be said about the one in Quebec city which is suffering service-wise compared to before the takeover by Westmount). Even some employees which I met during my two last stays (and I won't name which department they worked for no to put them in trouble) commented on how the recession excuse was being used to cut just about everything, including Air con in the staff's rest area (and I'm not trying to make this just an entertaining read but... on my second stay, it looks like they were trying to save on air conditionning in the lobby too, it was quite stuffy - Just try and go up to the meeting area where you have a few computers, that place has probably not seen air circulation since the last time they changed the carpet in 1999). That's pretty low from an employer to me and I can understand where the low morale comes from if that's an indication of how they treat their people. I'm one to believe in the saying "treat your staff well like family, and they will treat your customers the same way". Unfortunately, it looks like the bean counters at this Hilton forgot that saying when they walked in their classes at business school. STAFF: I think I covered up a bit in my general comments how the staff is at this hotel. Most, if you're kind to them, will be equally kind to you. Unfortunately, even though I appreciate them trying to be friendly, it shouldn't take 3 calls (including one to the duty manager) to get a room cleaned properly. Some on here have noticed communication seems to fail between departments at this hotel. I wholeheartdly agree. Sometimes, it also just depends on the employee. I wanted to book another Hilton hotel in the business center. This employee at the front desk told me to go use the business centre. When I inquired as if they had a free link to the Hilton website, she said, "no, you'll need to pay for it". Wait a minute? I want to book a stay again in the chain and you're going to make me pay for the privilege? That's a first in a Hilton. Fortunately, a more proactive staff member suggested I go use the meeting area business center where access for a few minutes would be free. During my first stay in June, I got asked checking-in if I wanted 2 double beds or a king. Well... I had booked 2 double beds for a reason so I was curious as to why I was being asked. She said that a lot of people booked 2 beds not really consciously through third party websites... I booked with HHonors on the website, I don't think this qualifies as third party. Regardless, I was upgraded to the executive floor which was useless since the lounge is closed on week-ends. Tip: If this happens to you, refuse the upgrade, the standard rooms on the lower floors and the Deluxe rooms on floors 20-24 are a lot nicer and more recently remodeled. ROOMS and FACILITIES: Rooms, just like the service and housekeeping, are usually inconsistent. Lower floor rooms (15 and below) were renovated less than a year ago and are very spacious, nice and new. Floors 16 to 23 are to be avoided as just when the elevator doors open, you will smell the older, stuffy hallways. This extends to the room also. Deluxe rooms are also very nice and some have rainshowers which is excellent. Executive level rooms are alright, I'd say not as bad as the unrenovated standard rooms but definately a notch below the deluxe and renovated standard. The only difference is that you get the top floors, lounge access and free water. I also found the mattress more comfortable in those rooms, the new ones in the renovated rooms gave the two of us a mix of back/neck pain in the morning. Housekeeping is this hotel's biggest weakness. On the stay back in Nov '08, the room clealiness could have been better but I brushed it off and didn't call. First stay in June, clean room, nothing to report. Third stay... where to start. Walked in the room. Noticed bread or some sort of muffin crumbs from previous guest on the carpet and it was all over the work desk. Work desk was also sticky (soft drink leftovers?) and had clearly not been cleaned. An elastic was just by the window on the carpet (again, no girls in the party so couldn't be ours). I decided to lift up the bed cover to discover small curly hairs. Make-up mirror light in bathroom burned. Alarm clock dimmer light burned so impossible to see anything when it was dimly lit or dark in the room. It took, as mentioned, three phone calls to get it resolved. The first time, we waited 30 min. for someone to come up, decided to go to the pool and comeback. An hour later, no one had been there. Called again, they changed the sheets (even though I had mentioned the crumbs and sitcky desk) but didn't clean the rest. Third call, I was promised the housekeeping in-charge. They did send someone who did a great job but failed to send their in-charge. To compensate, breakfast vouchers were offered with an apology so overall, they did the right thing but I would have rather had a clean room with functional appliances to start with. Facilities are overall very good. The hallway on our floor was not air conditioned and warm (some random girls we spoke to on the elevator noticed the same, cost-cutting measures???). The pool area is large and well-maintained with nice loungers. The entryway could have been cleaner. Tundra restaurant served an excellent buffet breakfast with lots of choices but absolutely not worth the 23$ (if my memory serves me right) price tag. You can go to Milestone's for an equally good brunch for 30-40% less. At 16-17$, their buffet would be good value but over 20$, that's just a rip-off in a city so full of breakfast options. The restaurant staff was very kind and cheerful, I will give them that! Internet access and local calls are included in Deluxe and executive rooms. Watch your check out slip as I had been charged local calls in a Deluxe room while it said they were free on Hilton's own website. Brought it to the attention of the agent at night and he said local calls were not free in deluxe rooms. The agent at check-out the next day said the opposite and told me her colleague was misinformed. BOTTOM LINE: With the central location, fairly spacious rooms with really nice dÃ©cor and a relaxing pool area in the summer (open year-round!), this could be such a nice Hilton. They seem to treat HHonors members fairly well also (I was satisfied with respect to them taking into accound floor and room location preference in my profile). It's really too bad poor management, staff training and housekeeping let it slip consistently. Hopefully, someone will wake up soon and smell the coffee but I won't be in rush to go back to check it out, unless the rates remain competitive (they have been fairly low recently and are frankly, not worth more than 130-140$ a night), then I might consider it and I'll let you judge if you should do so too. This is why I rate it as an "average" hotel overall with very inconsistent service.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, quiet, relaxing stay. In the heart of Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: chopin1981
Reviews.Content: Clean and pleasant room. Very nice and modern bathroom. Good housekeeping- at first they gave us 1 bath towel for each person, but after I requested more, they would leave us at least 4 every day. We got the really nice view from our window. The staff downstairs were very helpful and friendly. Never encountered long waiting. The restaurants provide great dining options. Ruth Chris' is highly recommended (pricey though- filet mignon is $47, side dishes are extra ($8.85). Ahi tuna was a really good choice as well. Exemplary dirty martinis. The pool was both in- and outdoor. There is a hot tub next to the pool. The only down side of my stay was the lack of valley parking. You have to park your car in the public parking garage, with an entrace right next to the hotel's main door. It cost $24 every 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Contemporary Hotel with Excellent Value and Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Upon entering the lobby, the lively music and decor were an instant attraction! We were greeted and checked in quickly! Our room was ready early and we had an amazing price! AAA rate of $99 per night, wow!!! The room was super clean, modern, comfortable! Bedding was the best!, like a big fluffy cloud! The bathroom was sparkling and just right with extras, like a toilet lid that lowered itself! The gym was full of the best machines and it was big! The swimming pool was inviting and very large, outdoor AND indoor, connecting! It was warm enough and cool enough for however you felt. The coffee in each room was the best, little individual coffees and teas which were so fresh and delicious! Oh, and the location was PERFECT! We walked almost everywhere because it was so central. I can't say anything but wonderful comments about this hotel! I will stay again and I am quite sold on Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Checked IN & Checked Right OUT”
Reviews.Author: indiefilmmaker
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this in saying, i know selecting a hotel is a very personal choice based on one's experiences. So if you've haven't traveled much and have few expectations, sure this hilton will do ok. Location is one of its biggest pluses. On the other hand, if you travel often globally and have experienced staying at a multitude of hotel chains both business & luxury hotels, this hilton is NOT for you. First off, there's no valet parking and parking is $30CAD/day and pending time of day, could be quite walk back to hotel since its a shared parking lot. Hotel itself is dimly lit and pends on what floor u are on, is quite in need of renovation. I was first put on the executive flr 24th, but the room was horrendous and outdated. Called the front desk and the receptionist admitted that executive flr was still in need of renovations, so offered to put me on the 22nd flr but woulnd't have access the exec lounge, etc. At this point I didn't care, but when arriving in the renovated rooms, left little to be desired for what I was paying. I immediately called the Intercontinental Hotel (self parking is $23 CAD/day) just a few blocks away and got not only a great room, but great rates for remainder of my stay. This Hilton does not live up to the standards of the Hilton brand or at least the more newer and/or renovated hilton hotels. Recommend either Intercontinental, Marriott or if your budget allows, hotels closer to University & Yorkville Ave such as Four Seasons, The Hazelton, or soon to open Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay at this Downtown City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the middle of June during the weekend of the Much Music Awards. The hotel is located on Richmond St. next to University Road and York St. It is located one short block to the TTC (Subway) and two blocks to Streetcar. We had a room on the 23rd floor and had a nice view of the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre. We also had Executive Lounge access since I'm being a Diamond Member with Hilton i'm afforded the access. I will say this was one of the nicest Executive Lounges of the many Hilton hotels that I've stayed at. Has a great view, very roomy, excellent staff in there, and great breakfast to say the least (coffee, three juices, eggs, bread, bagels, 4 fruits) The only thing i would say that dissappointed me was the Concierge. I having never been to the city, but know a lot about it, knew more than the Concierge. He didn't know anything about Tours of the City, unless it was the one that he deals through the hotel with (which we didn't use to say the least) He couldn't get driving directions for one guy, (since he said he doesn't use Mapquest, he uses GOOGLE) Using GOOGLE will not give you driving directions, that is what Mapquest is for, and the guy asking for the help was very dissappointing. Other than that, the rest of the staff were very nice and helpful. The pool area is great, an indoor/outdoor heated pool and hottub. Nice Outside Bar Restuarant area next to the pool with views of the city, feels like your more on the Rooftop than the 2nd floor. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel - would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: suttonsghirl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i visited this hotel in april. we arrived late in the evening to a clean and modern reception area and instead of wondering about trying to find somewhere to eat, we ordered room service and although we knew it would be expensive, it was lovely and very much needed after having no dinner! the hotel room we had was modern and clean, the bedding was soft and clean, the bed was massive. the pool was clean and ended up being the the two of us only in it at the times we went! the hotel was so central for everything we wanted to do and we walked everywhere! shops, bars, nightlife, tourist attractions - all so close! we only ate in the hotel one night - at the steak house down stairs - and although it was probably over priced, was a lovely atmosphere and the food was top class!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable & Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: hopearth
Reviews.Content: The updated room was very modern and chic. It had enough furnishings to store and scatter everything without getting messy. The king size bed was very comfortable with down cover that kept perfect temperature. There were pillows of various thickness so we can choose to our liking. It was heavenly. Spacious shower had a regular showerhead and also a rain shower. Nice touch. We loved the view of downtown Toronto from a large window. There were no other buildings in front of our room, so we left the curtain wide open and enjoyed the city view day and night. The location was very convenient. Within easy walking distance - Younge Street (the worldâ€™s longest shopping street), Queen Street full of charming shops and restaurants, CN Tower, NHL Hall of Fame, to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaqibQ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times. The hotel is well located, has a good Executive Lounge and fitness centre, and has been recently refurbished. It's a very good business type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but good enough”
Reviews.Author: PJTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for his business meeting and my sight-seeing. Location is great, hotel is your basic modern box. I think the exposed-concrete decor is pretty tiresome after the last forty years, but the rooms were nice in a beige-and-gray way. Some bits getting a bit shabby (woodwork, edge of our bathroom counter). When we arrived by car on a Saturday afternoon, doorman was there talking to what looked like a street vagrant, then just disappeared -- good thing we didn't need help! Self-parking is nice (you can get to your car to retrieve more stuff without having to keep tipping the valet parkers). One pub in the hotel is closed, as was pool, the remaining restaurant (Tundra) was very disappointing. All in all, your basic urban hotel -- fine if you can get a good price, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JetAirways
Reviews.Content: I have visited Toronto on business trip and booked the hotel Hilton in down town toronto. The hotel is magnificent and great hospitality. It's service is excellent with many attractions around the down town. Even the prices are competitive. The indoor cold and hot swimming pool, the terrace restaurant are nice amentities. The friendly staff assist in happenings around the down town and places to visit. I would recommend this hotel to any one visiting toronto especialy summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended stay for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: calibear314
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Downtown location - Appears well-maintained, recently renovated - Nice selection of restaurants - Good conference venues - Flat screen TV Cons - Hotels towels are old & used - No fridge in room - Small desk, not really condusive for working - Gym was basic, if underwhelming Stayed here for two days on a recent business trip and I have to say the hotel is recommended and no real major complaints. The rooms appear recently renovated and I enjoyed the carpeting within the room. Room walls were thick so it's good not to hear what your neighbors are up to in the middle of the night. Bathrooms were adequate and I really enjoyed the curved shower curtain rods, all high-end hotels really need this feature and this hotel did well on this end. In terms of service, I did not have much interaction with the staff so no complaints and nothing beyond the standard service level. Check-in staff were nice and accommodating for my small requests. The hotel benefits from being centrally located downtown with two good restaurant selections, Chris Ruth & Tuscani. Lobby bar and conference rooms are well maintained and not worn out. Enough dining selections so you don't have to use room service. While most of the software in terms of TVs and furniture is new, there were some chipping in the drawer cabinets. Towels were worn and used up, though. Gym is nothing to shout about, a bit underwhelming and depressing to be in though. Would recommend this for business travelers looking for a place in downtown. I got the conference room rate so it was a decent value for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little 'down-on-the-heel' for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: frameworks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in early April 2009. The lobby is nice, the room was great, although a little basic. The pool was disappointing... it was small, crowded, cold, and not as clean as one would expect. It is an inside/outside pool, but the worst I've ever been to. The sauna was non-existent, the hot tub was also very small -- 7 people were crowded in like sardines. There also is no spa. On a more positive note, we were given a $25.00 gift card for Ruths Chris, the steak house in the hotel. We decided to eat there and the food was EXCELLENT. The place was packed, maybe others had received the gift card...? Unfortunately, we paid our tab and then remembered the gift card a minute later -- they were rude about it and wouldn't adjust our bill to give us the $25.00. The main reason to stay here is the great location. You are a block away to trendy Queen Street nad the subway. We shopped, walked, had afternoon drinks at the REX nearby (live music). YukYuks (a comedy club) is also only a block away and we saw a great show there Saturday night, no reservations needed. I bought the room on Priceline.com, so only paid CDN $90 all in. I honestly would not pay a dollar more, it isn't worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Signs of Times?”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: This was our third or fourth stay at this property. It has become our favorite place to stay., especially for our quick weekend getaways in Toronto. However, we are very disappointed with the reduction in the level of service, especially regarding their executive lounge. Recently, the hotel decided to limit the hours of the executive lounge. It's closed all day Saturday, and does not reopen until 5 PM on Sunday. We checked in on Saturday and left on Sunday. Therefore, we could not use the executive lounge at all. No evening munchies, no free breakfast, no free nothing. Also, I thought the staff at checkin seemed to be not as expenced as we expected them to be, for the last two visits. Hopefully, when the economy recovers, the value and the quality of this peoperty will improve back to its original state. We will give this property one more chance before we look elsewhere, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Rhydz
Reviews.Content: hotel it self is great, good quality, its just too bad the staff are completely useless. when i checked in, i was put in a room where it hadnt been clean after the last person left. then there was the wake up call that never happened (it was lucky i woke up early anyway, not to mention the staff did not know how to place a wake up call for 1.5 hours time). then when i ordered room service they neglected to deliver me half of the food i paid for. for an expensive hotel you pay for service. i've stayed at a few expensive hotels in toronto and this has to be the worst out of all of them. go else where if its the same price.

Reviews.Title: “HILTON TOOK CARE OF ME”
Reviews.Author: MACismyboyfriend
Reviews.Content: Myself, my siblings, my father and some extended family had a weekend stay here in February of 2009. We arrived very early (9am-ish) and they got us checked in by around 11:00....which is excellent, considering check-in is 4pm...and this wasn't an issue because one of our family members already had a room. The room was very clean, good decent size with a good size bathroom as well. The houskeepers did an excellent job at cleaning our rooms and especially came through when myself and my 2 siblings got sick with the flu (which extended our stay by 2 nights)... First of all, the hotel staff were completely accommodating and got us a third adjoining room to the 2 adjoining rooms we were already occupying (for my dad because he was the only one without the flu).. The housekeepers came frequently to sanatize our room for us (because of our being sick) but did not disrupt us by any means..as we needed lots of rest.. even when they just came to get towels they would insist on cleaning to toilet etc. even just briefly to keep the bathroom cleanly.. They really went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable the entire trip but especially after we became sick.. they even extended our good rate for our last 2 nights..including to the third room we had to book.. Overall, I would definietly return to this hotel.. ..when you are sick with the flu the ONLY place you want to be is home and the Hilton really did their best to make us feel at home My ONLY complaint would be that there was no optional wireless internet..which would've been nice because we all had our laptops... but really, I cannot complain

Reviews.Title: “To honor or not to honor...”
Reviews.Author: MachitaMeg
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold member and have never been to a hotel less welcoming to an honors member. I was not upgrade to executive floor.. fine. But I cannot recal ever being denied access to the executive floor. It wasn't just the issue, but the delivery. Hotel was okay. Great location. Decent furniture. Staff is lackluster.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly cozy!”
Reviews.Author: LittleLouOttawa
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to get away for a weekend in March and thanks to Hotwire -- found ourselves at the Toronto Hilton. At first glance, you'd think it was just another downtown monolithic concrete hotel with no soul. Surprisingly, inside, the hotel is quite modern and warm. We arrived at 2:30 pm -- a tad early for check-in -- but had no trouble getting our room. Despite my Hotwire special, we were treated very nicely and when I asked about getting a nice room on a high floor -- she put us up on the 18th floor. The room -- a standard with a King bed -- was pretty much as you'd expect -- but it was very large and the furniture, quite modern. Gone was the old TV armoir -- and in its place, a sleek and long bureau. The bathroom was standard, though with a slightly larger bathtub -- and all was very , very clean. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but had drinks in the bar -- and received great service. I swam in the pool, soaked in the nice jacuzzi, and spent some time in the sauna. All very clean and surprisingly quiet. The pool was great -- indoor, but with a little swimming canal to take you outside. It isn't the funkiest neigborhood in Toronto. You are in the heart of the financial district -- lots of big banks, and insurance companies abound. But it's easy to get around and there's still no shortage of things to see and walk to within 20 minutes, including ample shopping. All in all -- the Toronto Hilton was just what the doctor ordered. A big, corporate hotel, which felt smaller and boutique-ish somehow. And what a crazy price. Oh, but parking is a tad expensive. I found a cheaper lot but it still set up back about $20 per night. It's $30 per night apparently at the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the staff - a great experience overall!”
Reviews.Author: timesensitive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for a weekend getaway to take in a couple of shows and do some shopping. Concierge was very helpful as we arrived at the most congested time of the day. The Guest Service agent at the front desk was very pleasant, smiled kindly and actually looked at me when she was speaking to me - what a refreshing change from our visit to the Hilton in Niagara Falls last fall. We did enjoy an incredible dinner in Ruth's Chris - superb food and genuine service. After we returned from the play, we ordered dessert from room service - friendly, quick and efficient. Our guestroom was comfortable and clean with the exception of a few small hairs on the bathroom ceiling and back of the bathroom door. I must emphasize how safe I felt in this hotel - security was stationed at the elevators to the guestrooms allowing access to only those who had a room key. It was very quiet - just far enough away from the entertainment district with people filled sidewalks at all hours of the night. We enjoyed a peaceful night with no outside noise to wake us. I did not have the opportunity to see or meet any manager but the line staff were certainly well trained and cordial. Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton is a modern gem in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto quite frequently for business and leisure and this was my first time staying at the Hilton. My wife and I loved the hotel and it is our new favorite in Toronto. We usually stay at the Sheraton (one street over), but the Hilton was more modern, cleaner, had better service, and was less crowded. The last time we stayed at the Sheraton we found that the weekends had a lot of party goers which made sleeping through the night very difficult, the Hilton was very quiet and we were able to get a good night's rest on their comfortable beds. The only drawback to the hotel is that they didn't have valet parking for my SUV, and I could not park it in their garage so I had to park a couple of blocks away. I would have also liked to have brought my dog with me, but they charge a $75 room cleaning fee, so I opted to leave him at home. It would be nice if they would revise the pet fee downwards in the future; however, the hotel is a great stay regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm....”
Reviews.Author: jessphi
Reviews.Content: Not too impressed. It's one of the hotels I cannot remember a thing about a room after a while, meaning the room was plain, not too good not too bad. Oh the view was pretty good. We're on a higher floor facing the tower looking down the pool. The terrible thing about the hotel (which is the only thing that's still in my memory) was the room-service bf. Terrible food and service! Wait time was more than an hour. The flatwares were dirty(??). OJ tasted like it was squeezed from a rotten orange. Asked a replacement and it took another 40 min. The waiter was waiting for another tip for the second glass of juice. A cold omelet and a cold and hard piece of bread. Geez, my worst room-service breakfast ever... Toronto itself was fun. Try French restaurants in downtown. The riverside was beautiful and lively.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Except Value”
Reviews.Author: cromartie
Reviews.Content: Not an architectural gem by any means, the Hilton in Toronto is nonetheless a quality place to stay for both business and leisure in downtown Toronto. I get a kick out of the little things, and the elevators that face the outside are a treat to ride in, unless you have a fear of heights. This is a Hilton, of course so it is inherently high class in presentation and organization. The rooms are recently renovated and show it, with a wonderful, comfortable bed, new television and quality furnishings complete with a comfortable work area and a nice desk chair. The rooms aren't perfect, however, as the walls, particularly in the bathroom, show their age. I also found the room air conditioner to be an under powered disappointment. Housekeeping is prompt and comprehensive, the business area is complementary, the breakfast buffet is on a high floor and very good, and service is generally friendly even if the lobby shows off a little too much of the brutalist design that went into the building's construction. Parking is price appropriate for downtown Toronto, but I'm a little disappointed guests don't get any sort of discount on the day rate for the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Brownsfamily
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton Toronto was great. We were greeted by a courteous, pleasant Desk Clerk who not only checked us in promptly but informed us that we had been upgraded to a Club room. The room was spacious and well appointed, and the view from the 31st floor facing Lake Ontario was great. The service & the food in the Executive lounge located on the 32nd floor was second to none and it was nice being able to conveniently avail of the business centre which was located on the other side of the room. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better - we were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go in the downtown core. We very much enjoyed our stay - it was a great weekend and the only way it could have been better, is if we could have extended our stay.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended to stay at”
Reviews.Author: bingowingo
Reviews.Content: I used a 4 days/3 nights stay thru my Hilton honors account and sad to say, this Hilton hotel sucks. First of all, when I first checked in, the girl at the front desk(got her name, Latanya), checked me at a room wherein there was still someone inside! Good thing they were not around as it would be so embarrasing that the person would be inside. The bags were there and so were the clothes, so I knew someone was still in the room. After telling them that someone was in our room, Latanya mentioned that she would put me in 20th floor with a free internet access-an upgrade, for the mistake, but backtracked when she found a room on the same floor(26th floor) without internet access. Anyhow I called them up few weeks before and they told me that the lobby and restaurant had free wifi, so I decided to use my wifi at the lobby instead. Latanya gave me a code to access the free wifi at the lobby, but when I checked out they were charging me wifi since I used it at the lobby(what the ??)...also the room was really really bad as I had problems with my coffee maker since when I tried getting water, there seemed to be a problem with their electricity as it was going on and off, I think it has something to do with them connecting the parallel wires from the coffee maker and the light at the hallway to the restroom. I requested to be changed into another room but they didnt want to change the room since they told me that I have changed twice(first from their mistake, second is i didnt like the view---i asked them to change it to the view of cn tower)..the third room I got had problem with the coffeemaker. Their housekeeping sucks as well as I had to request for 2 of everything as I was travelling with my sister, who used up most of the shampoos, so I keep on asking them to provide me with 2 shampoos, 2 soaps.and they only give me one....when I request for it at around 8 am..it takes them 30 minutes to bring it to the room....one night I had to go downstairs just to ask them why my toiletries werent there yet. Anyhow, as I was checking out I was surprised why there was a 12.95 bill plus tax..and I disputed that, since when I checked my bill the night prior to me checking out(Saturday) I spoke to the front desk and they told me wifi was free at the lobby and that my bill was clean..but when I checked out...lo and behold, there was a 12.95 plus tax charge of using the wifi at the lobby!!! weird! Good thing they took that off when I disputed that charge but I wouldnt stay at this hilton again...

Reviews.Title: “"worst stay ever!"”
Reviews.Author: girlie1234
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay of my life! When I arrived to the hotel to check in the front desk person could not find our reservation. When she did find the reservation she informed me that I would not have a smoking room as they were all reserved. (we specifically booked with this hotel because the reservations team assured us that it would be a smoking room). We would be entertaining some guests of ours later on who were smokers and were really disappointed that we didnt get what we asked for. However, working in the hotel industry, I know that the global reservations team can say things that aren't always true knowing they wont deal with the consequences on check in. The front office manager then told us he would upgrade us to one of the CN tower rooms to make up for the problem. This room had no view of the CN tower what so ever. The front office agent who was orginally checking us in was so rude i had never dealt with such bad customer service in my life! Aside from that the room was fine. The decor was nice but definitly not worth the $200 charge for the room. In the morning when we were checking out I realized I had forgotten my cell phone in the room. My boyfriend went upstairs to check for it but couldnt get back into the room. The front office clerk contacted housekeeping who had picked the phone up. After waiting 20 minutes for the phone i became very aggrevated. We had to wait an hour and a half for the phone to finally make it to the front desk! While this was going on, our friend who was driving us was waiting with his car at the front doors. The bellboy informed him that if he didnt move his car it would be towed. After explaining the situation of why he was waiting the employee came inside and told me that the car would be towed and it wasnt their problem if our phone had got lost somewhere throughout the hotel. A couple minutes later the phone had arrived and we were on our way NEVER to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMuffin81
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Hilton is located in the downtown area of Toronto, in the middle of the city's financial district. It's about 30 floors high, but it still easily one of the smaller htels in the area, being dwarfed by the Sheraton opposite. We visited the hotel about a month before Christmas and the hotel was more than ready. The first thing that hit us when we walked into the beautiful reception area was the huge Christmas tree, and carol singers. It made us feel warm and festive before we'd even checked in. And being ass it it was snowing outside, the warm feeling was more than welcome! Check-in was so easy and friendly. nothing was too much trouble. We had arrived quite early, so the porter took our bags and showed us to the bar, where we sat down with a couple of Baileys looking out over snowy Toronto. It was incredibly romantic. The rooms were opulent. The beds wewre huge and the bathrooms had marble floors and huge oversized showers. We even got our own bathrobes, which were so thick I felt like the Andrex puppy. We had requested a high floor, and a high floor is what we got. We could see out over half of the city. Unfortunately it was facing north. It would have been nice to be the other side of the corridor where the views would have overlooked the CN Tower and Lake Ontario. The lifts were fabulous, glass-fronted elevators that swept up the side of the building. Great for adrenalin junkies like me, but not so good for those with a spot of vertigo. Facilities at the hotel are great. The pool and sauna is small, but quiet. The pool stretches out on to the roof terrace, but in the sub-zero November chill, I'd not recommend trying it out! The gym is also small but very clean. The restaurants and bars are all incredibly good quality and no matter where you go, the staff are friendly and seem genuinely intereested in you. The location is perfect for all the big attractions. It's just a few minutes waalk from the CN Tower, Lake Ontario, the Air Canada Centre, and the main shops. One of its best features is that it's connected to The Eaton Centre via PATH, an underground shopping maze. It really is quite a spectacle. It's a never-ending maze of shops that connect up most of downtown Toronto and lead to the main shopping centre. All in all, I'd head back to this hotel in a flash. It really is the most wonderful hotel I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: proreach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Toronto Nov 29th & 30th. We found the location was excellent. We were within walking distance to everything (in the downtown). Also, the Hilton is on the P.A.T.H. underground walkway (which means that you can walk underground throughout most of downtown Toronto). The P.A.T.H. was very handy due to all the rain this past weekend (which allowed us to walk around town without getting wet). I also liked the fact that on the Saturday night, the hotel was monitoring the elevators so that only registered guests could get to the rooms (we saw several people who where is groups of 4 that only registered 2 people per room). I found the rooms were clean, but a bit dark. We did order room service the one night, and the food was above average. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations for a 4-Star Hotel in downtown Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: I used PriceLine to bid for my room: $110CDN/Night - on the weekend. The hotel met my expectations of a 4-Star in downtown Toronto. The parking was expectedly high, not that you can do anything about it in that area. The front lobby was modern, but not warm and inviting as some other hotels. Rooms within this hotel are under renovations, and newer rooms show very well. The city-view is better then the CN Tower view, which is obstructed by other buildings. With five working elevators, the wait is never long no matter what floor youâ€™re on. The walls were surprisingly thin for a quality hotel, especially towards hallway noise. Everything was expected and satisfactory except for basic amenities required. I was charged high fees for internet use, local phone calls, and $8 for borrowing a bowl from the hotel to eat dinner in my room. It is worth it to call ahead and ask for a room on the top floors, as the view is quite nice! We stayed on the 22nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Room needed renovation”
Reviews.Author: sked789
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights as part of a conference. The hotel itself is, as one would expect of a Hilton, very nice, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was quite large with a comfy bed. However, the bathroom was desperately in need of renovation: the paint was peeling off the walls and ceiling, the chrome had worn off the leaking faucet, and years of leaking plumbing had eroded and discoloured the tiling. It was clean, but quite unexpectedly run down for a hotel at this price point. The room also faced construction (as of Nov 08) and was noisy, even on the 17th floor, as of 6:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice”
Reviews.Author: wise2374
Reviews.Content: I am not a huge fan of the Hilton chain, but this stay is making me wonder what else I may be missing. This is a truly lovely and sleek hotel, with a zen-lite atmosphere in both the public spaces - which are very handsome - and in the rooms - which are comfortable and with terrific fixtures. My room was clearly renovated somewhat recently - I'm not sure if they all are - but from the bed to the desk to the shower - it all works. Feels more like a W than a Hilton. Having stayed in the grander but also more worn Fairmont, I think I'll choose this place every time. No valet parking is a drawback, but that's just about all I can think of not to like.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly? Not really.”
Reviews.Author: mcs386
Reviews.Content: This was an HHonors stay, using points slowly accumulated through past stays and a Hilton credit card for 2 adults and our 3 dogs. I called the Toronto Hilton directly on Friday, 10/17 to confirm the reservation. I wanted to make sure they had seen the note on the internet reservation that I was bringing 3 small dogs (Pekingese) with me. The women I spoke with in Reservations said that yes, it was noted about the dogs. She said there was a $50 refundable DEPOSIT for the dogs to stay in the room. I asked if the room had a refrigerated minibar as one of my dogs takes a liquid prescription medication twice a day. She said the room did not have a minibar, but she would put in a request for a refrigerator. I checked into the hotel about 5 pm on Saturday 10/18. I was told there were no refrigerators available (so glad I called ahead!). I said what about putting me in a room with a minibar? No, those are only on the Executive Floors and dogs aren't allowed on those floors. Finally the Manager came up with the option of keeping the medication in the refrigerator at the Front Desk area. That was acceptable. Then, I was told it was not a deposit for the dogs, but a FEE. Oh, and the fee was no longer $50, but had recently gone up to $75. Then the front desk clerk stated she wasn't sure if the FEE was per room or per dog. Hmmm. Let's see, from a customer expectation of $50 deposit (refundable) to $75 fee x 3 dogs =$225. For my "FREE" room. I told her if the fee was per dog then I was walking out the door. The Manager then compromised by charging me "only" $50 (plus taxes, of course!) The next time I want to travel with my dogs, I will be sure to seek out a truly pet-friendly chain such as Starwood. As for the room, it was well appointed, clean and spacious. We were suprised to hear the bass from loud amplified music on Sunday morning (8 am?) on the 19th floor. I can't imagine how loud it was on lower floors. Unbeknownst to us, the Toronto Marathon was right outside our door, along with a water stop and music blaring. A little warning would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guelph_geek
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 days at the Hilton and was happy with the stay. The pricing is a little high but OK. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and nicely appointed. Although almost too shallow for my liking, I enjoyed the pool and being able to swim from inside to outdoors. I can't comment on the food because I never ate there. I was on business at Dundas Square (downtown if you haven't been there) and there are so many reasonably priced places to eat it didn't make sense to pay premium prices at the hotel. Now this is absolutely nothing against the Hilton, but watch the extra charges for parking, taxes, internet, landline calls etc, etc. It's a pet peeve of mine that ALL these downtown hotels charge for things like parking and internet ? Bugs me, especially when a few miles up the highway all that's free.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: mistralksk
Reviews.Content: My room was in on of the higher floors with views to the CNN Tower and was very noisy: There was a big aircondition machine over the closer building going on the whole day and night! and it was very dificult to sleep; People in reception was rude, also the man in the door. Rooms are old. Just the executive room was excellent, including the crew in it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Spotless room. Great service. Was upgraded to HHonors floor (and used points). Room very up to date. Food excellent. Free use of nearby health club. (No I don't work for Hilton.) My only criticisms: Candy bars and junk food in room to tempt you (not locked in mini-bar). Returned them to the front desk Single cup coffee maker dispenses a witches brew--and not enough of it. Why do Hilton's use these dreadful machines. Garbage cans (as with all Hiltons) so narrow virtually useless. All Hiltons have both of the above. Ok they are nits. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking downtown”
Reviews.Author: R55wilson
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Honors Gold members and were surprised that this Hilton did not have Valet parking? If you must drive to this Hilton be prepared to pay $30 dollars a day to park your car. The food and room service was very good and fast. Apparently Hilton Honors has changed their rules on gold members, they told us at check in that they did not have a room on the Executive level available so because we did not have an executive room we could not use the executive lounge, when we complained they did give us access and free Internet use as well. If you do purchase a Gold membership be prepared to have to negotiate at each Hilton to get the upgrades you paid for

Reviews.Title: “Great for a solo female traveler”
Reviews.Author: ChicPea
Reviews.Content: As a female traveling alone, I felt very safe and attended to at the Hilton Toronto. The location was great, the concierge and desk clerks were helpful and I felt comfortable walking by myself in the surrounding neighborhood. When I arrived back at the hotel from attending a Saturday evening concert at Massey Hall that let out around 11 p.m., two employees were stationed in front of the elevator to make sure anyone going near that area had a room key. That gave me a secure feeling as well. It took around 12-15 minutes to walk to Massey Hall and was very easy and safe to do alone. Also, there were some decent places to eat along the way along with great places to shop. While I could have gotten a much better deal on the room (start your bids at $80 on priceline and go up from there), it was still a good value. I called a day before my arrival and requested one of the renovated rooms on one of the higher floors and the staff kindly accommodated me. I felt very lucky! The room was spacious, modern clean and nicely appointed, and the bed felt heavenly and comforting after a long day. It definitely felt like a business traveler's room, but I liked it and it beautifully served my needs. The only complaint is that the bathroom smelled musty/mildewy even though on the surface it looked clean. Since my stay was brief, I chose to overlook this. I enjoyed riding the elevator with the outdoor view. Parking was easy as well and yes, it was a bit expensive, but very convenient, so no complaints! The biggest hassle was getting into downtown. The Gardiner Expressway was closed so what should have taken 10 minutes by car took an hour. Be smart and call ahead to ask about road construction, closings, etc. Also, while there, many streets were closed due to a movie being filmed near the hotel. This complicated getting to the hotel as much as the Gardiner Expressway being closed. While the filming was probably an unusual occurrence, it would have been good to know about this in advance. The next day for breakfast I decided to splurge and eat at Tundra--one of the restaurants at the Hilton--because I liked the modern decor and because I had an enjoyable breakfast there once before. Again, it's a bit costly, but the convenience and quality is worth it. For $23 (CAD) plus tax, the buffet, which has many choices, such as eggs benedict, pea meal bacon, fresh fruit and wide selection of breads/muffins, also includes tea and juice. There seem to be plenty of other nice places to eat in the area with much lower prices, so you definitely have options. Overall I felt pleased with my experience and would stay at the Hilton Toronto again. It seems like everyone I encountered was very kind and accommodating and the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SugarCreek
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Toronto Hilton for four nights. My husband was there for a conference. We requested and received a renovated room with a view towards the CN tower. It had all the usual Hilton amenities, although it could have been slightly cleaner, especially the carpet. The bed was great and I like having a chair with an ottoman for reading. The hotel location is very convenient, with a subway stop nearby. Other than to the Distillery District, we walked and rode the subway everywhere. There is no minibar in the room, although there is a coffee/tea maker. Pet peeve: $12.95 per day for Internet service?! The indoor/outdoor pool is nice, but be for warned, the gym is being renovated, although the hotel does give you a pass for a nearby health club. They are also doing other renovation which we could not hear from our room, but was very loud in the lobby. Also, there was a loud party on our floor one of the nights (Several rooms had their doors propped open, so the party was literally in the hall!). It took two calls to security, but eventually it was taken care off.

Reviews.Title: “A definite 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: nosensestayinghome
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel room for a real steal at $69 per night through hotwire. My sister, father and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel over the Labour Day weekend. The hotel is 1 block from the Eaton's centre. The hotel is currently finishing renovations to the rooms but this was not a problem. The rooms are among the largest I have ever stayed seen in a hotel. We were given a complimentary cot in the room without being charged in order to accomodate 3 people in the room. The gym was undergoing renovations and we were given complimentary passes to a local highscale gym. The gym was about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. There was an indoor/outdoor pool, spa and sauna but we did not make use of these. The staff was also extremely helpful and able to answer our questions and fill our requests. I have stayed at many downtown Toronto hotels. This was by far the best stay yet. Note however, that we paid only $69 a night. The regular rate is $189. I could not afford this price on my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TXHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for $70 on Priceline, and we were very pleased with it. It's in a great location in downtown Toronto that is connected to the underground walkways. This was really nice because it was raining during our visit. We were able to use the underground walkway to walk to the CN Tower and Rogers Centre. We also had an amazing view of the CN Tower from our room. The bathroom is very modern and the beds are comfy. Overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: anhesty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my business trip and I thought the hotel was great. The only thing was that they were remodeling their gym so the gym was out of service but the city is a walking city and if you needed exercise you could just put on your tennis and start running around the city. This hotel is in a great location. I was able to pretty much walk anywhere I needed to go and the subway was near by as well. The room was always clean and the bathroom was clean as well. No water stains or anything. The food wasn't too bad at the Tundra but it is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “wet sheets!!!!”
Reviews.Author: StratfordJaxie
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 1 night with the family after seeing a Jays game. We got to our room on the 26th floor with an amazing view. All was fine until it was bedtime. The kids got under the covers and yelled,"the bed's wet!" Indeed it was, all the way down to and including the mattress. The top of the Duvet was dry which was why we didn't notice it right away. We called the front desk and they sent up someone from housekeeping. Since the mattress was wet they couldn't help. The front desk called up to our room about 5-10 minutes later and asked us if we would like a room change, but all that was available was a king room with 1 bed. I told them that 4 people wouldn't fit. They said that was all they had. I asked the manager to come up to our room. When they came up they said that housekeeping had said that we had spilled something on the bed. I told them no and that if I had spilled on the bed, I would clean it up and not ask for a room change. Once they understood that we had not wet the bed, there was a room available for us with 2 beds. We moved down at 11pm to an ok room but not as nice as the first one. Will not stay here again, very suspicious that sheets were not changed after the guests left. GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “Truly accessible hotel”
Reviews.Author: smilinsooz
Reviews.Content: I am in a wheelchair and the downtown Toronto Hilton is far and above THE best and most accessible hotel I have ever stayed at. The roll in shower and the grab bars near the toilet are items not always found in other hotels. The lower napped rug and hardwood floors made it easy to get around. We never turned the television on during our stay because the view from our window was so beautiful.We kept saying "I want to live there !! ". I travel a lot and this has been our best hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton - good location and exec lounge”
Reviews.Author: ryan444
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the downtown Toronto Hilton on numerous occasions and as recently as the week of June 16th. As a Hilton Gold Hhonors member, I receive an upgraded room on the executive floor and access to the executive lounge. The room is nice enough.. a nice marble bathroom and a great view looking south from the 30th floor overlooking Lake Ontario. The front lobby is very nice and the Ruths Chris steakhouse in the basement is very tasty. The executive lounge on the top floor is always great with a decent breakfast and evening hors doeuvres. One disappointment on this visit was their change to an honour bar system which I was told is now the case at all Hiltons in the world. Whenever I stay in downtown Toronto this is my choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Showing signs of aging....”
Reviews.Author: Faithful_Suitcase
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks in June for business. Hotel was booked by my secretary so I don't know how reservations are but my reservation was there and check-in was quick so there were no issues there. The lobby is a little strangely laid out and not a place for people to congregate but is fine. The room was ok. The hotel is showing signs of aging and needs an update fairly soon as it's starting to look more Hotel 6 than Hilton. The bathroom was particular dated having cracks in tiles and rust spots throughout. The room is a generous size and had quite a comfy lounger to sit and watch TV from. The typical Hilton bed is wonderful as usual. I never went to the outdoor pool but on the days it was hot it appeared packed from my window. This means it's either too small or very nice. The gym is cramped with old equipment and not sufficient for a hotel of this size/quality. It seems like an afterthought that is in a converted storage room. I went for breakfast a couple of the mornings and it was quite good with many choices and a neat idea of displaying nutritional information of each choice. being used to Europe and Asia, I did find it quite pricey however. The room service was also decent on the two occasions I tried it. Location wise was ok. It is on the northern edge of the financial district which was convenient for work, but I would have rather stayed somewhere equidistant to my work in the direction of the water, (i.e. York). Next time I'm summoned to Toronto for work I will probably request for a different hotel just because I assume that there is better value in some of the other places around.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: banker_barbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of the Norther Ink Exposure tattoo convention, and I don't have many good to say about this property other than it was close to where I needed to be. The convention centre was FREEZING cold - apparently management had decided the tattoo machines were emitting CO2... and cranked the air up to an untolerable level in the convention centre. The food down there was a rip off as well - $4 for a slice of very unfresh pizza and $7 for a drink. By mid day the bathrooms were in horrible condition; over the 3 days we never saw anyone come through to clean during the convention hours. The rooms were clean, but nothing fancy. The bathrom and carpets were very dated. The views of University Ave. and the office towers downtown were beautiful. We ate at Barristers, the bar & grill in the lobby - STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. The bartender was SO rude; we stood there for 20 minutes waiting to be served while he puttered around organizing the bar. When we asked for take out food - which we had seen several ppl with around the hotel - he advised me there was no take out available at that restaurant. When I advised him I had seen ppl eating it in the lobby, he rolled his eyes and handed me a menu. We paid $46 for two burgers with fries - no drinks.. which were raw. I had eaten almost half of mine before I realized the funny taste was bleeding beef, not the sauce. I've never been so sick in my life as I was that night. When we took the burgers back to the bar, they recooked them, and put them back in the same take out containers as the raw meat - they didn't even replace the fries we had eaten. The burger 2nd time around was burned and hard enough we could've used it as a hockey puck. Parking is also bad here; you have to park at a public garage attached to the hotel, under an office tower, so finding space mid day Mon-Fri is almost impossible. I had to sit in my truck for about 40 mins before someone came down and left, and I took their spot. Parking is also $24 a day (up to 6 PM) and another $6 if you stay over night, so basically $30 to park. On the whole, I would stay at the Delta or Royal York any day! I DEFINATELY won't be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Looks fine from the surface”
Reviews.Author: What_a_view
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for the week as part of a large group meeting. The hotel lobby and elevators looked great. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The food was mediocre. My room though was not at all clean. The bathroom was the worst - whiskers in the sink, smelly shower curtain, toilet bowl stains, older towels and lighting that worked intermittently (had the staff come twice to fix the problem). The room's carpets were not thoroughly vacuumed, not lately it seemed. Although the sheets were crisp and clean, the duvet was worn and thin (the filling was sparse and had mostly shifted to the four corners). This Hilton appears as though it's an older hotel that's been refurbished (not in its entirety or well though). I wouldn't recommend it and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jbomb060
Reviews.Content: The Hilton downtown was a nice hotel with a great location on the corner of Richmond and Spadina. Short walk to Yonge St. The staff was friendly though at first they charged me twice for parking ($60). Parking itself is quite high at $30 but it is downtown. The room was nice though I was only on the 7th floor so my view consisted of an office building. If you want a better view you can always take the "scenic elevator" to the 32nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to lock your door!”
Reviews.Author: bluebirdx
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending the night at the Hilton in Toronto...what a nightmare. Booked online using Priceline.com for $130/night, regular price was around $300 so we were happy to get a discount. Priceline rocks, we use it all the time. When we arrived to check-in and their computers were down, so they made everyone wait while they printed off all of the bills for the entire hotel to prepare for the upcoming rush of guests checking out. After making us wait about 30 minutes, they began to check people into the hotel manually one by one. When we finally were checked in and made it to our room, not even 10 minutes later another family walked into our room. Thank goodness we hadn't started to change yet!!! Called down to the desk and complained...the 2nd family went back down to the lobby to sort things out. Then my husband went to get ice and couldn't get back into the room because they had deactivated both the key cards for the family that tried to get in, along with our own. We called down again and they said that someone would deliver new key cards for us. My father was staying in another room, so we called him to let him know that we had had people walk into our room and that he should put the chain lock on. He said that housekeeping hadn't done anything to his room prior to check-in, so he decided to change and then go down to the lobby to complain but houskeeping walked in on him while he was in the midst of changing. He had called down to the front desk and they had told him that they would deactivate his keys and send him new ones. The new keys arrived at my room almost and hour later, and then 20 mins after that they still had not arrived at my father's room. They then delivered keys almost an hour and a half later, and then brought a 2nd set of keys to our room. It was chaos, and the thing that really made me angry was that they never seemed to REALLY be sorry for the inconvenience. The least the hotel could have done was offer us complimentary breakfast or SOMETHING!!! The room was OK, not overly clean....there were hairs on the duvet. The bathroom really needed some work. There were rust stains around the sink, and the shower head was falling apart with large lime stains. Breakfast buffet was $26 per person, parking was $18. The pool was closed, you had to walk to another hotel to use the pool. Everyone in our hallway received a paper in the morning except for us. So to sum everything up...YIKES, never again. I felt that I had been ripped off even at $130 per night. I can't even begin to imagine the thoughts of someone who was paying $300+/night.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travellers, ok for tourists”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Toronto, as with most other Hilton in Eastern Canada has been upgrading the look and feel of its common areas (hallways, rooms) over the last few months. During my last stay I stayed in one of their "junior suite", which is really a slightly oversized room. There is no real division between the "bedroom" portion and the "living room" portion. To create the optics of a suite, they have put the TV in the middle of the room which creates a line between the two portions. The new furniture (living room portion) is a good improvement over what was in place before. I also have lounge access at the Hilton. The lounge features a very good continental breakfast in the morning and has hors-d'oeuvre in the early part of the evening. The lounge used to be very crowded at all time in the evening but I have found that things have quieted down a little bit since the drinks are no longer complimentary. I have stayed in different rooms at this hotel over the last few months and have experienced different "designs". Some rooms have new stand-in showers type bathroom (no bathtub). They look nice but water tend to spill everywhere so... The Hilton is my #1 spot in Toronto as it usually offers a good balance between amenities, price, service,...

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhzll
