Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business and enjoyed the stay pretty well. The room was not overly spacious but it was not cramped either. The bed was comfy and the food was good. I think they may have had the best staff I have encountered in sometime and they were very accomadating as well. The only thing I could think of that was not awesome was the bathroom. It was a little cramped and when I first got in, I don't feel that it was as clean as it could have been. But the housekeeping took care of that.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Aspects Too Numerous To Mention...”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at the Hilton Toronto and could not wait to leave. Although we stayed there over 2 years ago, the unpleasant memory sadly still remains! To begin, the furniture in our room was badly damaged, the paint on the walls in some areas was visibly peeling and cracking, there were blood stains on the furniture upholstery, the large dark stains on the carpet could not be overlooked, the sink was leaking, the bathroom was deplorable, and the list goes on and on.... My husband and I are long-time Hilton Honors Diamond Members with 100+ stays per year and were told that there were no executive room upgrades available at the time of our check-in (Diamond members are supposed to receive an automatic upgrade). This was odd because the hotel appeared to be empty. Never again will we stay at this property nor will we recommend it to anyone else. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Ryan344
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire for decent rate but in the end got about what I paid for. THE ROOM: Half the lights were burned out, most likely trying to hide the terribly peeling wallpaper. There was no remote control for the TV. Really could have used a mini-bar. THE REST: Ruths Chris restaurant is probably the best thing going on in the hotel, great food, decent service. Front desk staff would smile occasionally but for the most part was cold and distant. THE WORST: Housekeeping began knocking on my door at 8am and then 4 more times before 9:30. She then demanded that I tell her when I would be checking out because she was quite busy. When I told her I would be out by the 11 (check out is noon) she asked me to hurry! That's a first for me and probably a last for the Toronto Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family!”
Reviews.Author: 1111NewYork
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying at a Hilton, since it was a huge chain. But to my surprise the hotel offers a lot for the buck. We got two rooms through Hotwire for $69 each. Since we were with the kids, we called the hotel ahead of time for adjoining rooms. At first, the hotel said they were booked and could not give us adjoining rooms, but later upon check-in the lady was so kind to have figured out a way by moving guests around. Our room was really wonderful for the price. The beds are super comfortable and the view amazing. They have great swimming pool and work out facilities. Breakfast at the restaurant was wonderful with kids. And room service was surprisingly good and well priced. Even though there are hotels out there that may be higher end than the Hilton, this hotel seems to offer many conveniences at such a spectacular rate that it far surpasses the rest of the four stars in Toronto, especially if you're traveling with kids and are budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: KLM1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for two nights in March, while in town to see Bon Jovi at the ACC. Location was excellent. It's within walking distance of the restaurants on Front St, Union Station, and ACC. It's also connected to the PATH, so you can get to places underground. Parking under the hotel is very easy, at $24/day (if you don't exit), or $30/day (to exit/return). Tip: pay the $24 at the parking garage pay station ... not on your hotel bill. The room was very nice, with new furniture, and awesome beds. The linens were very luxurious. Soap, shampoo, etc. was nice too ... Crabtree and Evelyn. The indoor/outdoor pool was fun. It was actually heated, and you could swim through the plastic curtain from the inside to the outside pool. The air outside was chilly, but the pool was warm. And the hot-tub was definitely hot. Overall, good value for the money, good location, and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: fishbait95
Reviews.Content: our room was infested with bedbugs! stay here at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Marilou888
Reviews.Content: Feb 21 - 23, 2008. LOVED the glass elevator. Great staff and friendly service. I was given a non-smoking room in which someone smoked (out of their control) and the front desk immediately switched me with no problems and even met me at the new upgraded room. Manager I met in elevator was friendly and actually spoke to me. Restaurants on site have wonderful food, and again service was excellent. Great location. I can't say the hotel is above average because there were little things in the room that was lacking - no morning paper, there were chocolates on my pillow the first night but not the 2nd night, and little things like that which I would expect as standard for a hotel such as this. The room itself was wonderful and nicely designed so I must have been given one of the newer rooms. The bathroom the same although the bath fixtures were old. Cosmetically fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value at the Hilton Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Trojan
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a downtown hotel for one night while attending the Auto Show. The Hilton was within a few blocks of the convention centre and offered a very attractive rate for the "Romance Package" (C$124 plus taxes). This included chocolate-dipped strawberries and sparkling wine upon arrival and a full room service breakfast next morning. The room was spacious and clean, the king bed very comfortable. The bath had a large, granite-tiled shower with multiple shower heads: very nice. Be sure to ask for a room on an upper floor and take the scenic elevator: the views are wonderful. The indoor-outdoor pool lets you swim outside in Toronto in February, a new experience for me! Only negatives were a minimalist lobby and expensive (underground) parking. Would definitely stay here again when staying downtown if I could get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Special treatment from Hilton Toronto West”
Reviews.Author: amberdamber
Reviews.Content: Now I stay in Toronto on business a lot, and my experiences have been so so at a dozen or so "4 or 5 star" hotels, but as soon as I arrived, tired and forlorn from almost missed connections, lost baggage and having to drive from Buffalo through Customs, by the time I arrived at the wee hours, the staff made me feel welcome and comfortable. Not only that, the massive and wonderful lobby, as huge and lofty as it is, has such incredible architecture with the huge lanterns floor to ceiling, and the warm colors and wood tones, it looks like a set to a David Hockney Opera! But there is a special reason I am writng this, I could go on about the fluffy bed with the fluffy down pillows and comforter, but that seems to be the norm unless you just started travelling last week! It's the services that most travelers really count on that make a difference and that is what makes this hotel leagues apart. Renate for instance. I needed to sew a button on my pants, (yes I do that for myself!, big deal), she suggested the hotel sewing kits, but then I said: "it's a pretty big button I need, not a shirt button". Instantly she thought, then walked away and said: "It will be in your room." She was on break, but went all the way to housekeeping, searched for some large buttons. When I arrived in my room after dinner, there were 2 envelopes, one with sewing kits and the other with 4 buttons to choose from. Now I would like to meet her parents, this is a kid brought up right! Class. And I am almost embarrassed at the price I got all this for!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown chain experience”
Reviews.Author: barksducks
Reviews.Content: The downtown Toronto Hilton is a good example of what this chain does well: they are highly professional, service-oriented, and friendly. But the hotel feels very much like a chain. It is large, short on charm, and impersonal. However the location of this hotel is excellent and fantastic rates can be found. I got my room on priceline for $80 a night, but when I was at the hotel, I learned that walk-ups were getting standard rooms for $99 a night. The rack rate on my room was $330. Excellent views from rooms above the tenth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: rdtriptaker
Reviews.Content: Although previous reviews had me apprehensive about the property, I had an excellent stay at the Hilton Toronto. I booked my room on Priceline for $120 a night, then phoned the hotel directly to request a room with a king size bed on one of the recently renovated floors. Upon check in, the clerk quickly found my reservation with the noted requests and gave me exactly what I'd wanted. My room was on the 26th floor with an incredible view of the CN Tower. And the bathroom featured those amazing dual shower heads that previous reviewers have raved about. Plus, the bed was incredibly comfortable. My only complaint was that I would have liked more drawer space. All the staff I encountered were helpful, from the doorman to the clerk who brewed my cafe mocha at Second Cup (although the drink wasn't that great). When I inquired at the front desk about the location of the business center, the clerk informed me that the Internet connection wasn't cooperating there, offering instead use of the computers/printer outside the conference rooms. Best of all, it was free of charge! Although neither Barrister's nor Tundra offered stellar cuisine, the service was fine at both establishments. As expected, the prices were inflated at both, but there are plenty of other restaurants in the area so you're not forced to eat at the hotel. Access to the underground PATH system was a plus given the chilly temperatures, but the hotel was also conveniently located to subway stations and area attractions like the Air Canada Centre. Provided I secured another discounted room rate (no, I don't think it's worth $300 a night), I would have no qualms about returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired room that looked and felt more like a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: j'adoreparis
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hilton in downtown Toronto for one night. We booked through Hotwire and were able to secure a room for 2 adults for CAD$79 ($96 with tax). Check in was smooth and easy. Our room was a standard non-smoking room, with two double beds. Upon first inspection, we noticed there was dust everywhere and the carpets were stained and dingy. The bathroom has definitely seen better days: the fixtures were old and the counter top was dull and scratched. For a 4 star hotel with a pretty nice lobby and services, the standard rooms just don't live up the image of a Hilton hotel. We stayed during the weekend, and the hotel was packed with the party crowd, and there was loud talking and music in our floor until about 4:30am. It felt more like a dorm than a hotel. If you're looking for a deal for a short stay in the downtown area, then book try to book through Hotwire for a deal on the room rates. Do not pay the full room rates through Hilton's web page, the rooms are NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge a Book by It's Cover”
Reviews.Author: misctraveller
Reviews.Content: While this hotel looks great from the outside and from the lobby, our room was nothing short of disappointing. The bathroom had mold in every corner and the tub had mold just about everywhere. The ceiling vent was so dirty that crud would fall out of it when you turned it off. The coffee machine provided was equally as dirty, I don't think it would be safe to drink out of it. Two of the lamps in our room didn't work. Additionally, there is no valet parking and when I asked about discounted parking for guests I was told there was none. One of the worst parts of our trip was the visit to the hotel's Barristers Bar. The bartender was so drunk he couldn't even speak, and the $13 vodka I had was hardly coating the bottom of the glass (very small pour). It took almost an hour to get one of the TV's changed from news to a hockey game (you would think Hockey would already be on the TV in Canada!). The location of this Hilton is convenient, but other than that I most likely would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Executive Rooms and great Loung, loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: paulchen78
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hilton hotel, I can only comment on the Executive rooms which are really nice, great view, rather new furniture, great bathroom and clean. The Executive lounge is one of the best I've seen in any Hilton around. Extremely friendly staff. The outdoor pool is fantastic, especially in Winter. The whirlpool inside is a bit on the small side but does the job. The gym is too small though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fabulous location (beware of noise).”
Reviews.Author: DW614
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toronto Hilton during the Grey Cup weekend (we weren't there for the Grey Cup games) and had expected the hotel to be packed with excited fans in town for the weekend. Fortunately, it was not crowded in any way. The hotel is in a good location in downtown Toronto. It is within walking distance to the subway station, and City Hall/Eaton Centre. Self-parking is underground, and easy to find. The weekend parking rate was very reasonable -- it cost us $18/night to park. Check-in was quick and staff was friendly. We stayed in a junior suite. The suite was very spacious, and clean. There was even a couple bottles of spring water and a snack compliments of the hotel. The decor is modern -- almost had a 'boutique hotel' feel to it. The king bed was fabulous (nice and soft)! For those on a business trip, there is a work area with a work desk and phone/internet connection. Very simple. The bathroom is clean, and the water pressure in the shower was nice and strong. While we loved the room and hotel in general, we did have a few things that we were disappointed with. If you're a light sleeper (unfortunately, my boyfriend is one), I would highly suggest you choose your room as far from the elevators as possible. Our room was closest to the bank of elevators, and the traffic from people walking to/from elevators can be very noisy. It is also closest to the ice machine, so we can hear the dispenser releasing ice at all hours. Also, we could hear the sirens (possibly ambulance/cruisers) from the streets below quite clearly (we were on the 20th floor and we thought the windows would have been sound proofed from street noise) so that was very disruptive from having a good night sleep. Between the noise from the hallway/ice dispenser and from the streets below, it could be a deal breaker for those looking for some R&R. We had access to the Executive Lounge, which offers complimentary beverages (nice selection of wines and liquor, as well as non-alcoholic drinks) and continental breakfast. The breakfast selection was limited and a bit disappointing, but it's good for those looking for a quick bite to go with their tea/coffee (I've seen better at Hyatt/Fairmont). The lounge has a couple of desktops with internet access. It is a nice area to unwind at night because its on the 32nd floor, so it offers a panoramic view of the city. Overall we would recommend staying at Toronto Hilton for its nice decor and friendly staff, but would definitely be bringing earplugs to tune out the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Wave47
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and a stylish hotel. Many rooms have a view of the CNN Tower, and you can walk just about anywhere from the hotel. You don't even need to go outside, as an escalator takes you down from the far end of the lobby into PATH, Toronto's network of underground shopping streets (17 miles of them! great shops too). You can also walk down to the Waterfront (attractive area, ferries out to the islands) & to the CNN Tower (pre-book a meal on the revolving restaurant - the view at night is amazing!)

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Deekel
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Hilton for one night recently, having moved over after 3 nights at the Westin Harbour Castle. First the positive: very comfortable beds, newly renovated bathrooms, good location Unfortunately, the room was in poor shape. Bedside tables had a prominent layer of dust. The furniture, while modern, was beaten up and, frankly, in embarassing shape for what was supposed to be a 4 star hotel. I can understand old TVs that they haven't gotten around to replacing, but poorly maintained furniture reflects poorly on a room that is $200 a night. The minibar was missing from the room. Upon check-in, I noticed that the bathroom sink was leaking and called down. No one ever came to fix it. When I mentioned this at the front desk, it didn't seem to bother them, I guess they've heard it often enough before. Had I been there longer than one night, I would have made a bigger deal of all this, but I left there with the intention of not returning to the Hilton on my future business in Toronto. I had expected more from a Hilton. The experience made me appreciate the Westin all the more: clean rooms, well-maintained furniture, large flat-screen TV, cordless phone, in-room laptop safes, bathrobes, minibars--none of which the Hilton had.

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable service”
Reviews.Author: World_Class_Guru
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hilton late evening to find that my Navigator wouldn't fit in the lower parking area. I requested valet, but to my surprise it wasn't offered at this location. The attendant provided directions to alternative above ground storage which happen to be full. I returned to the hotel and explained that I had been driving all day and asked that the attendant park the vehicle, he refused, directing me to another parking location several blocks away. After an hour from the time I'd arrive, I had to carry all of my luggage several blocks late at night through downtown Toronto. I had the pleasant experience of meeting several panhandlers along the way. This quality of service continued throughout my stay. The following evening we planned on touring the city and asked that the attendant call for a limo. Rather than picking up the phone, he walked to the street and waited for a taxi, ten minutes later a cab pulled up. The front desk staff was equally unprofessional, as my associate overheard rude comments towards guests. Upon requesting the manager we were informed that she was unavailble. As for the rooms, they were clean and modern, however similar class hotels typically offer flat screen T.V.'s and what not. In short, if safety and service are of concern to you, then I would strongly recommend a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: originalwong
Reviews.Content: This is easily one of the best hotels I've ever been at (with a price tag to match)! But you get what you pay for... Room had a fantastic (and very comfortable) king sized bed. Central location in Toronto. Service was top notch. Lobby was luxurious. Stayed in the hotel while watching a show at Cannon Theatre that evening. Unfortunately, only used it as a place to sleep after the show, but was very happy with all aspects of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catraveller7
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Hilton is an ok hotel. The staff are pleasant, and it has a good location. I had access to the "club" level which had a decent breakfast each morning, and nice snacks at night. However, the rooms need upgrading. They are somewhat old fashioned; would be nice if they painted the rooms, upgraded the bathrooms (which are not of the usual "Hilton" standard) and improved the lighting. Room service was fast, and the food was good. The gym was a bit small, but ok. I think internet access was about $12 a day, and was convenient (although it would be nice if they didn't charge extra for it). All in all an ok place to stay, but below the normal Hilton standard--hopefully they will refresh/upgrade the rooms soon.

Reviews.Title: “September 22nd - Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kylee30
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the Hilton to be wonderful. It cost me only $18 to park for 24 hours. I was told there was no valet, so I am unsure why the other review said that valet was expensive? It has a scenic elevator that you can take to the 32nd floor which is a nice view of the city. It is close to everything and the beds/pillows are really soft and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: goleafs00
Reviews.Content: Save your money. Old TV's in the rooms, small beds, bathroom lights burnt out, 3 diet-cokes for room service was over $16, parking was way too expensive, my buddy's Lincoln Navigator was too large to park in the hotel, so he had to park over two blocks away and walk with his baggage with no appology. The front reservations attendant said something about me as I walked away not knowing that I was listening and when I confronted him, he played dumb. Overall, not what I would expect for $275 a night. Go somewhere else. I will be contacting the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: travelbugz2006
Reviews.Content: I decided to have an evening getaway away from my family so I booked a room at the Toronto Hilton. I called around some of the major hotels in the Toronto Downtown core such as the King Edward, Sheraton and Royal York and found the Hilton to have the best price for a standard room. I stayed in a room with a king sized bed on the 25th floor for 159$ for the evening. I primarily checked in so that I could have an undisturbed evening of sleep. I am happy to report : mission accomplished. Although this hotel is situated at a very busy intersection (also major lane way to many of the hospitals on University Ave) and very close to the entertainment district in Toronto (clubs, and theatres) I was not bothered at all by any noise from club goers or emergency vehicles. The Hilton must have pretty thick windows. I had a very restful sleep on a very spacious and comfortable bed. Pro for the Hilton was thier use of high quality bedding. Although the Hilton met my need to get a full 8 hours of sleep there were a few 'cons'. Expecting a superior hotel experience, I was very disappointed to find hairs and quite a bit of dust on top of the toilet tank. As well after my shower in a very spacious and impressive shower (it had both an overhead raindrop shower head as well as a hand held shower head) I was again disappointed to see that water had leaked out of the glass wall around the back of the shower leaving my bathroom floor quite damp. Expecting a luxurious stay at the Hilton I was a little disappointed by the above mentioned problems. On my next mini vacation away from home I might consider spending a little more money and staying at the King Edward to finally get my posh evening away.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: capdistrcttravel
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a Friday night at the Hilton. I was upgraded to a recently renovated room on the 24th floor. The room was large, featured a flat screen TV, a desk, very comfy King bed, and windows overlooking City Hall. All hotel staff were very efficient and accomodating. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. You can't ask for a better location. The price was right. There's a nice fitness centre and pool on the 2nd floor. I'll definitely look into staying at the Hilton on future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: lerrilynn
Reviews.Content: medeocre at best...stayed 2 nights during the week. pool was dirty. pool area was littered with dirty towels...we waited for clean towels for a least an hour. only one small whirlpool. Room was o.k. carpet was really stained modern decor but cheaply put together. No ventilation in the bathroom. Had pool side view so was not very appealing due to the mess. bed and pillows were comfortable. hallway had dirty dishes from someone's room service on the floor for an entire day. service was non-existent. Food and drinks expensive. and we had to pay $30 per night extra for parking!!!! I expected more from a 4 star hotel... would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Hilton Stay”
Reviews.Author: Celticgrl
Reviews.Content: August 18, 2007 Booked with Hotwire and got a fantastic deal for 2 rooms at the Hilton downtown. Have stayed there before so was expecting the typical 4 star treatment. Our room was filthy as was the second room. Rubbish under the bed, bottle of deodrant on the floor, dirty carpets etc. We did complain and tried to change rooms but the hotel was full that night. Next morning, we informed the staff again as we were checking out. Her solution was that since we used a bottle of water from the mini-bar, she would give that to us free in lieu of the bad condition of the room!!! Not really typical Hilton service.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Clientele That Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kbz2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Hilton through Hotwire for 2 rooms for two nights. We havenâ€™t traveled that much but we have stayed at an arrangement of hotels. Given that I got these rooms through Hotwire I was happy but if I would have paid full price I would have been upset because of the clientele that was there. Check in was smooth and very easy. This was my first time using hotwire so I was a little nervous about how it would go; we had no problem at all. When we arrived in the rooms they were very clean and we had a room facing the CN Tower and the pool. The beds were comfortable and rooms were a nice size. As we were traveling with someone in a wheelchair and another person with down syndrome this was appreciated to have such a nice view so that if we didnâ€™t get out as much it was just nice staying in. There was a small hole in the wall which we called about and they offered to switch rooms however we had the only adjoining rooms left so we told them we were fine we just wanted to make them aware of it so we didnâ€™t get charged. The showers in the room are POWERFUL! I also really liked the toiletries; they were Crabtree and Evelyn, and the smell was very refreshing (I still have to visit our local shop to buy some). I didnâ€™t like that you were charged for local calls, I thought that was unusual. It did seem like everything was extra (internet connection, phone call, etc). We ate at the Ruth Chrisâ€™ Steakhouse for dinner, that was outstanding, but pricey which I knew it was going to be. It did serve for a memorable meal since we were celebrating a special occasion. We ate at the Tundra for breakfast, and the food was outstanding there too. The fruit was especially fresh and everything was very tasty. The location of the hotel was convenient. I do recommend trying to find parking elsewhere if you can. Since we had someone in a wheelchair I didnâ€™t have a problem with $30.00 a night for the parking, but there are plenty of other places that offer parking much cheaper. The pool area was adequate, half of the pool was outside and half inside which I thought was great!! The workout area was very small, but we didnâ€™t really use it. Our only big grip was the clientele that the Hilton had that weekend. On Friday we were next to a room full of young college kids that were partying, (they calmed down after the second time someone came up). Then on Saturday night some 30-40 year old men came up drunk and knocking on all the doors at 3 am. Sunday morning was really weird when there was a lady in the hot tub who was facing the jets and moving her breast around to have the jets target them, then she started positioning her legs as well. Luckily enough it was early and just myself and my sister-in-law (who has down syndrome) there, but we quickly left and went into the pool to give her some â€œprivacyâ€�. My sister-in-law didnâ€™t notice and there werenâ€™t any children around but I wouldnâ€™t have expected that type of clientele from people staying at the Hilton. Its hard to fault a hotel for the people that stayed there because it could have been just a one time thing, however I would probably try to find a different place to stay next time so I have some place else in Toronto to compare it to (is it just the people that go to Toronto, or is it the Hilton??) Although Iâ€™ve never had this type of problems with the clientele in other places Iâ€™ve visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bschuster23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were only staying for one night so this hotel was perfect for us. It was easy to get to off of the QEW. Self parking was right under the bldg. Checking in was very smooth and they had four front desk people on duty. We did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants but they had a Ruth Chris steakhouse, a place to grab drinks and another place to have breakfast. The room was nice, had a mini bar, desk and internet access. The pool was nice and had a outside bar. We were going to a Blue Jays game and the hotel was within walking distance to the Rogers Center and walking distance to shopping and places to go out after the game. Did not need to take a cab the day we were there.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at another Hilton”
Reviews.Author: crmlbeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Toronto as it was the site for a conference I was attending. We booked rooms on the Club Floor in order to be able to use the conference room for meetings. The second night of our stay a large group checked in for another conference being held at the hotel. A group of 30-40 individuals, men and their wives, met in the Club Floor Lounge for cocktails which are served free of charge by the Hilton for their Club Lounge guests. This group proceeded to get so drunk and disorderly that all other guests ended up leaving the room or moving their chairs over to the far side of the lounge to be away from the yelling and profanities. The Club Floor concierage just sat there although many guests requested that she either get the drunken group to quiet down or, if unable to do so herself, notify the manager. As a woman who travels frequently on business I choose to stay at facilities which create a comfortable atmosphere for all guests. This experience left with me with a sense of such disrespect for the Hilton Organization that I have discontinued involvment in the Hilton Honors Program and plan to avoid their hotels in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alanake
Reviews.Content: We, a family of four, stayed in this hotel for one night before heading to the Niagara Falls. Since we have a diamond card, we could stay on the executive level. I have to say that the room was huge, the bathroom was a little small in comparison, but had everything you'd expect (including a little bathduck!). Breakfast in the executive lounge was good, the decoration beautiful. Its one of the most peaceful lounges we've been in, plus you had an amazing view over the city on one side and over the Cn tower and the lake on the other side. the hotel is in a perfect location which allowed us to see a little bit of the city even though we had only an afternoon. I can further say that the hotel restaurant (the name slipped my mind) was very good. For 35 CAD we had a three course menu which was very tasty! I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tam Carr
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly typical Hilton city hotel but in a very good Downtown location. Taxi from the International Airport was Can$46 and took about 30 minutes. Check in was smooth and we were soon in our standard room on the 14th floor. We were tired after the flight from Scotland and headed straight to bed. Next morning we had a closer look at the room and decided it was not as nice as we had hoped for. The carpet was dirty and the decor was as tired as we had been the previous night. A visit to reception was called for and after some apologies we were given a recently refurbished room on the 26th floor. Layout was exactly the same but cleanliness was much improved as was the bathroom. Actually there was no bath and instead we had the most incredible power shower. As we were room only we cannot comment on the restaurant or bar. We did use the pool most afternoons though and found it adequate. Nothing fancy but very busy especially at the weekend. There is a small bar at the pool area where drinks can be purchased in plastic glasses and at expensive prices. Restaurants are plentifull near the hotel and we liked the Entertainment area of Toronto which was only a few hundred yards away from the hotel. Many choices and styles to be found there. Breakfast was also close at hand and we recommend the Sunset Grill 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Turn right outside the main entrance and head towards Yonge Street. It's on the right hand side and the portions are the same as all the restaurants we tried, enormous and tasty with freeflow coffee. All in all we had a great time in Toronto but found the hotel to be of a lower standard than we expected and certainly lower than Hilton's UK city centre hotels.

Reviews.Title: “average stay - keep an eye on your car”
Reviews.Author: greenberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for two weekend nights recently. Our room was on the 22nd floor so we didn't hear much street noise - however, there was almost constant construction noise coming from nearby rooms. We were not informed that this would be going on, so we were surprised the first morning at 9:00 am to hear loud hammering and sawing coming through the walls. Other than that problem, and our bathroom needing some repair work on tiles and the ceiling, our room was fine and the hotel is in a great location. Our major problem was when we arrived in the "secure" parking garage under the hotel to pick up our car and go home. During our stay, someone had broken into our car (professional job, no visible damage) and our ashtray and glove compartment were hanging open, with things strewn all over the floor. We also had an iPod stolen. There was another man from Ohio parked about 10 cars away from us and his car was also burglarized with several things stolen. We won't stay here again unless they tighten up the security with the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dcmove
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Toronto is a nice hotel. It's probably better for business travelers and tourists interested in seeing the major tourist sites as it's large with lots of business amenities (business center, executive center, etc.) and is far downtown near the major sites (CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, Rogers Center, Eaton Center, etc.). I was very pleased with our stay though. We stayed on the 26th floor, which was updated and modern, very stylish. Also, since I'm a frequent Hilton hotel gues (diamond Honors), we had access to a really nice executive lounge, which occupies nearly half of the top floor (32nd). Free high speed internet access, free breakfasts (juices, cereals, eggs, fruit, pastries, bagels, etc.), drinks on the house from 4-10pm. A really nice amenity. The staff was courteous and the concierge very helpful. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again. It's also right next to the Osgoode metro stop which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “family time”
Reviews.Author: sk8jdgca
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through hotwire for 72 USD. I stayed here from June 28-June 30 with my two kids age 4 and 8. We had taken the train to Toronto and arrived well before check in time. We took our luggage to the hotel expecting to have to leave it with the bell hop. We were pleasantly surprised to get an early check in right away-nice! Off to the pool we went. The pool is located on the 2nd floor, in inside outside and overlooks the street below- there are plenty of chaise lounges and a little bar. The kids had a great time in the pool. The pool is deepest at 5 ft and goes down to 3 feet, and heated-perfect for the little ones. Our room was nice-too bad that the mini bar was stacked so full of overprice items, would have been nice to use the fridge for our snacks. The Hilton has special Barbie and HotWheels rooms, they were on the same floor as us and the maid let us tour the rooms-wow they are nice (Barbie is very pick and girly; Hotwheels very car focad. There are toys for the kids to play with when they are there too) and would be a great treat for the kids (parents stay in an ajoining room) The hotel is very convient to the subway station (University Line, Osgood). We walked to the eaton's center and to the CN Tower. We walked up 1 block to Queen and went west on Queen, there is a Pizza Pizza and a subway down just a bit plus a lot of funky bars. The kids and I always waited for the scenic elevators-rode to the top then went whereever we were going. This was a great added touch and you can see alot (there really isn't much difference between the 2 scenic elevators however we only got the North one once) Overall we were very happy with this hotel for the stay. One interesting note-I forgot my key one day so we went down stairs to get another- since I didn't ahve picture ID with me, i had to wait for a security guard to take me up to my room where I then had to produce picture ID. Great security but when would a women with a 4 year old and 8 year old in tow try to get into the wrong room

Reviews.Title: “Normal Hilton Hotel - nice and confortable”
Reviews.Author: JenM72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a weekend towards end of June. Hotel is a typical Hilton hotel. nice bathroom ammentites, comfortable bed. Room also had a flat screen TV. rooms face a busy road, so can be a little noisy, but nothing unbearbale, but ask for a high floor if noise sensitive. Location is walking distance to all e.g 15 mins to CN tower, 20 mins to harbour front, 10 mins to station, 10 mins to Eaton centre (shopping) etc hotel also has a Ruth's Chris restaurant in there, but is seperate in that you cant charge the meal to your hotel room. Staff were friendly and privided me with an ammenitites kit since the airline lost my luggage. Rate paid was also good and the breakfast was great

Reviews.Title: “Simply average and is not the Hilton standard I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: WeiQi
Reviews.Content: The location : The hotel is located in the business district. The location is fairly convenient. The union Station, Eaton Centre, CN tower, Osgoode park, Old City hall are mostly within 10 minutes walk away. The plus : The room has modern furnishing. Bathroom is a bit small comparing to the room but has a long vanity top for my big cosmetic bag. Hilton provides Crabtree and Evelyn range of products which is a nice touch. The bed and linen are very luxurious. The minus : The hotel does not provide complimentary drinking water. if you look at the room carefully, you can tell it is not very well maintained. There are layer of dust in the bathtub (my room must not have been occupied for awhile). The night curtain was not hung properly. Considering it is Hilton, this is disappointing. For those who are staying in this hotel, ask for a room with the CN tower view. Check out the lift with the CN tower view as well!

Reviews.Title: “fine for a business trip, stay elsewhere for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: drop_the_zero
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four day conference held at the Toronto Hilton. The staff was friendly, the lobby was modern and contemporary in design, and my junior king suite was large, updated, and had a comfortable bed. I had complimentary access to the Executive Lounge, which provided a nice continental breakfast each morning, a lounge to relax in, and a great view of the city. My stay was pleasant, but I would not stay here if I was traveling for pleasure. There is no difference in the decor of the executive floor rooms and the standard renovated rooms. The junior king suites are located on either end of the hotel, next to either the public elevator or the staff elevator ( very noisy ). The pool area is very dated, as well as the less expensive restaurant, Barrister's Bar. Located between the financial district and the entertainment district, there are very few nice restaurants open on Saturday or Sunday that are nearby. Even Starbuck's is closed on the weekend! In closing, this hotel is great for a business traveler who is racking up loyalty points. But if you are looking for a place to indulge in Toronto, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in Toronto Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: Edmond_ET
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay in the Hiltons in downtown toronto at a price of $69 for the low season in late decemeber 06. Perfect Location: the hotel is located close to everything even it was bitter cold in toronto we managed to walk to everything - CN tower, eaton's centre, the city hall, Tim Hortons just around the corner. We check in to a to nice room on the newly renovated floor. However, as the family was unreasonably loud, we kindly asked to be moved to a different room on the same floor. Both rooms were amazing with hip/new decor. Although the first room was bigger, the room we were moved to was the 'customer appreciation' room where a bottle of chilled champagne awaits us. We were pleasantly surprised by the fact that even we booked our room at priceline was still got pretty good service and our complains were heard. The shower of this hotel was just the BEST (with 2 shower heads one from the top and one from a different angle). The new bathroom is really hip and upscale, furnished with dark mossaic stones glass shower. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast at Tundra is supposed to be really good but was somewhat pricey (as I am not into buffet style breakfast anyways). But I recommend Tundra because they do have a different daily menu for lunch and dinners. We definately stay at Hilton's in toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely average”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Older style in serious need of refurbishment. Tired decor. Sparsely furnished with cheap and nasty furniture yet somehow the bed is comfortable. The bathroom is very outdated. Toiletries are extremely average. Breakfast is frightful for a hotel like the Hilton and the service even worse. The business center is horrifically expensive. Do not expect any service whatsoever unless you tip. The conceirge was especially rude. I did not have time to exchange money at the airport and intended to use the hotel ATM to obtain funds and tip him later. His complaint about not being tipped resulted in exactly that - not being tipped. Rude. As an extremely well travelled business traveller, this is not a hotel I would return to. Look elsewhere for your $200 odd dollars a night

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DX-Traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Walking distance to just about everything. The airport bus drops you in front of the Sheraton (on the diagnoal corner). Check-in smooth. The room was good size with an excellent bed but a somewhat sad view (see pictures) The bathroom had some poorly done repairs and needed a little bit of work but was clean and functional otherwise. The coffee maker was one of those "single shot" machines and was nice. The standard HILTON clock with iPOD plug is nice! The staff was very good, including the bar/restaurant which is fine for a quick meal and a beer. Note that they add a large number of bizarre taxes to your bill and internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - except for the fire alarms”
Reviews.Author: Grenouillesansleau
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Priceline for the Toronto Hilton and were, overall, very pleased with our stay there over New Year's Eve. The staff at check-in were very friendly and professional. We were offered a choice of rooms (refurbished with large shower but no bath, older style rooms with bath, north-facing view, south-facing view, quiet etc) and got exactly what we wanted - a renovated room on a high floor facing North and in a corner, which minimised noise. We arrived on Dec 30th, which probably helped in terms of room choice (the pickings might have been slimmer the following night, since the hotel filled up for New Years). Overall, the renovated rooms were nicely done (we particularly liked the comfortable bed and nice linen, the chaise lounge and the huge walk-in shower with rain shower head plus detachable showerhead). It does seem, though, as though whoever oversaw the renovation skimped on a few things (e.g. flimsy curtains that add nothing in terms of decor) and didn't oversee the details of the work done (lots of splashed paint blobs, some poorly finished elements). The Melitta coffeemaker in the room makes terrible coffee. Since we know the area well (ordinarily, we live in Toronto - this was a trip home for us), we knew where to find good meals elsewhere. However, the one "meal" we did eat at the hotel at midnight after we arrived at the hotel (quesadillas in the Barristers Bar) was surprisingly good, and the service was fast and friendly. The old books in the lounge (a mix of law books and other books) are entertaining (well, not the revised Ontario Statutes, but the old romance novels are a hoot). The only negative experience we had was the succession of fire alarms on New Year's Eve - although hotel staff tried their best to handle the problem. (They can't turn off the alarm while it is under investigation, but they did provide regular updates.) The first alarm, which went off some time after midnight, was a prank. The second alarm was triggered because people partying on the floor where the first alarm went off were smoking. The third alarm was a mystery. On our final day, the same nice person who checked us in gave us a late check-out, which was great. We needed the extra few hours to pack and repack our bags so that everything we'd received at Christmas or purchased) fit into our bags. I certainly would stay at the Hilton again, and would recommend it to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “loved the toronto hilton”
Reviews.Author: simstr
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel soley on the ratings on this site. was not dissapointed. it was well situated, we upgraded to an executive room, which was on the 30th floor- well worth it for the view (of the CN tower and skydome) and for the facilities of the exec lounge. We arrived on a friday night (having been to a wedding) so made use of the exec lounge on the saturday morning - this was very nice, very organised, clean and fairly quiet. good choice of food - continental breakfast, no cooked foods. sunday morning however was a complet contrast, it was terrible, there were no tables, nothing had been cleared up, they were running out of food and unable to replenish quick enough. it was noisy. it was nothing like the previous morning. I found out there were only 2 staff dealing with the breakfast, they were such lovely girls, but under too much pressure, totally unfair on them. i wrote to the hotel to complain. It was also the day of the Santa Parade- a massive event in toronto. that is why there were so many people there and loads of kids too. we eventually found an empty table and had breakfast - views are amazing from the exec lounge. the monday morning breakfast was perfect again! we ate on the sunday night at the "Ruth's Chris Steak house" located in the basement of the hotel - not owned by the hotel - it was excellent - amazing steak. overall - i would highly recommend the hotel. the staff were all polite and helpful, even the poor girls serving in the exec lounge, under so much pressure! the rooms were spacious and clean and nicely decorated. best bed i have ever slept in - massive and comfortable. will be back........(not many places i can say that about!! )

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: slane
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a stay at the Hilton Toronto recently. We were told we'd be in a 're-furbished' room which was great, but there are obviously some 'un-re-furbished' rooms, so be careful) Some observations: - Reception nice - Room roomy - Bar has decent snack food - Staff were fine - Shower fantastic - Breakfast overpriced, go down the block to the Sunset Grill - Clean

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rahulrch
Reviews.Content: To start with, Hilton Toronto is in a different league than Hilton Montreal, where I stayed 2 months back. Well located above underground shopping, this is a fine hotel for business travelers and vacationers. It's right across the street from the FS Opera. The best part about the hotel is the comfortable executive lounge with an open bar in the evening and great breakfast. I would strongly recommend this hotel. Only downside (someone had mentioned this earlier in the reviews) is - the rooms have thin walls - you can pretty much hear everyone walking outside your door even if they whisper. For the light sleepers, I recommend a room at the end of the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: fireman9s
Reviews.Content: What a great place. We booked a package thru CANAM travel. It included first class train from Windsor to Toronto and upgraded Executive floor at the Toronto Hilton. If you are undecided on whether to upgrade your room, it is WELL worth the extra money. The Executive Lounge is on the 32nd floor. Our room was on the 31st. We had a direct stairway to the lounge. The room was spacious and clean. Beautiful view of the city. Marble bathroom with telephone. Coffee maker. Work station with comfortable chair. Nice lighting and adjustable comfort control. The best feature was the lounge !! In the morning, free continental breakfast (rolls, bread, bagels, cereal, yogart, oatmeal etc......) Coffee (lattes, cappuccinos, etc...) Fruit, cheeses,meat. In the evening, free hot and cold snacks and free drinks (beer, wine, mixed). Nice view of the city from large windows. Courteous staff, very helpful. Add to this a great location, steps from shopping, dining and entertainment. I will never stay any place else in Toronto!!!! Questions ?? fireman9s@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton with character”
Reviews.Author: chrishandley
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Hiltons (and we've seen a few!). It is much more than a business hotel, with above average-sized rooms, comfy beds and good facilities and service. The Tundra restaurant is first-rate and the breakfast/brunch is good value. Even the mini-bar prices lack the usual greedy mark-ups. Staff are invariably helpful and well-informed. The location is good for downtown Toronto, across the road from the new Four Seasons Centre (opera fans, please note!). Don't bother asking for a South-facing room. The lake is obscured by other buildings. In fact the North-facing rooms have the best views - up University Avenue - especially from the top few floors.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Noise”
Reviews.Author: MontrealVoyager
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, very inviting executive lounge., but.....I found the room to be terribly noisy. I could hear all the hallway chatter even though they had given me my requested end of the hall room. Even the 4am newspaper delivery jolted me awake as the paperboy threw down copies to each door. I am a huge fan of the Hilton brand and even though this hotel had many positives, I can't recommend it . It all comes down to a good night's rest, which I didn't get. Poor soundproofing. Side note: Why are some guests so disrespectful when walking down a hallway at 3am, laughing out loud as they pass by others' rooms? I have always taught my children to limit hallway chatter to a whisper, no matteer what time of the day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Good times! excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Monopoly83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend. Paid for it through Hilton gold member reward points. well worth it! Stayed here for our anniversary. We could of stayed in the executive suite but only smoking rooms were avail so we decided to stay on the 24th floor instead but they still gave us access to the executive lounge which was well worth going to. The room was a nice size with a king bed and clean bathroom...the view from our window looked the same as pictures posted already on TripAdvisor...You can see alot of the city which was spectacular. The exec lounge was quiet and well done with nice tables, couches, big screen TV, and fireplace...the open bar was the best part! as the Hilton in Montreal did not have this...So we took advantage of that...Breakfast at the lounge was OK, very basic that was light and nutruitious. The pool was excellent with an indoor/outdoor feature with a hottub...lots of lawnchairs for lounging around the pool area if the weather was warmer. The location is what makes this hotel so great. Your close to pretty much any of the major shopping/tourist districts of Toronto...Great Restaurants as well...I reccommend the Baton Rouge its very tasty for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: BOLTS_1
Reviews.Content: I recently decided to take my girl for her 30th birthday. I reserved a junior suite. Check in was easy and quick. The scenic elevator was great considering we were on the 20th floor (worth the wait). We entered the room and were impressed. A very nice, elegant looking room, and very spacious. My only problem (very insignificant really) was the desk was worn and the table in the room was wobbly. Also, the fridge wasn't working, but the quickly fixed that (very impressive how quickly). Something else that was impressive was the bed. It was amazing! The pillows the sheets. Really comfortable. I used the gym, and was impressed. It had everything you would need for a good workout. The pool was also very nice, clean, and a great indoor/outdoor concept. In a great location. So, yes, I would definitely recommend it, and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping, Night Life and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: holatamara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time. The room was very comfortable, modern, spacious and clean. The location is ideal, just around the corner from Queen street shopping and 1 block from the train. And walking distance to the Cn tower. The breakfast is buffet is pricey $14 but really good. We also enjoyed Yuk Yuk a comedy club right around the corner. If your looking for a central, easy downtown location that is modern, cool and fun. This is it.

Reviews.Title: “High in the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: brittraveller
Reviews.Content: If you have children they will love the lifts! The glass sided elevator gives you almost as good a view as the CN tower. Generally we were quite impressed with the Hilton. The room was very spacious for the four of us and the beds very comfortable although the bathroom was in need of an update and was rather tatty. We had room service twice whilst we were there and the food was excellent. The outdoor pool was a bonus during Toronto's heatwave when you could get a seat - it was very popular in the heat. The gym although small was adequate. Location is good although in hindsight we would rather have been nearer the waterfront,as it was quite a walk, but then everything seemed further in those temperatures! It depends what you are going to Toronto for. The location is great for the shopping centres and business district. We loved the islands and the waterfront area but until we got there and had a feel for the place we couldn't have known. Generally a good hotel, in a good location of an adequate standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Surreyite
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a trip to Toronto spending two nights at the Hilton at the start and coming back for three nights at the end of the holiday. We booked two exec rooms which included buffet breakfast and an open bar from 4.00 pm with hors deouvres (accessible to over 19s only). The rooms and facilities were excellent and the service good and friendly (with the exception of the bar tender at Barristers bar on the ground floor). I'd certainly recommend the hotel as excellent for families, well located near shops, the entertainment district and the CN Tower. We asked for, and were delighted to get, a view of the Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsteel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hiton Hotel for five nights on our first visit to Toronto. We loved the city and the hotel was superb. Our room was large with a wonderful view over the city looking up University Avenue. Sitting at night looking at the sunset over the city was amazing. We were on the 16 Floor and had terrific views. The room was cleaned daily and extra pillows requested were delivered within 10 minutes. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The pool was busy on the weekend but we found we had it almost to ourselves on the Monday afternoon. Very clean and a welcome cooling in the hot temperature. Breakfast in the Tundra was a treat especially with a deduction of $5 per person - special offer to guests checking in on a weekend. We booked this room through the hotel website on an advanced non-returnable booking and saved ourselves 100% on the price if we had booked it two days before we arrived. Fantastic value. We will certainly recommend this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying there again on our next visit to Toronto. I noted the comments of previous guests regarding austerity - but I found it very modern, light and airy.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton is fine”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this property last weekend. The location is very close to upscale restaurants and entertainment. The slighty funky Queen St West begins at the hotel's doorstep as well. Upscale shopping is a bit farther away (Yorkville is perhaps a twenty minute walk). Check-in was uneventful. The lobby is nice but a bit austere. The hotel has two lobby level bars: Tundra and Barristers. Tundra was nice and bright (with windows) but had limited (restauarant) hours. Barristers is an interior space that probably has not been decorated in twenty years (though well kept). They have longer opening hours. The rooms are large and clean though (again) a bit austere. Had a room with two double (not queen) beds though there was plenty of room for larger beds. The tv had some 50+ free channels -- the most I've seen in any hotel. I've noted twice the "austerity" of the hotel's decor. I'm a big fan of modern or Asian-styled decor. But this was not the same. The decor (according to a few sources) supposedly reflects the Canadian "experience." If the intent was cold and sparse, the hotel can boast accomplishment. (I've always found Canada to be defined best by its people -- honest, hip, friendly and a bit quirky -- perhaps the designers should have had *this* in mind). Still, the hotel was clean and accommodating and the location excellent -- walking distance to entertainment and restaurants (Queen West / King West / Entertainment District / Financial Center) and excellent public transport is at hand (Queen West streetacars and subway are but a one minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaggyrob
Reviews.Content: 1st July 2006 We stayed at the Hilton in downtown Toronto for 3 nights. I chose it so that my family and I could have a little 4star luxury at a very reasonable price ( thank you Expedia! ). Check in was quick and easy, we requested a rollaway bed and it was already in the room by the time we go to the 19th floor. I was expecting a camp bed, but it was a proper bed, which was much better for one of the kids. We also asked for a plug adapter on another occasion, and that arrived almost immediately. The staff were great, friendly and helpful without being obsequious, they really made sure we enjoyed our stay. There is also a concierge service which was very useful for sightseeing tips etc. The room was clean and comfortable, good mini bar selection, it had everything we needed, and what a wonderful view of downtown Toronto. The facilities the hotel had to offer lived up to what we were expecting. The pool had an indoor and outdoor section and towels available. We particularly loved the jacuzzi and sauna. Food was wonderful, breakfast buffet in the Tundra restaraunt is not to be missed and as for Ruths Chris's Steakhouse, it was worth the flight just for that!!! Finally check - out was made so simple, no stress at all, great. Toronto is a wonderful place to visit, Niagara and CN Tower are awe- inspiring, and the Hilton was just perfect for our trip. I can't actually think of any critisisms at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to have a nice simple romantic getaway in the big city of Toronto, just for the weekend. Since were only students, we decided to go to Toronto for the day, go shopping, have a nice dinner, and stay in a fancy-schmancy place for the evening. What I expected was exactly what I got...a delightful experience! The city of Toronto itself was amazing, but I was BEYOND impressed with the services and facilities at the Hilton hotel. We stayed in a King Size Junior Suite, it sounded impressive, and for the price, we were expecting something amazing. Considering the fact that were students and that we usually sleep on futons THIS WAS A TREAT! We had a large room on the 22nd floor, it was quiet all evening, and best of all, we had a FANTASTIC view of the city. We ordered some late night room service, and it was fast, convenient, and private. We wanted to order chocolate dipped strawberries, but all they had were fresh strawberries and chocolate ice cream (a LARGE portion, which, we didn't mind.) But couples beware, if you are going to order this, prepared to pay $25 bucks (that's with a nice tip!!!) The pool was the best part of our trip. We went swimming in the night time, it wasn't too crowded, it was rather private, and for a couple wanting a romantic getaway, that was a MUST! The best part is that the pool is an indoor pool, but is ALSO an outdoor pool. It was nice to swim under the stars and the big lights of the city, but when it got colder, they just close off the outdoor part. I just wished the hot tub was in the outdoor part as well. All in all, a FABULOUS getaway for a couple just wanting a romantic evening to themselves. My boyfriend and are have already planned another weekend together in Toronto for August 26th, and we loved the Hilton so much, we're staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: haji
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is very convenient to nightlife, restaurants, and sites. It is within walking distance to most everything although it is probably a 15 minute walk to the CN tower/Skydome area. The public areas of the hotel are updated and look good. We were provided with an upgrade to the executive level room with access to the lounge and it was worth it. The room was very nicely decorated and looked recently refurbished. It was clean and very comfortable. The lounge was the best part. It has an outstanding view out from the hotel and provides complimentary breakfast, hors d'ourves, alcohol, and internet access. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the valet, to the front desk, to the lounge attendants. I would recommend this hotel to someone going to the Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but you have to book an Executive Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton in Torronto many times. The hotel is in a very good location, staff are great etc. BUT ( and its a big but), you have to book an executive room. There is a huge difference at this hotel betweeem the standard rooms and the exec's. It a hotel within a hotel sort of thing. If you are a gold HH member then you are likely to be upgraded, ( You can use the excellent lounge ( great staff, nice bfast and afternoon food.). The bar in the exec lounge is fully stocked and is open till 11pm. I booked a Jnr suite and because of being a gold HH member i could check in on the exec floor (32nd floor) and also have access to the lounge, there is also free internet access. All in all a great place to stay but worth spending the extra few dollars for a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sub Par Hilton”
Reviews.Author: hawkdog
Reviews.Content: Location of this property is excellent. Besides the location, this Hilton is a bit below Hilton standards. The room I had was pretty average. The bed was very uncomfortable and the carpet was fairly old and "compromised" There was a large clump of womans blonde hair on the bathroom floor upon check in. Small Old TV and dated furniture. The public areas were average hilton. You can do better in Toronto for the price. I prefer the Sheraton Centre. It was sold out this trip, that's how I ended up at the hilton. By no means is the Hilton a dump, it just needs some work. They also charge you for internet access...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Hilton last September, it's in a good central location we walked to all the major attractions from there. We never bothered going up the CN tower, the glass elevator at the hotel was enough for us. We found the hotel staff friendly and knowledgeable. We only had breakfast at the hotel twice, overpriced compared to the many other options close by but still very nice. Would highly recommend as a good base when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for two nights at the end of our holiday in Ontario, and thought it was an excellent hotel. We arrived early (around 10.30) expecting to just drop our bags off, but one of our rooms was ready so we were able to check in early. Check in staff very friendly and efficient. Our rooms were lovely - a decent size, very clean and modern, with good views of the city - we could just about see the lake in the distance from our room. Bathrooms were spotless. The location was handy for shopping and the theatre. We had stayed at the Novotel at the beginning of our holiday and loved that hotel too. Each was good in its own way - the Hilton was a little more expensive than the Novotel and was handier for the shops, but the Novotel was in a better situation for the Air Canada Centre and the waterfront. If I had to choose between the hotels on a subsequent visit, then it would be the Novotel, but only because the location was better for us. Both hotels were great and I would recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton while on a business trip with a colleague. When we checked in they didnt have a room available for us even though it had been reserved and paid for in advance. We waited almost an hour. When we got to our room the cards didnt work and had to go back down to reception to have them fixed. The reception staff seemed to look down on us as we were not your "typical business travelers" The bathroom was not clean, stains in the toilet and the bath tub. Towels were old and grungy. There was an accident in our room as my colleague was ill. They said they couldnt do anything about the mess in the room until morning. It was only 9 pm. After phoning house keeping 3 times and management 2 times we were finally able to change rooms. This room had not even been cleaned by housekeeping and it was probably better to stay in the first room. I definitly wouldnt stay here again , nor would I advise anyone else to!

Reviews.Title: “Read this if you have status with Hilton”
Reviews.Author: prodmngr
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Hilton is a good hotel. Here are the reasons and some tips. 1.) Good upgrades to the exec floor if you are gold or better with Hilton 2.) Free coctails and snacks, including sushi, from 4-7PM nightly, including weekends, in the executive lounge (must be A hilton honors gold or better member) 3.) Hotel is connected to the PATH. This is a huge underground mall and walkway that connects seemingly all of Toronto. 4.) Access to the Adelaide Health Club (ask at the executive lounge desk for passes.) Nice health club on the PATH 5.) Good and quick room service 6.) Alot of good dance clubs two blocks away. Check out Lott and Metro. You can get on the guest list from the web sites which avoids you having to wait in line.

Reviews.Title: “christmas”
Reviews.Author: jesmas
Reviews.Content: Christmas in the hilton downtown, toronto was disappointing for us.The art deco design gave the feeling that the hotel was unfinished ( not grand at all!) Only one of the hotels 3 restaurants was open on christmas day and this was only for a set menu which my 2 children would not have eaten. We were only told this after spending a fab day at niagara falls building up an appetite. We had to have room service and eat in the room. The coffee shop was not open for the whole 4 days we spent there. Some friends of ours came to the hotel to meet us on the day of arrival and as they don't drink alcohol we could not offer them a drink in the hotels lobby. The rooms were average size and there was no entertainment in the evening. We chose the Hilton because we spent last Christmas in the Berlin Hilton and were treated fabulously, but i'm afraid this Hilton did not come any where near.

Reviews.Title: “Canadian Cool!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton in Downtown Toronto whilst visiting friends and it was excellent! The hotel is perfectly situated in central Toronto. It is linked to the underground PATH system, which is particularly useful during the bitter winter months! It's just a few minutes walk from the CN Tower and the Air Canada Centre (where the Toronto Raptors and Toronto Maple Leafs play their home games) The hotel itself is metropolitan chic. The rooms are large and clean. The views from the window are stunning whichever direction you face out on. And the scenic lift is worth a ride if only for the view. The staff are really friendly and efficient. On the first night I had to complain that we didn't have any tea/coffee making facility and within 20 minutes we had a coffee maker delivered to our door and were given a full tutorial on how to use it!! The hotel really made our trip. To read more about what we got up to, or to see pics of our holiday visit my boyfriend's website www.neilstudd.com Linda.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: J_M_S_Toronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of hosting our wedding reception at the Tundra Restaurant, Toronto Hilton, in December 2005. We also stayed overnight as guests at the hotel. It was 5-star luxury accomodation and service from beginning to end. I would like to thank the staff of the Toronto Hilton Hotel, in particular Stefan Bauer and Ben Chiu, for providing such excellent service and attention to detail for our wedding reception. The food at Tundra was spectacular, the setting was gorgeous and elegant and we were thrilled with the event. The hotel room itself was large and comfortable, with a great view of downtown Toronto. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling on business, vacationing in the fine city of Toronto, or anyone who desires first-class service and accomodation. And especially, I would recommend the Toronto Hilton to anyone who is planning any kind of event-conference, corporate dinner, wedding or dinner reception, etc- please consider the Toronto Hilton. It was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a great time with the staff, everyone was very friendly. Rooms were very clean. Tundra restaurant was a little pricey, though the food was excellent. However, the best part of the trip was the bartender in Barrister's, Yul. Funny, charming, and quite attractive. He has a number of magic tricks and brain-teasers to keep you occupied as well. Definitely stop by to meet this character. Hotel is nearby to some great shopping (Eaton Center, The Bay, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AJSG
Reviews.Content: My family and I (husband & 2 teenaged sons) stayed 1 night . We were in town for the Raptors Game. We were happy with the hotel. We booked the room on Hilton's web page for $119.00 Cdn, we found that to be very reasonable for downtown Toronto. Only complaint is that the beds were not very comfotable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good standard, however”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1802
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton was o.k. I had a very cheap rate and therefore was put into the room next to the elevator. Expected some more noise, but it was not a problem. Rooms are very big and nicely furnished. The only point I have is that the bathroom was not 100 %clean. Some more attention should be put to this fact. The lobby and the restaurants are very good and can be recommended. Location is perfect with easy access to Yonge Street etc. To the airport it takes around 40 minutes by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The following are concerns I had about our room: 1) Bed was very uncomfortable. 2) There was a dirty coffee filter in the coffee maker 3) The bed pillow smelled of perfume 4) When I rolled over in bed I found a blue hair elastic 5) There was lime build up in the shower. 6) The bathroom towel was extremely frayed. Go to the Sheraton accross the street. Much better.

Reviews.Title: “has it's good points!”
Reviews.Author: Tenny-Two
Reviews.Content: If you can ignore the mould growing around the bath tub and rust stains near the taps, the rest of the hotel is good. Large room, good sized bath. However no inroom safe. hairdryer adequate. Hot water is shower is dependant on who else in the area is using hot water. Tundra and Barrister's both good and well priced ( for Toronto) Centrally located. Nice pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is really a terrific hotel. I had an executive room which may be different from standard rooms (though my impression was that the rooms were the same, it was just a little more expensive but had access to the Lounge). Very modern decorations, not to my taste as it's a little cold, but still very well done. Great amenities - the shower is terrific, free wireless access, the lounge with free drinks and free breakfast is great of course and very attractive. Excellent views of the city, conveniently located. Quiet, clean, comfortable and the staff were very nice, very accommodating. The glass elevator is pretty cool as well...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: drcahughes
Reviews.Content: the hilton is in a great location, close to the osgoode subway stop. the rooms are clean and nicely decorated with contemporary furnishings. we had no complaints during our stay and would recommend this hotel - especially given a priceline deal of $75 a night.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel....but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: RSVPTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton saturday, Aug 27-29. Nothing spectacular about the hotel. Rooms were good, nothing stood out. Location was good, close to the sheration and winston churchill statue..park. Staff was very helpful. The pool area was very nice. Centrally located hotel. Scenic elevator.. Oh..The bartender (asian guy) in the Barrister was delightful...he makes the best Martini. The menu choices was tempting. I had the curry chicken in a baked bread bowel...mouthwatering. OK, perhaps better than I thought. The main restaurant provides buffet breakfast for $20. BBQ is served at the pool during summer months. OK..............The hotel was very good, but not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice upscale urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: delmarvamom
Reviews.Content: The decor is very modern and clean-lined throughout. It has a very upscale feel. The room was nice with beautiful bathroom, decent size with a nice bar area. The beds are basic. If you like a soft bed, you may not like these. The bed was the only thing I found average. The pool was nice with a big deck and comfortable lounges. It is both indoor and outdoor. One side is about 25 meters, so if you swim for exercise you could swim laps. There is also a hot tub. The staff was very pleasant and the concierge was helpful. Since we had no complaints they were not put to the test. Overall a nice place for both leisure or business. It has a more business feel, but we enjoyed it as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Terrible”
Reviews.Author: travelsmart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at the Toronto Hilton and were suprised at the poor service and upkeep of the hotel. We are Diamond members and typically have good experiences at Hilton. This time was very different. The Hotel itself is VERY Worn and tired. Our room had paint peeling. The bed was very uncomfortable and the towels were dirty. My wife noticed makeup on the hand towels. The carpet was very worn as well, in fact in the halls it is all bunched up with slack. The service was terrible. We called for extra pillows - noone ever showed up. Then we called for room service - Again, noone ever showed up. The executive lounge was way understaffed. You could not find a clean table to sit at. We ended up going to the restaurant for breakfast because they could not keep any food available in the lounge. We had a hard time getting anyone to wait on us downstairs in the Tundra restaurant. We ended up getting our breakfast off the buffet and then almost finished before we were asked if we wanted any juice or coffee. The location is good, of course so is the Sheraton Centre across the road which is so much nicer. Oh well, we are off to stay at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton tomorrow which we have heard such wonderful things about. I'm sure Hilton will be a favorite in our eyes again - just not the Toronto Hilton.....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: CaptDoug
Reviews.Content: Location, amenities, staff attitude, cleanliness: all outstanding and typical for a Hilton in a major city. The only drawback we found - minor annoyance to a chosen few - was that parking is only for cars. Our vehicle would not fit into their garage and no provisions are made for those with SUV's. Ample space is evident for curbside valet, but nothing was offered. This will only be a minor inconvenience to those with large vehicles, but there is an outdoor lot 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Opaline
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a two-night getaway from the kids and had a great visit at the Hilton. Our check-in was delayed, room was not ready on time but didn't have to wait too long and we ended up in a larger corner room with a view of the CN Tower. The hotel is in great shape as it has been recently renovated. The location is convenient to everything!! Theaters, Eaton Center, China Town, Kensington Market, Skydome, you name it! Everything is within walking distance. If you don't like to walk the subway station is just a block away. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a business trip and must say it is really top notch. Lobby and restaurants/bars are gorgeous with reasonable prices and great food, the rooms are very clean, average size but tastefully decorated. The hotel is well situated, especially when the new opera house opens across the street. The staff were a little rigid, but nothing that cant be overlooked since the overall product was so great. I would definately recommend this hotel, especially one of the high floor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto - Wonderful City for a Family!”
Reviews.Author: prmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I (my husband, myself, and our two boys, ages 7 and 11) visited Toronto from July 17-24, 2005. What a great trip!! The downtown Hilton was excellent, and was within walking distance of the SkyDome (saw a Blue Jays game!) and the CN tower, the Hockey Hall of Fame and several delightful places to eat (the Baton Rogue is great with kids, and offers the best ribs around!). Ninety minutes to Niagra Falls, so that was a great side trip as well. Toronto Zoo is HUGE! Canada's Wonderland is similar to Six Flags and that is worth a trip as well. We had one of the best vacations we ever had, and I would recommend this city and this hotel to anyone (especially anyone how has boys who love sports!)

Reviews.Title: “No honors for Gold Card”
Reviews.Author: nesbytes
Reviews.Content: Arrrived with son @front desk. Robert, the clerk, told us room not ready. Came back to front desk periodically over the course of an hour. Finally, told room still not ready but we were being assigned a room on 20th floor. Asked if this was executive floor. Told no double bedded rooms available on Executive floor. Ultimately assigned a room on 12th floor. Asked for access to executive lounge. Told not available. Offered to forgo upgrade and pay for a room on executive floor. After much key pounding and conferences in back room told no double bedded rooms available on executive floor. Asked to speak with manager. Manager arrived to tell us (a) no double bedded rooms available on executive floor and (b) executive lounge not made available to mere gold card members. The manager ("Walter") then said his paying customers would feel "jilted" (I'm not making this up) if they found the lounge crowded with people who had been upgraded. Went to our room(very utilitarian with a mattress having all the comfort of what my son reffered to as thin sliced salami) called HHonors and was told that there were multiple double bedded rooms available on executive floor. Only when confronted with this information and a threat to make a phone reservation with HHonors did "Walter" agree to let us purchase a room on executive floor...but no upgrades. I hate being lied to. I would go out of my way to not stay here again. The good news?? Ritz Carlton is allegedly opening a facility in Toronto in the very near future. On a final note, the valet parking would not park our car because it was a Yukon and then, when told that the concierge had indicated that the front desk would stamp our parking ticket for free parking, Robert on the front desk stated that the concierge was "mistaken". One positive: The executive lounge staff was gracious and accomodating and the beds on the executive level were far, far more comfortable than those first offered to us.
